I stayed for 4 nights.The bellmen were helpful in holding my bags while my room was being readied. They also asked me each time I departed if I needed a car or help with transportation. The front desk greeted me each time I returned. A man cleaning the elevator was friendly and welcoming and insisted on stopping his task until my ride was complete. There was also another man putting down a fresh mat near the elevator prior to the start of a rain storm. He also greeted me and insisted on starting his task after I was on my way, even when I told him I was not in a rush and would wait. I’m sorry I didn’t get their names. The pride of the staff maintaining the hotel was evident, with everything looking fresh each day. Bibi left my room spotless each day, leaving a handwritten note thanking me for staying in your hotel. I was fortunate to briefly meet her on my last day before checking out and thank her in person. The hotel may have a recognized name of a large corporation, and while the name may be important to some, it is the people, not the brand, who make any organization a success. The staff should be cited for their dedication and pride... it was noticed and appreciated. I will be returning to this hotel on my next trip to Manhattan.

This hotel is much better described as "adequate" than "exceptional". It's very clean with friendly staff and in a great location, but nothing really stands out. The standard rooms feel like shoeboxes, so it'll be well worth your while to upgrade if you can. It can get a bit noisy with doors slamming and people talking and clomping through the halls, but the staff are always more than willing to move you to a different room. The food and drinks are all right, but again, nothing to write home about. Great place to stay for business travelers and those who will be on the go and experiencing the city, rather than relaxing in the room and milling about the hotel.

If you are looking for a hotel that has preeminent service, plush beds, and cultivated staff, the Sheraton Tribeca is your best bet in New York City. The location is perfect for those who want easy access to the Holland Tunnel and located right next to the Canal Street Subway Station. All of New York is yours within minutes. Checking in was simple and a breeze. We opted for a room for a balcony/deck that allowed us to enjoy cocktails and NY pizza purchased from a local restaurant. If you can, purchases and upgraded room with club level access to enjoy complimentary beer and wine with choice appetizers. The breakfast provided in the lounge was excellent as well. The lounge attendant was quite knowledgable on local places to eat, drink and attend while visiting the city. He was very personable. There is a great fitness facility on the second floor which was cleaned daily. I noticed it being cleaned the same time both days of my stay. There were up-to-date cardio machines and weights along with the Sheraton Fitness branded tips. We ate some light food and drank cocktails at their Antica Ristorante which has an excellent assortment of beers. The service was fast, efficient and offered delicious foods for anyone. This is definitely a great hotel in a fantastic location.

I stayed here over Memorial Weekend and overall had a great stay. The hotel staff was very friendly and provided very good service. The hotel rooms while small, were clean and still very comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent, right near several subway lines and near plenty of restaurants. The one thing that I did not like was how you can hear everything in the hallway from your hotel room.

I stayed here for my wife's 50th birthday for 3 nights in May 2019. Overall excellent. I was contacted in advance by Andrianis M - one of the reception team. Her service from start to finish exceeded our expectations. The rest of the staff were also excellent. Our room was clean and comfortable with am Amazing view. Credit to the 21st floor team - very efficient and helpful. We were recommended this hotel by a friend who has used it many times simply due to service , location and price. The location is great. Situated mid downtown it gives great access to all the stuff you might wish to visit. Canal subway 2 mins walk. Fantastic Italian just next to subway entrance ( bellman's recommendation ) There is a private bar on the 21st floor with roof terrace where you get comp beer and wine between 5pm and 7pm. You can also have breakfast up there too. Defiantly worth joining. all in all - well done and thanks - Tribeca team

I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca in room 2207 from May 9th to May 18th 2019. I had a very positive experience. With such a long stay, I sprung for their 'Club Level' package; so my room was on a higher, (actually the highest), floor. Which was great if you're as sensitive to noise as I am. (This is NYC people - pack some ear-plugs! Or download a white-noise app.) The bathroom had the GREAT addition of a magnification mirror on the side wall. The toiletries were ample & of decent quality. The water pressure & temp remained at a consistent level throughout my morning showers. There was a full-length mirror just outside the bathroom. In addition to the chair at the work-desk, there was a very comfy lounging chair with ottoman in my room, (such a great touch!). Every single Sheraton employee who I had dealings with, or even a short encounter with, was terrific. (This was a bit of a shock to me...) The Club Level breakfast offerings were ok, (though the scrambled eggs weren't very good, unless I used a lot of ketchup!). I really liked their addition of sauteed onions along with the sausage. There were three options of cold cereals and an ample variety of breads, muffins, and pastries, etc.. Also, plenty of coffee, water, juices, and even soda. For the evening offerings, there were basic noshes - crackers & tortilla chips, one kind of cheese cubes, and then one kind of luncheon-meat (rolled up). Also a pasta salad. They served several wines & beers. (Also, they had a cash-bar in the Club room, if you wanted to have hard liquor as well.) I'm not much of a drinker; so I mostly just enjoyed the breakfasts and then the viewing deck for the Club Level upgrade. The Sheraton Tribeca is VERY well situated with short walks between four (4!) subway lines that I used every single day of my stay - such a great location for public transit. I can think of two areas for improvement - the lighting in the bathroom was on the dim-side. And, the in-room coffee maker was a bit of a spitter.... After the first cup of coffee, I made sure and kept a washcloth handy to contain the water leaks/spurts.

I booked this hotel because of I spg member & closed to the tour bus location which about 8 blocks from the hotel.the room is average. the room the gave me with an unplesant view of airconditiong unit.

Sheraton Tribeca does it right. They treat Marriott elite members very well, and they have a great location with a great lounge. Not a lot to hate about the Tribeca, rooms are always clean and fresh. Can be pricey, but well worth the price. This is my go to hotel for SoHo/Tribeca areas.

What a terrible experience I had staying at this hotel. When we first checked in the counter staff were disinterested and unhelpful. They were barely responsive to any enquiries we had. Halfway during our stay the hot water went out, which granted, happens in older buildings in winter. However, it took two days to fix and we were never notified if it was fixed. We called repeatedly to tell them that the water was not fixed and we got a curt reply of: "oh you have to run it for awhile" and after informing them that we had done it for a few minutes they said it had not been fixed. This would have been fine if it happened once but we tried several times over the course of two days and each time we mentioned it we were given the exact same reply. On checking out we were told that there were no extra charges to be paid, again in a disinterested and curt manner, but then received a charge the next day on our credit card and trying to find out what the charge was about was like pulling teeth. I will never stay at this hotel again and it is a shame to the sheraton and Marriott brand.

My stay was ok and the hotel is decent, if not a little dated. But, I was astonished that I could not get a cup of coffee before 7am and to make matters worse they ran out of coffee for the in room coffee makers! I was told to “go next door” if I wanted coffee before 7am.

The staff here is amazing, second to none. At the front desk, Sal and Felitta are warm and welcoming, taking care of all our needs and very helpful with dinner and events going on in the area. Also in the front desk area, Eddie is extremely helpful helping out with all logistics. In the concierge lounge, Deon carries a great conversation and brings a big smile every day; Steve is also great, greeting visitors with a smile and making us feel welcome; Josh is also excellent, keeping the lounge meticulously clean and is warm and welcoming as well. Overall, this is a 5-star hotel with a great management team (too many to mention) and I look forward to returning whenever I'm in the Big Apple. #greatbrand

This hotel is an excellent choice for business or pleasure. The staff is second to none, and make every effort to accommodate any request. I had several business needs that were handled timely and professionally. The following specific staff members went out of their way to assist and accommodate: Kayleen Solano, Andrew Nkunku, Mai Garcia, Eddie Espinal. Thanks to each of you! This hotel is in an ideal location, is well kept and very clean.

We had a King Room then we were offered a Club Room for just $18.00 with the breakfast and evening drinks and apps. This was an easy upgrade. The room was great no problem. The only downside with New York is parking. $75.00. If I didn't get a good deal on the room I would have stayed in New Jersey. Picture is a view from the club room

After the worlds worst travel day, my pregnant wife became extremely ill during the middle of the night. We didn’t have any provisions with us in the room so we called the front desk at 3am and “Fast Eddie” came to our rescue hand-delivering juice and a sleeve of crackers. My wife was so overwhelmed she started crying in thanks. That’s the type of customer service that brings people back.

This was my first stay at this property. I was in NYC for 3 days only and needed a mini getaway. I booked the Club Level king room and I definitely do not regret it. It is pricier than the regular room. However, it does have it perks. High floor, partial view of the river. The room was smaller than expected, but we didn't spend much time in there, so it's okay.one of the perks of Club Level is breakfast + happy hour is included. They have a lounge for Club Levels that can access 24/7 for free water + soda/pop. When I went to happy hour, they had alcohol, appetizers (not amazing, but still decent) I was on the 22nd floor (highest) and it was pretty quiet. room was clean, bathroom was decent size and clean. It did what it suppose to do. Sleep through the night and enjoy NYC outside. Amazing location , right by ACE Canal station (2 min walk) or NQR Canal Station, about 5-7mins walk . McDonalds close by if you're desperate --Chinatown was around the corner and got a foot massage from all that walking. Took uber once, due to the fact it was late a night. Every staff I encounter was really great. I am a Marriott Memeber, so free wifi and their app is really great to use -- live chat are available. I will definitely visit this property again.

My husband and I recently stayed at the Sheraton TriBeCa, which I booked due to good reviews and close proximity to a concert venue for a concert we were seeing (City Winery). We were quickly greeted by staff ready to valet our car, which we happily did. It was expensive ($65/night), but it was worth the cost to us. If you want to pay less you could probably find a cheaper garage closeby. We were all about the convenience.The lobby is lovely, and the front desk staff was very friendly. Our room was on the 4th floor. It was a very nice room, actually quite spacious by NYC standards. The bathroom was also nice and spacious. We were facing the very busy canal street and it was LOUD. I wonder if a higher floor would result in less noise. It wasn't that awful, but some might be bothered by it.The free WiFi was no good. If you want good WiFi you have to pay. I just used my data and it was fine. We weren't in the room that much so it really didn't matter.There is daily breakfast for a fee which we didn't do. The location of this hotel is really great, whether you're spending most of your time downtown, or anywhere in the city. The subways are everywhere. That's how we got around when we weren't walking. The only issue with walking in the area is the multitude of street vendors selling bags. It's hard to get down the crowded sidewalks, especially as you approach Chinatown. It's also not the prettiest part of TriBeCa. It's quite dingy and dirty and loud. However, walk a few blocks and you'll be in lovely neighborhoods. Never did I feel unsafe.We were overall quite pleased with our stay. It's not luxury but it's a good value and great location, so that's good enough for us.

I work close to this hotel and thought I would give it a try. I was staying 2 nights mid-week. I am Titanium Elite Lifetime. I requested an upgrade through app and I was told it was processed. i thought I could check in at noon as the app had sent me a notification. I was told my room wasn’t ready so I left my bags and went to work. At no point did I feel appreciated or greeted as a lifetime Marriott member, in fact it was the opposite. When I returned, I was given my room, which was on a higher floor (18) but it was not an upgrade. All I got was a shrug. I was not told where the lounge was or even if there was one. When I entered the room, the elevator sound was really loud. I called downstairs to see if I could change rooms. After a sigh and being put on hold, I was told to come downstairs to get another key. Wow, first time in a long time that has happened; normally someone would bring a key and help you move! And they weren’t that busy! And it was around 5 pm so there is no way they didn’t have other rooms available.So I went downstairs and now the attitude was hostile. I was given an identical room on the 11th floor with a filthy window - fine, I shut the shade. Point is, I got there at noon and it seems that I got put in a less desirable room , not once but twice.There were multiple other things. Noisy, people in the hallway at night trying to use their key on my door, terrible food from room service at premium prices, worn out rooms, etc. I have detailed all of this and more in an email to the front office manager when they asked for my feedback and have not heard one word. And it has been more than a month.I won’t be returning. Thank goodness there are other options in NYC.

I wouldn’t stay here again. The rooms don’t have any sound proofing—I was woken by slamming doors in the night and morning. The maid’s service only came once in my three day stay despite me scheduling them to come and the room was only a few feet bigger than the king size bed on each side.

This hotel is clean with an efficient staff, close to the subway and West Broadway. I really liked the location. You could get to most anywhere in 30 minutes or less using the subway. The front desk, while courteous, were not very welcoming or warm. Rooms were small but clean and updated. It will be hard to find a large hotel room in NYC. The club or Memeber lounge was an embarrassment. Seating was institutional, afternoon wines were terrible, and the “appetizers” reminded me a what a bunch of college boys would put out. Cheese cubes,Ritz Crackers and some vegetables. Breakfast was similar low end with a meat option, which was the worse “sausage” I have found in my travels. Maybe the club room was at this level because of the many families. The lounge on the main floor was better and if you get the happy hour drinks, reasonably priced. I’ll be back only if I can get a good rate.

My daughter and I stayed recently at the Sheraton Tribeca. Lovely hotel at a very reasonable price. The hotel is close Chinatown and Little Italy; it's also very close to Soho. Perfect location - and super easy to get to Brooklyn, too.In addition the to location, the rooms are lovely, and perhaps most importantly, the staff are wonderful. responsive, charming, and helpful. Will definitely book here again.

Had a very recent week long stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. Didn't get in until 2 am the first night and no problems with check in despite the very late arrival time. Room had a nice view of the Empire State Bldg. and was relatively quiet (always city noise) and very clean. Our room was great, not very large but its NYC and none of the hotel rooms are large. House keeping was reliable and kept the room very clean. Great location, various subway lines (the A,C,E, and N,R,Q, 2) within very easy walking distance. Canal Street had always been kind of dicey but never felt unsafe at any time. Restaurants galore within easy walking distance and across Canal Street is SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown. There's a little deli right next store to the hotel whose food was really good, bialy's bagels, etc., and a wonderful Italian restaurant named Pepolino's is right around the corner. We must've used the subway to get to and from our hotel 20x...Don't bother with Uber (we did 1x) because the traffic doesn't allow you to move from where the hotel is located in any reasonable amount of time. When we left, the hotel coordinated a ride for us to Newark Airport and that worked seamlessly. We would have no problem staying at this hotel again in the future.

Having been disappointed at a price increase at my regular NYC hotel, I got an amazing offer at the Sheraton Tribeca for a single night. This great price was complemented with great service and accommodation. Heading straight to the hotel after overnight travel from the UK, intending to drop my luggage and get lunch, I was gladly surprised to be to told I could check in early, albeit a room on a lower floor than requested, which was a brilliant compromise allowing me to wash and rest a little before tending to my business. The room was a great size, especially for hotels in Manhattan and matched by a decent sized bathroom. The room had a coffee machine available as well as good quality toiletries and even included an iron and board, a great addition, despite not using them. Although being on the second floor, the room was rather quiet and little outside noise could be heard. The staff could not have been more accommodating, offering their help and service at every opportunity. A great experience and would gladly stay here again for right price.

Despite being on busy Canal St, this hotel was great. Subway 2 minutes away.My room was big for NY standards. Comfy bed and quiet considering the area. I was on level 18 w a nice view. One porter was extra nice, sorry didn’t get his name.

We stayed in a king bed/executive level room. Whisper quiet A/C, comfy bed, excellent water pressure and temp. Room is very compact (but, it IS New York, we expected it). The club floor lounge offered 24/7: Starbucks coffee, bottled water/soda, a few snacks/granola bars. Breakfast had cereal/bagels/danish/yogurt/eggs; around 5-7, they have beer and wine plus light snacks (cheese/chips/veggies). All staff were very nice. Check in is at 3 AND they do not deviate. The reason for only 4 stars: 1. Window treatment did not offer a set of sheers. You either closed the 'black out' panel or keep the panel open for light (and no privacy). Our room's sheer assembly was broken. 2. Bath sink bowl had a 12" crack in the porcelain. We would stay here again.

The rooms are compact but very comfortable and squeaky clean, some with great views of the skyline. After staying in a few hotels that try to jazz things up with quirky features, it was nice to be in a traditional, classic hotel that offered the things that matter (excellent shower, well designed room, fast Wifi, great bedding, window that opens a few inches for fresh air). Concierge lounge offers bountiful reception at 5 p.m. seven days a week, with beautiful sunsets. Used both the hotel gym and the separate lobby elevator to Planet Fitness. Both gyms had ample equipment in good condition. Everyone working at the Sheraton Tribeca was a true pro, with tiny special requests met quickly and with a smile. The location is excellent if you plan to use the subways; easy access to the A train for JFK and three blocks from the trains that serve midtown and the upper east side. Lots of good bistros across the street in Soho. Very happy Titanium customer.

We stayed in Sheraton Tribeca on our 4 days trip to New York. We arrived around 11 am and the check in time was 3 pm. The hotel staff put our luggage in storage room & we went out to the tourist sites until the room was ready.The hotel is well located on canal street which is just a few blocks away from the world famous shopping & eating district Soho. Brooklyn bridge is only 10 mins walk from the hotel. The subway to uptown is at 2 mins walk from where you can easily take the express train which takes you to Times Square in less than 10 mins. There are a lot of train stations nearby so you can easily go to major attractions like staten island ferry for Statue of Liberty, Port authority buss terminal which takes you to Woodbury premium outlet shopping mall ( an hour away from NYC).We booked at room at 17th floor with twin beds and it was quite spacious. However, there was no minibar in the room. It had an ironing facility & a locker thou. The bathroom size is also ok. The rooms are comfortable but not very modern which does not makes much difference as in a city like New York , you only come to the hotel to sleep at night. Overall, it was a good experience , not v noisy like Times Square Sheraton . I would definitely stay here again.

Pros1. Location - I chose this hotel primarily for the location (easy access to Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown). Soho is my favorite neighborhood in New York for the high density of great shopping and food and the easy walkability, and this hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Soho.2. Comfort - The rooms are comfortable and cozy. Bed was a king size (sometimes New York hotels will default to a queen) and the room was clean. Blanket was a little thin but it was adequate.3. Good service - Staff was pleasant.Cons1. The entrance, lobby, hallway areas aren't the chicest in the four-star range. It's fine, but not great.Overall an affordable, comfortable stay with a great location!

Location isn't fantastic as it's right off Canal Street in Chinatown. Very noisy unless you're on a high floor.Room was okay in size and comfortable / clean.No real dining on site, though they have a breakfast buffet in the AM.Staff was friendly but definitely not close to a full service Sheraton.
user_name:
EA913
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my first stay at the Sheraton Tribeca and I found it to be a quality experience. It's well located near main subway lines, walkable to great food options and close to the Holland Tunnel for travel to NJ. The club lounge on the 21st floor had limited but good breakfast items, nice views, and space to work. The restaurant in the lobby is on the smaller side, but my steak was good and the staff was courteous.

I selected this hotel because of the very reasonable price and location to several subway lines. I arrived several hours before check in and the front desk took care of checking me in (room was not ready though) and storing my luggage (no charge - did tip when I picked them up). I am a Marriott Bonvoy member do they upgraded my room to include Lounge access (complimentary breakfast, snacks, coffee, waters and soft drinks). The room I stayed in on the 15th floor had a decent rooftop view looking east. Decent sized room (for NYC) with a queen bed, desk (with desk chair) and restroom. Bed was comfortable and you are able to open the window a few inches which is nice. The heat/air worked great. I left the fan on high to drown out some of the hallway noise. I will say that my room was near the bank of elevators so I did hear lots of loud conversations while others waited for access to them. The windows did a good job keeping outside noise out as you could hear a tremendous difference when you opened them.Lots of shopping in nearby Soho too - just a couple minutes walk away.Several subway lines were within a block or two that would get you to most places in a short time. I flew into LGA and it was about 55 minutes from getting in the MTA system. The lounge breakfast was simple with eggs, sausage, pastries, breads, yogurts and juices. It was a great treat if you are trying to save a few dollars on a meal to get your day started. Happy Hour - this was a very nice treat that I didn’t expect. During my stay (Saturday-Tuesday) from 5-7 each evening there was a FREE Happy our in the Club Lounge in the 21st floor. A few wine options, a few beer options and light snacks. I had a few beers each night (prior to going out for dinner) and simply tipped the gentleman that served us. Other places I ate charged $7-$10 for beer so this was a crazy good deal. It was busy each night with little room to sit. There is a rooftop area with additional seats and nice views but the temperatures were a bit chilly during my visit to linger outside.You should consider upgrading to Club access if a free happy hour, free breakfast and drinks excite you. I think if you have two in your group that could easily add a significant value to the room at the Sheraton Tribeca.Checkout was noon and the desk was happy to store luggage if you wanted to explore and come back later to retrieve the luggage.

Very rude staff, can not handle any problems decently, no empathy at all, when I complained in the morning about a dirt brown water coming from the sink and shower, front desk said it’s a city pipe issue sorry just wait, no shower, brush teerh with mineral water. Later at night got to hotel, then no hot water, front desk rude again can do nothing just wait, should offer to move us to a hotel with decent water. That means no shower again, just go some place else to get a hot clean water shower with friendly staff.
user_name:
hermannalex
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location, comfy bed. Unfortunately these are the only positive things I can say about this establishment. Upon checking in, I was not greeted and had to ask to check in. The lady had some serious attitude despite my reservation being incorrect on Sheraton's behalf (I had called to make this reservation). Two rooms were booked when I specifically asked for one room to be booked. This same disturbed lady made it seem like it was my fault for this mistake and said they will have to late cancel this room for a fee, but since I have "status" they waived the fee. No apologies were made. Unacceptable. I ordered a bottle of champagne for the room and when it was delivered it was room temperature. I asked the delivery lady if I could have a chilled bottle and she said she would "check". She did end up delivering a chilled bottle, however I had a hard time paying the already included 20% gratuity when there was no attention to detail. The morning of checkout I had a knock at the door and it was someone "just checking to see if our room was still occupied" at 10:00 am. Checkout is 12. After already being irritated at my stay, I again asked the front desk to check out. The lady just looked at me waiting for me to speak. There was no greeting, she did not acknowledge my request, but just looked at me like I was bothering her. So I just rattled off all of my info because I didn't know what she needed. These all might seem like small complaints, however for this Hotel to be considered a Marriott property, is unacceptable. Being a lifetime Gold member I have definitely had enough stays to be able to compare. I choose to stay at Marriott properties because of the great service and overall great experience, but sadly I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY. With all of the hotels in NYC and competition, a friendly greeting and professionalism at the concierge desk would greatly improve guest's experience.
user_name:
Scenic00636369783
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Carlos did a great job and deserves a 5 for finding a prefect sushi restaurant for dinner. He spent the time to figure out what I needed for my dinner event and something close enough that I wasn’t traveling for hours. He also arranged my very early airport ride which is great as Uber is having difficulties finding the hotel.Why the hotel did not get a 5 is they spent money on a remodel and the tv is still on a twisty desk stand?? It is 2019 they make movable wall mounts and who wants a tv on the side of the bed just saying it takes up desk space and is in a stupid location which is not easily seen from the bed.

The location of this hotel is great for parents visiting for NYU. We stayed on the concierge lounge level which gave us access to breakfast and later in the day, snacks and appetizers. The rooftop patio is fabulous! The views are amazing.The room was clean but the mattresses are ready for replacement. We felt safe walking around the area at night due largely in part to the police precinct located steps away. We ended up eating offsite for dinner as the dining room at the hotel was closed when we arrived at 8 PM on Sunday night. The hotel did not offer anything unique in the way of customer service or experience. Sadly, I’m not sure that I would stay again.

Besides the bartender, Chantelle, this hotel is the least desirable. We requested a king room with a city view and the room was just queen bed with a view of a water tower which was a total disappointment. (I get it, you don’t stay in the city to be in the room, but we had to pay extra for this amenity.) Anyways, the sheets on the mattress was stripping off after the first night. The valet is great, the gentlemen constantly greeting people, great. The lady who checked us in did a great job finding us a horrible room. Not only that, our stay came with breakfast because I booked through my cc, she didn’t even give us details on it. There was not even a menu or room service offered at this hotel... Strange compared to other options in the city. Chantelle, the bartender is the only thing this place has going for them... She was sweet, personable & deserves a promotion. Btw, the street noise was heard all night, even though we were on the 11th floor. I booked this place months in advance via Chase... Come on...

When I came in to stay with a friend the front desk agent that checked us in was very unprofessional and spoke to us like she was bothered to check us in. I thought her attitude might change through the check in process, no. The night staff, however, were well polished and polite, this was the night of 2/10/19. The housemen that brought up the amenities I requested was very kind. When I checked out I saw the bellman almost karate chop a guest for tapping his shoulder, it was funny but a little exaggerated at the same time. I really loved the bathroom amenities and the bed was comfortable. Work on professionalism for you staff a check-in can either make or break a stay.

I booked 2 rooms for 7 days in Feb '19 at the Sheraton Tribeca. From the moment we checked in it was apparent that this SPG hotel was substandard. Adjoining rooms were not available even though I booked these 2 rooms months in advance. Excuses were many and I was never given an option other than we had rooms ‘near’ each other. (I did ask for a suite that could accommodate 4 adults but was told they were all booked) My reservation confirmation clearly said extra towels and feather pillows. When we saw these requests were not provided, we called the front desk only to be told "no you did not request that" even though it is clearly on my reservation! Additional supplies were delivered but short 1 pillow and we were told the extra pillow would be up soon - never saw it in 7 days!! After that day we were never provided extra towels either. The elevator hallway at the lobby level is very dark and has illegal light level. We told the front desk and we were told that this is Marriott standard. It was under 10% and one of my guests is an architect who knows the regs! It was increased for a few days but lowered again later in the week. Elevators require a key to access floors and we noticed that many people had issues with their key cards allowing them floor access – we had the same issue intermittently over the 7 days. In one room (1907) we had various disappointments - one day no toilet paper another no Kleenex another no bath mat. We had a plastic drinking cup on the floor for 4 days - we left it there to see if the cleaners ever really looked. The hair on the bathroom floor (which was ours due to hair washing and drying) was never swept up. Beds were always poorly made with linens lumpy looking and bed skirts caught up in the sheets. Breakfast in the lobby on Saturday 9 Feb was cold because the Sterno pots were not lit. The waiter ,when told, quickly took off to find a way to light them and came to us to say they must have just gone out. I had already taken a picture and surprise there were no Sterno pots!This is a big health issue - needless to say we ate bread products and stayed away from the "hot" foods. The website says it has airport shuttle - well that is not true however the front desk will call a cab or limo service. I said I could do that myself. Our second room 1906 was extremely small and suffered similar issues. I am an SPG Platinum Premier Elite with Ambassador member. I obviously travel a lot. And have many SPG nights in the cities where their hotels align with my needs. I travel globally. I can say without reservation that this hotel (which is a franchise to Ascott Reit) is very poorly run and the staff under trained. Sheraton and now Marriott are allowing this franchise to diminish their brand. All a hotel can offer, after a bed to sleep in, is SERVICE. Not everything can be perfect all the time however staff can respond to issues in a way that underscores that quality and service are job ONE. This hotel is just OK - nothing special, just an older and dated facility with staff that are not engaged or excited about working there. The club floor food is very poor (try the Hyatt Grand Central for a good Club Level experience) The staff we met over 7 days did not even try to enhance our stay. My Ambassador did try to connect with me by phone 2 times but I choose not to call back because this was a problem too big to be fixed by one call from Corporate. So bottom line is I will not be back to this location and I will return to the Hyatt Grand Central as my NYC hotel. SOHO was great and a nice change from Midtown but like hotel rooms in NYC there are also many cabs in NYC. Next time I will pay for cabs to SOHO and stay in a hotel that will offer superior service to their valued members.

I was visiting a family member and needed a place to stay. Was very pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel was - clean and comfortable, very friendly staff and with a nice little gym and a cute bar on the first floor. The king size bed was clean and comfortable tho the room was on the small side, it was all we needed and just fine with bit of city view. We will return. Great value!

Came to New York for a friends birthday and it was also mine and my partners first time. This hotel was so amazing and everyone was so sweet and professional and went out of our way to make sure we were OK if we ever need anything. We will definitely be coming back to New York and will only stay here.

I appreciated being recognized as a Marriott Platinum Elite at check in. The desk agent struggled to get me an upgraded room. My first room was so small, there was barely room to walk around the bed. After going back down I was offered a handicapped room, which I took. It was sufficiently larger than the first room. The bed was very clean and comfortable I was given breakfast in the restaurant as well as lounge access. I would recommend the lounge breakfast over the restaurant. The lounge breakfast was not just a continental breakfast as I was told, but also included hot food. The restaurant food wasn't great, and the buffet was quite sad looking. Service was lackluster the two times I was there. The service at the lounge was much more welcoming than the restaurant.

My friends and I were coming to this hotel for our friends birthday. A member of the bell team, Raul came to our room and let us go up to the 21st floor and take pictures with all our friends. Amazing hospitality and would definitely recommend for the future!!!!! BEST TIME EVER

Stayed overnight for 24 hrs just to get away. Was upgraded to an Empire State Building view. You can walk Chinatown and Little Italy from the hotel. Value for money: Excellent! I paid $116 all-in. The kind front desk person (Jennifer) was so kind and gave me a drink ticket per my SPG status. Cleanliness: Perfect! Housekeeping is really top-notch. Other tips: It’s just a few blocks from the Canal street subway stop. There’s an Italian restaurant in the lobby but with so much good food within blocks I did not try it. The toiletries were just ok. Two free bottles of water were in the room.

The location of the hotel is perfect - between Soho and Tribeca with all the trendy shops and restaurants in walking distance. The Canal Street subway station is only 100 meters away.Clean and spacey rooms, friendly staff, free wifi - everything was perfect.

On this particular visit I checked in early and was told that my upgrade was not ready by the very welcoming Front Desk Associate Precious. She told me that I should check in the mid-afternoon to make the switch. The room I was assigned, 1212, suited my purposes. So I made no call to the Front Desk. However one of the other FDA, Carlos, made many calls to my room to let me know that the room was available for the switch. I was either out of my room or was sleeping very soundly in the very comfortable in Room 1212. I just wanted to rely how the above two Associates go out of their way to make sure that guests staying at the Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel get the best service ever. This is why this remains my hotel of choice when staying in New York City
user_name:
bmckaneyiii
New Hyde Park, New York

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff. Good soundproofing, important in NYC. Again, blocks from all that lower Manhattan has to offer - shopping, restaurants. Clean. Have stayed 3 or 4 times and will do so again! The club lounge has great views, hearty breakfast, and nice outdoor patio, though we didn't go outside in January! Probably fantastic in the summer.

You need to ask for the Club level. It’s so very worth the few extra bucks! Deon is so helpful. I would recommend, the Club level. The front fest is very helpful and attentive! You couldn’t ask for better guest services, from tooth brushes, to blankets. They are on the spot!

The lounge was one of the better ones I've ever been to as a SPG Platinum. It was really really really solid. The hotel was located in a solid spot, was clean, and exactly what you are looking for in a sheraton! The customer service was really strong despite having a small blip in the radar. I was only here for about 8 hours with a layover from EWR

We enjoyed this hotel very much! the club lounge is just beautiful. It has a rooftop seating area that has incredible views of the city! We were moving our daughter into her apartment there and this was a great place to hang out for a snack and a glass of wine every day after the heavy lifting! This will be our new go-to place when we visit. Well done!

We are 8 nights into a 12 night stay and I love it here. The staff we have dealt with are great (thanks Sal for your excellent welcome and your continued smile whenever we see you and to Deon in the lounge just fabulous) Its comfortable, clean and friendly here, on level 20 so have a great view (I know not everyone will have that - but its worth it). Yes the club lounge can get crowded (I am sure in summer when you can sit in the large outdoor area it is quite different) but we have never not gotten a hot breakfast and plenty of coffee. The amenities are good, we only like house keeping every second day, but have never failed to have a call in the early evening to check if we needed anything. Love the location, easy access to trains, entertaining locals and food everywhere. Some people seem to have either not researched or be expecting 6 star facilities in a 4 star hotel. Get a grip people - the Sheraton Tribeca is fabulous for the price, I am travelling with my partner at the moment but it is somewhere I would happily stay by myself (so I feel safe here) . The staff wish us a great day when we go out (whilst checking if we need anything) and always have a welcome back when we come in - its so welcoming.Keep up the great work guys, would come back any time I visit NY xx

Clean and comfy rooms with friendly and accommodating staff! Very nice ambiance and one of the nicest hotels that are pet friendly in NYC. It was hard trying to find a nice hotel that was not super strict with their pet policy (most were 1 dog max under 15lbs or cost up to $100 extra a night). They did not give a us a hard time at all and even supplied us with extra blankets.The hotel is in a great location surrounded by cute restaurants and wine bars. Just a couple minutes from several subway stops as well.Overall, excellent experience and I’d definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC. Thanks for making me and my fur babies comfortable for the holidays!

I had an amazing stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. Upon arrival, I was immediately greeted by Prescious and Sal. Their warm greetings, stellar customer service, knowledge, and efficiency made my stay exceptional! Because of them, I look forward to staying at the Sheraton Tribeca during my business travel to NYC.Amazing job Precious & Sal!
user_name:
jaybrown90
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: So, I’m writing this review as we are actually here at the hotel and I have to say that I didn’t expect much before we arrived however the hotel and staff has been fantastic.As I’m travelling with my family including children there are some very basic needs that we have and so far nothing has been too difficult to deal with for the staff from helping us ordering food to changing rooms for us to something with a nice view.5 stars from our family.Thank you to all staff at Sheraton Tribeca.

The location is handy enough with relatively easy access to subway, Short walk to Chinatown and across the road into Soho, but Canal street itself is not amazing, quite a lot of touts and a lot of loiterers along the street, definitely not the best street in New York. Also not near any of the tourist spots even though not hard to get to them on subway. Hotel itself is only just ok, beds are good enough, rooms are small servicing is a bit hit and miss with team and coffee and sugar etc not reliably replaced every day. No fridge in room, although they will bring one of you request. Lifts get crammed in the morning and trying to use the stairs is a nightmare and I discovered the bottom one of the fire exits is stacked with supplies, a huge hazard if there was a fire. When I pointed this out to a front desk staff member I was told that I shouldn’t have been down there, when I told her that wasn’t the point and that they should clear it out or get a FDNY Report she sarcastically told me to have a nice day. NOT ACCEPTABLE at all.Overall I would suggest there are likely to be better options and I would have expected better from a Sheraton brand, they seem to have slipped a lot.

I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable this hotel was. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the rooms were sensibly laid out. I always prefer a glass shower over the shower/tub combo and this hotel had a nice shower. The views from the lounge were amazing. The hotel is in a nice area that has less tourists than many parts of NYC. There were many nice dining options walking distance from the hotel. I would stay here again.

This hotel is very near the business district and is very easy to get around from. The entire hotel and room was very clean and is what you would expect from a Sheraton brand hotel. You really won't need to get hotel breakfast anymore because you can just walk outside and enjoy famous New York City delights like bagels and pizza and all other really good food.

Average hotel standard expected of a Sheraton brand but disappointed at facilities.Lobby area small and can get congested. Breakfast expensive and limited selection. Bedroom comfortable and staff helpful especially when requested late checkout.

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca New York four nights in early December 2018. As for the hotels location I can’t imagine being in a better position, 2 MTA subways within a couple of minutes walk which made it so easy to get around and virtually every major attraction was accessible ueasily within a short time. lots of local eateries, 15-20 walk to the World Trade Center and the 911 Memorial. As for the hotel itself it was a pleasure to stay in such a lovely, clean and well presented hotel and the views are great, especially the view from the club room, that is what dreams are made of. I would like to take this opportunity to complement the club room staff in particular Deon in the evening his local knowledge, caring and friendly disposition, attentive service and good humor made the evenings we spent there an absolute delight. He must surely be one of the hotels greatest attributes. Thanks to all the staff for helping to make our New York visit such a wonderful experience. I couldn’t recommend this hotel more. Best regards Peter D Brisbane Australia.

The Pros-Location convenient for where I needed to be for work -Bed was comfortable The Cons-Room service run by a third party. Tried to pre-order breakfast in the morning but the order never came. Called room service to ask the status and the girl who answered had difficulty understanding what I needed. She came up to the room to try to resolve the matter but still did not seem to understand. Was a strange situation. Ultimately, had to cancel breakfast all together. Hotel tried to offer free coffee but was in a rush at that point. -Hotel bill charges were very confusing to understand and even after calling did not understand at all what they chargedWill not stay here again. Not worth the nuisances especially for work travel when things must run smoothly

Convenient location but several issues: 1. Could not locate my reservation, despite me providing the reservation number and it shows in the app (waited 20 minutes and was late for meeting), 2. A/C comes on (heat) every 4-5 minutes and is deafening, 3. Bed sheet not clean, major stains and 4. $550 per night for all this.... Not my first choice in Manhattan and I would recommend to look for a better rate - I had to book on short notice.

We stayed here for a few nights in late August 2018 when moving our kid into her NYC dorm. We arrived at 10pm with 2 cars packed to the hilt with her stuff to move into college. The valet parking was awesome, and the hotel employees were fantastic with taking everything out of our back seats and up to our room. (I did not want to leave items in the back seat overnight for fear the car would be broken into in the parking garage.) Again the staff was awesome with helping to bring all that stuff back from our room to the car out front the next day. The hotel was very busy and I could see that many other families were accomplishing the same task with their kid. The room was clean, and the beds were awesome. There is no negative thing I can state about this hotel except that we were unable to get the in-room mini-fridge I requested in our reservation, to store insulin, but an ice maker was on our floor and we brought a mini cooler- so it turned out okay

I recently had a stay booked and prior to my arrival the day before, I received a text saying my card was authorized for a random amount by the hotel that did not match my reservation confirmation. I did not book an advanced purchase rate so I was puzzled as to why my card had been authorized when I wasn't scheduled to arrive until the next day. I called the hotel and spoke to someone named "Sal" who reported that no matter what rate you book, it is the hotel's policy to authorize 1 night stay prior to arrival. This is mentioned no where on their website nor in my confirmation email. He was very rude and kept repeating that this is their policy when I informed him it was not okay as this was not mentioned to me at all nor on their site / confirnation. I later learned this was a lie. I asked to speak with a manager and he said he was the manger. I also later learned he had lied again. He was not helpful at all and told me to take up my issue with corporate. I called Marriott and the lady said this policy is incorrect and no where did she see this policy nor was it in my conformation. She escalated this to her manager as she wanted an investigation into this "made up" policy and apologized for the unacceptable charge / error. We didn't even know what the total amount unauthorized was for because there is no invoice or confirmation stating the random amount he charged my card. The next day upon check in, my card was charged AGAIN for the 1 night but this time the amount matched what was on my confirmation!!!! I was only paying for 1 night but because my card was charged twice, I spent over 900 for a mediocre hotel room. If my card had not been authorized without my consent the day before, I would not have had double charges on my credit card. They are completely unprofessionally and it's a scam. The quality of the hotel is equivalent to a 2 star hotel , not 4 star and for the headache of scamming your credit card, it's best to stay elsewhere. I will NEVER stay here again and definitely not another Sheraton property ever. Sal doesn't deserve my business and Sheraton TriBeCa is not worth it if this is the low level of professionalism I must deal with before, during, and after vacation. There are better quality hotels with much better customer service around the corner.

So torn on this place. Area out front is rough & trashy, though inside super elegant and nice. It’s a bigger hotel for the area though standard rooms are typical NYC & tiny with abt a foot between walls/bed/counter- no drawers. Staff is super nice. I had room preferences on my account t and booking request to not be near the elevators that apparently didn’t transfer as when I checked in I was a foot off the elevators. Went down and asked for that to be fixed and specifically requested “the quietest room you can give me” - - moved away from elevators promptly- yay! seemed great where they put me but in the morning there was a shrill screeching sound every 45 seconds from abt 5:45 am to 11 am when I left for the day. So maybe water-Pipe related?? Unbelievably loud! Room cleaning was weird as a cup of water with coffee ground was left out and 1/2 toiletries weren’t refilled. Otherwise bed was comfy... just lots of other stuff off

Check in staff were not as friendly as all the other places we traveled around the U.S. We had to ask all the questions about the Club privileges or about getting a map of the area. We booked a twin room on the club level which comes with privileges (breakfast & happy hour). There were too many people booked in club rooms and the actual refreshment/breakfast room does not cater for the amount of people. We only had breakfast on the first 2 days then couldn’t be bothered waiting for a seat or for the food to be refilled preferring to eat out. If a basic room with no breakfast was available at a cheaper price it would have been more worth it. Happy hour in the afternoon was the biggest disappointment with a couple of bowls of corn chips some dips and carrot sticks. Having these privileges at other hotels I’ve stayed at, this was pretty embarrassing we only attended once.I would stay in the area again but probably not here.Room was a little outdated but quite spacious by NY Standards.The location was great. Close to Soho shopping, Little Italy & Chinatown.Subway was close, area felt safe. Great rooftop with amazing views.

Marriott Platinum Premier. In NYC for Thanksgiving. Had booked the rooms because of location was a bit wary due to some of the reviews. However the rooms were clean and spacious and the lounge was good as well. The one thing could use improvements is the staff interactions. I had booked multiple rooms under my mine and others names and called the Marriott reservations number and the actual hotel to make sure that we were good to go but when they arrived earlier than I did they were told they couldn't check in until I arrived - has never been a problem at other Marriott properties. Finally, when I checked out I was double charged for the rooms during my stay which the GM fixed after I had to follow up with them. Long story short - you'll be in a good location with clean rooms, but might have to deal with some hurdles due to the staff.

If you have business or pleasure in TriBeCa this is a good option. A solid, reliable choice with no frills but one that does the basics well. There is not much at the hotel apart from the room, but the room is done well with a super comfortable bed, big shower and (in my case only maybe) an amazing view of the NYC skyline. The staff were efficient and friendly. Recommended as a no frills solid choice in this area.

My friend and I stayed at Sheraton Tribeca 2nd visit and she is a SPG member. I had better experience on my 1st visit in 2015. Stayed 15 to 17 Nov and again 21-28 Nov. I do not recall small rooms in Sheraton and was surprised how small, dark the room was. There were little bathroom amenities - tiny bottles, tiny soap and plastic disposal plastic cups! Where is the environment friendly, save the earth program under Marriott or Starwood?If you have plans to store luggage more than 24 hours, be prepared that only Sheraton Tribeca policies - not allowed. Its because of Security reasons but more so because they do not have space to store. Storage of luggage only for early checkin and after you checked out but on a late flight.Our return on 21 Nov, front desk informed they notice we stay a week and is giving us a larger room! That was nice if only it is true. It was no different from the room we stayed on 15th Nov. There were no bedroom slippers and no luggage stand. We only received it after 3 reminder calls & 3 hours later.The only reason to return to Sheraton Tribeca due to low rates and location.ps. This is subjective - we hate the mattress. Too soft caused bodyache & terrible pillows. Regretfully we should have asked for better pillows.

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for the Thanksgiving holiday and it was excellent. The rooms are very spacious for NYC. They were well appointed and very clean.The location is perfect for getting around Soho, Tribeca and the West Village. Lots of delicious restaurants, beautiful parks and plenty of shops in the area. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and accommodating. We will be back!!

Room size was decent for NYC (still small) but we weren’t crazy for the location. Hotel was clean and staff nice. Not likely a place we’d return though. We ate in the lobby restaurant (dessert) and they staff was attentive.

Rooms are clean and bigger than other Manhattan hotels in my past experience. Staff is friendly and extremely accommodating. Good location with decent restaurants within walking distance. Would stay again

Good option if you want a base for shopping in the area. Rooms are small, excellent executive lounge w/great terrace and open view of Statue of Liberty, good service from front desk personnel... friendly and aim to please. Lots of top restaurants within a short walk or ride. They offer some great rates at times that are very tempting. I'll be back.

Genesis, the lady who welcomed me at the reception on my check-in, has been super sweet, kind and accommodating. I'm really grateful for the positive experience and comfortable stay I had at this hotel. The room was spacious, cosy and with a great view.Thank you!

I mean, we're only halfway across Canal street with our bags and David the doorman meets us in the middle of the street to welcome us back to the hotel! Amazing how many folks there recognize us based on just 4 or 5 visits/year.Usually they have a room ready for us when we arrive (we're always quite early, before 11am), but not this time. Ah well, they stored our bags while we explored the city and we came back to a quiet room with a nice view of the Hudson.Hotel is very well located for the subway (3 minute walk to the A/C/E) and great walking streets all over TriBeCa and SoHo.

I would very certainly not rate the hotel among the best I have stayed at. The rooms are comfortable but not sensational. The staff on the other hand were very friendly. The front desk, baggage assistance and service at breakfast was exceptional. I wanted to especially recognize Ben who was our waiter on two days. The concierge lounge was subpar. The hotel is far from The theater district but an easy subway ride. The hotel rates on the other hand were only half as much as in the theater district and the hotel sometimes advertises specials even cheaper than that.

We stayed here for 3 nights on a trip to New York. This was a trip for my partners 30th birthday. The hotel recognised this and made our trip really special. The location is perfect and away from all the tourist traps but also walking distance to many attractions such as the highline Park, world trade centre and Brooklyn bridge. The rooms are clean and we were lucky to have a breathtaking view of the Empire State Building. The hotel is next to the canal street subway station too. I would recommend this hotel!

I have never been to New York before and I did not pay for this hotel. I cannot write about if this is a good deal or not. I thought the staff was very courteous. They allowed me to check-in early. The beds were comfy but the area is very noisy. Short walk to 9/11 Memorial.

We stayed here for 2 nights in Aug 2018. It was one of the worst experiences I had with a hotel. We checked in at 1030 am and stored our luggage. We booked the room in April 2018 and when I checked in they told me they didn’t have the rooms and would upgrade us for free and that our rooms would be ready about 1pm. They weren’t! They then told me by 3pm We got one room at 5pm and my parents(in their 90’s) still wasn’t ready. They told us they would comp us for dinner that evening in their restaurant and for the first night. They did comp us for dinner but the room still wasn’t ready at 6:15 pm. They didn’t have the room till 7:30 pm. They never refunded our room for that night. I’ve contacted them NUMEROUS times and still nothing from them. I can guarantee I won’t be using a Sheraton again.

I recently stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca and found it to be an incredible location, close to all the best shops and restaurants. The staff were incredible prior to my arrival, during my stay, and even while checking out. I had several boxes that had to be shipped home. David & Fery went above and beyond to make sure it happened. Helping me seal them up and they even hand delivered them to FedEx so I knew before I left they were on the way. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

Great service from all staff the minute you step in the hotel, the staff made you forget that you are in New York City. Felitta at check-in was very friendly and positive, when I requested for slippers it was delivered to me in ten minutes. The staff also upgraded me to a top floor with an amazing view due to my status.

Very nice hotel. Long wait for the room to be ready, but front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Room is clean and nice. Lounge is great, view is fantastic. Very relaxing and staff is friendly.

Great Hotel. I don`t understand any of the negative reviews I have seen.This is a clean modern hotel and our room was excellent. All the Staff are very friendly and helpful. It is within walking distance of lots of great bars and eating places. There are three subway station nearby so you can get around really easily. We had booked a city view room but were given a free upgrade to the club floor with free breakfast ( which was great ), free WIFI and use of the club lounge with great views over the city from the terrace.Would definitely stay again.

I stayed at the Sheraton tribeca Thursday thru Sunday. My room had an amazing view of the city. My bed and pillows were so comfortable and the black out curtains really helped me ensure quality sleep. Complimentary Starbucks coffee every morning was provided. This hotel was classy and clean and I would recommend staying at this hotel over any other in the tribeca area.

Carlos the doorman went Above and beyond for us. We had a flat tire late at night right outside the hotel and he went out of his way to help us get it fixed and made sure we were okay. Even though we were not even guests at the hotel that night. So very kind and nice. I definitely recommend this hotel just because of carlos !!! I appreciated his hard work and help.

First time to New York, Nelson probably provided the best experience I could have had. Check in to check out, these guys make you feel platinum no matter what. Doesn't matter when, I'll definitely be back every time I'm in NYC!

Sheraton Tribeca’s employees go above and beyond to accommodate their guests and make their stay memorable. Thanks to the entire club level staff, front desk staff and bell staff. Special shout out to Sal (front desk), Nelson (front desk), Raul (bell man), Steven (club level) and the gentleman who worked club level on October 13 and October 14 evenings.

From the moment on check-in I was gteated quite warmly by Kaylene. Paid for a Club Room which has access to the lounge for drinks and snacks where the staff go out of thwir way to ensure you have everything you need.Location is my favorite thing. The area has so much character and brilliant restaurants and among Italian and Chinese districts. As I like to walk and explore this made trips to Central Park and Times Square a brilliant hike.Rooms are a bit dated but very clean. One item to note were the room descriptions on the website showed a room fridge and even a washer and drier which on asking the front desk was dismissed.Pay for the club room. The views from the rooftop patio area are amazing.

A pleasant hotel with friendly,helpful staff, The room I had was a corner room on the ninth floor and overlooking the street, but there was no traffic or any other noise. So enjoyed restful sleep in a very comfortable bed. The hotel is also well located, just five minutes walk from the nearest metro station, so easy to commute all over this great city from here.

Great hotel for holiday staying! Friendly prices for this place, only weekends are more expensive. Stuff is friendly and helpfully. Very good restaurant and breakfasts. Calm place in center of New York. Real 4 stars place and very good and clean rooms with spaciously bathrooms. When I will come back to this wonderfull city, Sheraton Tribeca will be my choice again.

Great service started the second I walked through the door. The woman ( I wish I knew her name) at the front desk greet my husband and I warmly and quickly checked us in. She acknowledged my status with the brand and made sure we had everything we needed for a great stay. We choose to spend a little extra for the club floor and are very happy we did. The club is small but nice and the deck makes it all worth it. The staff was always friendly and happy hour was well operated with wine and beer options along with a fantastic selection of snacks. Club access is 24 hours which is convenient for those times you need a late night bag of chips or a bottle of water. We also tried the bar at the hotel and found the drinks (Tribeca Beauty to be specific) to be outstanding! The location of the hotel is away from Midtown, for someone like me who travels to the city several times a year it was nice to not be in the heart of the hustle and bustle but only a 15-minute subway away from midtown. Tribeca has some great dining options and the vide is a bit more relaxed than what you get if staying near times square. I will absolutely be considering this hotel for future stays.

This hotel is conveniently situated one block from the tube station and within easy walking distance of lower Manhattan sites. It was easy to catch the train from Newark Airport and connect seamlessly by underground.We arrived early and were invited to wait in the members lounge on the 21st Floor where we had complimentary snacks, juice and coffee. A magnificent terrace provides stunning views of the Hudson River and surrounds. They also provided a taxi service to the airport which was efficient and on time. For a luxury hotel the rooms are still quite basic, but comfortable in every respect. Friendly staff and efficient service made this stay very pleasurable.

This was a nice clean hotel. We had a patio room which I would highly recommend. Very spacious patio in the middle of the city which was awesome. Very close to the subway and easy to get around. The staff was very friendly bell staff were awesome. Always ready to assist with your plans. Breakfast was ok but not that great. Paid for breakfast everyday in advance but only ate their once. food next door was way better.

Hotel is well located in the upcoming Tribeca Area. Its walking distance from NYU and many high street shops are at walking distance. Once you enter the high street, it feels that you are away from the madness of NY. Hotel is on a very busy street - it takes a good 10 minutes for any Uber to arrive.

This hotel is right on Canal St and is in the middle btw Soho, Tribeca, and Chinatown...so it’s very convenient to walk around and find everything you need. The room that I stayed was a little bit small. The bed was comfy. Room was clean. Front desk was very attentive! Overall Nice stay!

Staff is amazing and I’m always happy and well taken care of. Shout out to Nelson, Sal and deon...and everyone else that makes this a great place to stay. This is my home away from home. You all rock!

If you love staying off the beaten path of Times Square/Tourist Central, this is a great area to stay and a wonderful hotel. We found the rates very good, rooms very clean. Great location with a 24hr deli next door, best NY pizza down the street. So close to shopping in interesting areas and Subway very close. Staff was EXCEPTIONAL. Want to specifically thank Nestor (Front Desk). Our flight was 6hrs late arriving and we were very tired and hungry at 1AM. He gave us a free buffet breakfast to use during our stay, showed us where we could go for food at 1am and immediately brought a fridge to our room on request. Couldn't do enough for us. Equally as friendly was Carlos (Bellman), We needed a taxi in the evening to go to a show and he walked down the street to the next intersection and stood on the road to flag down a cab for us. Over and above if you ask me. Another day he showed us a great shortcut subway trip to Yankee Stadium. He couldn't do enough for us and had a wonderful sense of humour. We think this is the best place to stay if you love the flavour of downtown.

I have stayed here many times over the last 5 years and each time it just seems worse. I think I will have to find a new hotel for my next trip. It's a shame because the location is really great but on this trip - my a/c didn't work (amont other issues). I asked at the front desk at 2 pm for a/c repair and my missing feather pillows. Upon returning to my room at 11pm - nothing had been done. They sent maintenance, who opened the a/c and rattled some things around and said it was fixed. Of course - it was not and we sweltered all weekend. I then had to call again for my pillow which I finally got at midnight. I am a lifetime platinum and I know good service from SPG - did not get it here. I am in the Sheraton Brooklyn right now and it's a world of difference - every request attended to immediately, everything in my room works, etc.

Very Friendly Staff. Good Club Lounge With Complimentary Wine & Beer.We stay over night at NYC on our way to Israel. We’ve started at Hotel near Time Square many times in the past and decided to try something different.The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We were there very early due to our flight and our rooms weren’t ready. We have 3 Rooms Total in our Traveling Group. One Presidential Suite, one Superior Room and one standard room. Due to my Platinum status, the 2 Rooms were upgrades to Club Level Rooms with Club Lounge Access. The Presidential Suite already comes with Lounge Access. The front desk was able to supply us with temporary key access to the Club Lounge to hang out before our rooms are ready.We have the Presidential Suite which was very basic in furnishings, would not call it Luxurious by any means. The master bed room have the smallest hanging closet in a hotel that I ever been to!The Club Lounge is located on the 21th floor, it have a open air rooftop balcony area with fabulous view of the NYC skyline.Happy Hours is 5:30pm - 7:30pm, Complimentary Snacks and Wine & Beer. Complimentary alcoholic beverages is becoming a rarity in the USA Hotel Club Lounges , Most of them will charge for the Alcoholic beverage. Unlike the Club Lounges in Asia will always have Complimentary Alcoholic Beverage and an extensive spread of delicious food.Overall. The Rooms are just average Sheraton products.The Staff are very nice, especially the Bellhop staff Jorge- he was extremely friendly , cheerful and helpful.

The Sheraton Tribeca is greatly located, has an AMAZING rooftop and the staff is the nicest, especially Felitta who was so welcoming, cheerful and helpful!Would definitely stay there again during a NYC trip!

This hotel has paper-thin walls and from my experience attracts loud, trashy people. This was a sad combination for me. I asked the front desk if the couple in the next room was checking out soon because if they were not I really wanted to move since their screaming all night and into the morning (10:30pm until about 4:00am) was pretty horrible. The front desk clerk lied 3 days in a row saying they were checking out. And every night they were still there rattling doors with their shouting. This hotel lacks very basic amenities such as understanding do not disturb signs, having a mail drop, being able to answer any questions about the area (Information about tours of the city? Their suggestion was to wander around the Port Authority Bus Station.). If you ask for no housekeeping, rest assured they will call you every day anyway and refuse to give you the star points. I cannot believe this is a Starwood property. I made a Trip Advisor account specifically to warn you NOT to stay here.
user_name:
marrietta2018
New York City, New York

review_body: Very good quality/price ratio for NYC. Clean, fast and reliable elevators, good locations, very close to major subway trains.Had parcel packages delivered to the hotel address with no problem.Only downside is the room size, expected a larger room, but then again that’s normal for NY.Would recommend it if asked.

The part we enjoyed the most was the super friendly staff! They always went the extra mile to make our stay there an unforgettable one. Having said that, our room at a residual smoke smell in it which means someone before us didn't respect the rules! It happens!

Stayed here in August and was pleasantly surprised in how nice the hotel was considering the low price! Great location, especially if you're wanting to stay in the Village/Soho area or go over to Brooklyn.

Felitta was a phenomenal woman who was SO welcoming! She went out of her way to make us feel appreciated our entire stay. We enjoyed our visit even more because of her wonderful, bubbly personality! Keep up the great work, Felitta!

I NEVER do reviews but Carlos deserved to be mentioned. He went above and beyond for me when I was waiting for my car. I travel a lot and hotel service can be horrible at times, for Carlos that was the complete opposite. Someone at a hotel who makes you feel significant, what a breathe of fresh air. Thank you Carlos for professionalism and making me confident in Sheraton!

This location cannot be beat for walking all over lower Manhattan. It was clean and decent, the beds and pillows were super comfy, and I'm really picky. It's typical NY small, though they do a great job with furniture that has little storage nooks & crannies. The staff at front desk was quite helpful. Housekeeping did an OK job with the room, and I did leave a tip. Despite that, the little extra touches, such as realizing you have one tissue left in the box, went unnoticed. The shower was a challenge. Either too hot or too cool, hard to get the flow temp just right. I was not thrilled with the club level lounge for breakfast. It was crowded, not always a place to sit immediately, and the staff seemed a little overwhelmed keeping up with demand. The roof top terrace was super nice, except it was raining the whole time I was there, so didn't get to use it. Perhaps that is why the interior was so crowded. I did not visit the restaurant/bar, as there were so many wonderful options within walking distance. I recommend this hotel if you like using SPG family perks and all, and want to stay in this neighborhood.

Shout out to Alexa at the front desk who was amazing at check-in. The club lounge is great with an amazing view and the rooms are spacious very clean and very cozy. Great option while in New York, New York!!!!!

1st time ever in New York and what a great hotel experience we had at Sheraton Tribeca. Upon arrival in very clean tasteful lobby, all staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and accommodating. I was extremely pleased with room cleanliness, decor and plush white towels. The room was well organized and equipped with the right stuff. Housekeeping was exceptional. We spent 3 nights and wished had time to stay longer. Bell guy “Carlos” was happy to assist and went the extra mile in satisfying requests. Definitely would recommend to friends and eager to return to newyork and stay at the Sheraton Tribeca again.

So having stayed elsewhere last year I returned - to what is a usual place for me. The location is great - yes on Canal street which can be tacky - but close the ACE lines and Little Italy & Chinatown . Beds are really comfortable though rooms a little light on space - but in terms of $ it offers a really good option. Wifi was free as I am a member of the reward points programme- though friendly check in person didn't seem to know I had stayed 5 times before (so an upgrade would have been nice).

Upon entering the hotel, met Felita at the check-in. She was very welcoming and I instantly felt at home and in a positive mood. She made the trip. As an SPG member I had access to the rooftop clup with its wonderful view of the city. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The location was perfect steps from Chinatown, Little Italy and the train.With the welcome i received from Felita, the nice rooms, and wonderful team, is it any wonder that we chose to return to the hotel for our visit next week/

Carlos Bell was of the utmost help when we ended up with a flat tire in front of the Sheraton. He is very professional, helpful and knowledgeable! Carlos, went above and beyond, providing excellent service. Thank you, Carlos!
user_name:
Megsampson
New York City, New York

review_body: Situated on Canal street, it’s an easy place to start exploring Soho. There’s lots of restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Hotel offers a nice size lobby compared to New York standards, as well as a nice breakfast area. Reception is efficient. Since my international flights had delays, and I arrived late, I was given vouchers for breakfast as a nice gesture. Room compact as many others in New York but efficiently decorated. There is a safe deposit box. Coffee maker, coffee and bottled water provided, but no refrigerator in room. Comfortable beds and crispy clean brand new towels and bedding.

The hotel is as one would expect for a Sheraton. Found hair in bathroom. Room was otherwise fairly clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. Front desk is disorganized and understaffed. The porter named David was a breath of fresh air. Enthusiastic fast and helpful. This guy should really be recognized for his great demeanor.

Really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. Great sized rooms for NYC, and excellent amenities. The view from the club lounge rooftop is stunning. Special thanks the entertaining and knowledgeable Steven H, who went out of his way to make the stay top notch for everyone on the rooftop!

I had a very nice stay here - the staff - especially Sal - were warm and accommodating - exactly how you’d hope. My room was certainly large enough (although I had one of the larger rooms) and was clean, quiet, and comfortable. I look forward to making this hotel my regular in NYC.

Great location, super friendly and helpful staff! (Sal at front desk and Frey at Concierge; the best!)Rooms have everything you need. The beds are very comfortable, and with a bit of luck, you have a smashing view directly to the Empire State. Reception (front desk) and concierge are helpful with every request - from additional bedsheets to a fridge in the room, to storage and transport.Three subway stations in easy walking distance, and Soho literally just outside the door, makes this the perfect base for a stay in Manhattan.

The location in Canal Street is very convenient, with 10 Subway lines nearby. It is close to SoHo, Tribeca, Chinatown and Little Italy. Some of the rooms have access to a lounge with a lovely terrace with Empire State building view. The rooms have air condition and the beds are comfy. The Hotel has a 24 hour fitness centre, this is perfect for Europeans with jet lag. The staff is outstanding. Sal in the reception is the best guy ever, and so is Frey (the concierge).

The room was very small!! We booked a Club Room with King Bed on the Club Floor which they show as being 280 sq. feet. I measured the room at 14'x14' ,not including the bathroom, and the bathroom was not big either. two people cannot move around the room at the same time. I know rooms in NYC are small, but this was ridiculous!Also, do not pay extra for the Club Level. The food was poor, and you couldn't even get a glass of ice. When I asked for one, I was told to go down the hall to get my own ice, and use a paper coffee cup!!!

This was my first trip to NY and Sal, Fery and Carlos were amazing!! They were funny, nice and really accommodating. They were super helpful with arranging transportation because I had 5 huge suitcases. I'm staying here whenever I come to NY!

David at the front door was very helpful to me as I was dealing with luggage for a trade show- really appreciated it! My room was clean and pretty- and lobby with business center was great. Thank you!
