Overall, we liked it because of location, cleanliness and professional staff.

Very friendly staff and efficient check in/check out experience. A clean, comfortable, and good sized room. Room has a large safe, modern and spacious bathroom & shower. No mini bar in room, but bottled water available. Hotel has fast & efficient elevators with minimal waiting. There is also a nice little bar & cafe area and a fitness room with good machines. There's also a restaurant on site, but I did not eat there due to the many incredible restaurants in the area. (like Khe-yo & Tamarind). Hotel is in a very good location with easy access to the World Trade Center, Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, & Midtown. Highly recommended.

The property is located close to subways in the south Manhattan.Staff is very friendly.We booked a club floor room and we had a very nice view on the Empire State Building.The club floor is a great place to start and finish the day around something to drink and eat.The only bad point is the rate but we are in New York and it was not overrated with competitors.Very nice stay.

The hotel is located in lower manhattan so if you wish to visit the center you must jump on the subway.Bed was comfortable and they offered us free breakfast (nothing remarkable but hey... it was for free)

Great location. Good deals if you look around. Close to many locations either on foot by cab or subway. Small rooms but that's NYC. Street noise happens with all hotels here. Wear earplugs if it's an issue for you. Many amenities. Restaurant but why eat in with so many in the area. mini Starbucks on site. Took the subway from Grand Central. Walked the Brooklyn Bridge, dinner and drinks around the corner on N Moore St. Walked to Chinatown etc. subway line is great Green and Yellow are right here.

The hotel was not really the standard that I'd expect from a Sheraton hotel, mostly because our room was very tired and could definitely use an upgrade. We were on a lower floor facing Canal Street and it was very noisy (which I expected but was told very unsympathetically at reception that the hotel was fully booked so no higher rooms available). The bathroom was two star standard, very disappointing. Very impersonal check in experience. The price however, was very cheap for the area - although I would describe the location as just on the outskirts of Tribeca, but it was only a 5-10 minutes walk to the Tribeca bars/restaurants. We only stayed for one night, and I would not recommend staying more than 1-2 nights if you are looking for a comfortable/luxury stay.

I have mixed feelings about this property. The Sheraton TriBeCa is on Canal, nestled in between takeaway shops and closed shops. The subway connections are good and it's a short walk to Soho and Downtown but on an evening there are questionable characters lurking outside and the atmosphere can be uncomfortable. I didn't have a great arrival or start to my stay here, problems with the room rate I booked, a dirty room and argumentative manager. Eventually all was resolved, I was given a different room, given the correct room rate and promised points for my troubles; the female manager didn't get why I was frustrated and didn't come back to me to follow up. The problem with this property is that it's dated, never particularly feels fully clean and the club lounge and lobby bar are always incredibly crowded; it makes relaxing anywhere but your room difficult. There is a Starbucks concession in the lobby which is an added bonus. The rooms here do need updating and the furnishings do need replacing. The rate here is not cheap compared to other hotels in the area and hence the value for money is questionable. The TV's are terrible but the wifi is good. The service, in general, was good. Reception team were friendly and the bell boy and concierge was also welcoming and helpful. The night manager was good; he tried to resolve the issues I'd faced on arrival. Room service was always good and quick.I think more attention needs to be paid to housekeeping here and with ensuring SPG benefits are delivered consistently. This could be a great hotel instead of a good hotel if standards were improved. I am still waiting a response from the hotel as to why my rate changed before my arrival and why I was downgraded. They did eventually sort this out but still annoying and shouldn't happen.

Well located hotel near two sub stations offers good transport options to locations around and in the city. The hotel location itself is nothing to write home about. The rooms are in good shape and it start to look that they need an additional eye to spot the spots. Anything from thick layer of dust above the bathroom mirror to broken curtains. The staff are ok, very cold so didn't make me feel too welcomed. Reserved through Booking.com and the hotel/spg didn't respect my gold status which was disappointing considering other chains do respect status even when booking via 3rd party. Overall good enough for the rate paid.

Location is good, close to subway stations of various lines. Room was moderately clean. However there was a long black hair in my bed and there were hairs in the shower drain. Under one of the beds was a plastic bag with a brand new garment in it, obviously left by a previous guest. Staff at the desk was helpful. Roof terrace was only available by becoming a member of some sort of club, which cost 30 dollars.

Location is nice , but hotel is very worn out.Walls need renovation.Wallpaper are dirty, doors have scratches , bed sheet were little bit over used.Reception was kind but big mess. Tube is around the corner.

The hotel is immaculate and the staff are super friendly it's location is great for hopping on the subway for up and downtown locations I've loved my stay and would stay again although I wouldn't recommend the bar the drinks are a little expensive although not more so than many hotels but if using as a base for a holiday rather than business maybe find a bar elsewhere

My wife and I have stayed here several times. We like this place because of its Tribeca location and super friendly staff. We like the concierge level club. Every day they put out a nice selection of snacks and some complimentary beverages. My wife finds the club and the roof top such a lovely place to visit and hang. The rooms are a bit small, but adequate. The bed was luxuriously comfortable, the bathroom has modern fixtures with hot showers. However, one area of improvement: The breakfast service was a bit slow, maybe understaffed or disinterested staff. The result is that the food can use refreshing, more attentiveness while the staff is taking their break in the back room. To end on a high note- the lady who takes care of us at happy hour is a joy, as well as the front desk and bell service.

Every year on May 1st NYC invites 32,000 cyclists to tour the 5 Burroughs of NYC. I was lucky enough to stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa NY Hotel. This Hotel is to hospitality what Amazon is to retail. Enough said.

This hotel is super cute. The staff is great and the SPG MEMBER recognition is impeccable. I'm Gold and I didn't have to wait in line at all! The subway is right out the front door. There are tons of great little bistros in this part of town. It's very clean for you neat freaks out there like me! We stayed here on our annaversary and it was a 15 minute ride to see a play on 42nd street. Awesome!!!
user_name:
victoriak170
New York City, New York

review_body: My image I had about Tribeca didn't match the exact location of this hotel. However the interior was definitely up to Sheraton's standards. Note the room size is on the smaller side since it is New York. I didn't mind the size since it was just me. I was impressed with the person checking me in. I noticed he knew the regulars and had a fun, polite conversation with them.According to my colleague, the hotel restaurant was quite good.My only complaint is some noise - when someone was entering their hotel room next to mine, it was loud, sounded like the door slamming every time it closed.

The Hotel and rooms are ok/average. The location is great - walking distance to wtc/ground zero and subway in front of the door. We booked a clubroom - breakfast was included. Anyhow we decided to get breakfast outside as the lounge was very crowded and the choice was very limited.i would return, as the location combined with the medium price was ok.

We stayed 4 nights and had only positive experiences. All of the hotel staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful. We needed assistance from housekeeping several times and the response was prompt. Room service from the Antica restaurant downstairs was a highlight. The food was delicious. We were on the 15th floor so it was very quiet. Beds are very comfortable. The room was older but clean. No bathtub but a large shower. We upgraded so we could use the club lounge on the 21st floor and I would recommend that. The view is amazing. The breakfast was good and the happy hour with appetizers was great. We had a 3 yr old with stroller and we walked all over Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown, Little Italy. It's a great location. The Hudson Riverfront Park was beautiful. There is a Japanese restaurant called Tataki right around the corner that was very good. In all of our time at the Sheraton we only had good service from all the employees. We will definitely be back.

The Sheraton Tribeca is just ok. We had some fantastic service from the night shift guys, Colin and Nelson. Most of the staff have been very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping has done a poor job at turning down our third bed, all three nights of our stay. I think it's been a busy Halloween weekend for them. The room itself is average. Overall not much stands out here but the location has been convenient for us.

Sheraton Tribeca NYC370 Canal StLower ManhattanThree nights (10-12 June, 2016). Reasonably priced. Location: ideal for tourists; safe / friendly neighborhood; convenient walking distance to subway station,Tribeca and Soho taverns, restaurants, and “convenience stores”; and to 9/11 Memorial; quick access from and to Holland tunnel . Room: overlooking Canal St. (traffic on this 700 block of Canal St. should impress NASCAR fans). Staff: exceptionally friendly and helpful, particularly in giving directions; valley parking and bellmen service was quick and efficient. A thoughtful bellman walked us across the street to the parking garage, saving us a great deal of time in getting into the proper lane to exit the city via the Holland tunnel. Staff helped make this visit a worthwhile experience for first time "Big Apple" visitors.

We were here for a weekend get-away - nothing to complain about and nothing truly outstanding. All just OK, which isn't a bad thing in NYC.Room was clean, comfortable. WiFi fast. Front desk staff friendly and helpful.Good location if you want to stay downtown - Canal & 6th Ave. A few blocks to Hudson River and then a 10-15 min walk to World Center site and ferry to Statue of Liberty.

We were going to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca in late October 2016. A couple days before our reservation date, we received a confirmation email letting us know that everything was in order.Check-in time was 3:00PM. We got stuck in traffic and were unable to reach the hotel until 7:00PM. Upon trying to check in, we were told that our reservation was cancelled at 6:00PM because they ran our credit card and it was declined.Instead of taking two minutes to call us and tell us about the card being declined and asking for a different one (or, as was the case, getting an updated number), they cancelled the reservation and gave our room to someone else. The hotel was full, so we could not stay there. The staff were rude about the whole situation. This was incredibly frustrating, and we were left to find a new place to stay at the last minute.Additionally, it's worth noting that we had colleagues staying there the same evening who had booked a suite. They were told the check in time was 3:00PM and arrived at approximately that time. Upon arrival, the suite was not ready. They would not allow them to check any baggage in, so someone had to stay with their baggage in the lobby, and the suite was not ready until 7:00PM. They were not given any sort of a discount.Terrible policy, and the staff were awful with they handled this. Very disappointed.

The hotel itself is in a good location, easy access to the train etc. The room was clean, bed was super comfy, great view! That being said, the service at the bar, restaurant, and room service is awful!!! And the concierge was so rude not just once but EVERY time I spoke with her. The final straw was me sitting there waiting to secure a ride to the airport while she argued on the phone with someone acting put out that I was interrupting her. I've stayed here before but it was never this bad! Won't be back.

The gym is super filthy, the room not taken care off, old and worn out. Not even an umbrella can be provided. The location is great, but still would no one recommend to stay. Way to expensive for what you get. Very disappointed about the brand Sheraton.

Rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. The noise from the street can be loud. Location is good to easily walk to Chinatown, Little Italy and Tribeca. And an easy 1 train ride to Midtown. Would recommend.

I really liked the feather pillows for a good night's sleep, the 24-hour gym - for those of us staying on UK time - and the location; it's a gentle stroll from the cute soho streets, the delis, the bars, dean and delucca on Broadway and not too far from Washington Square. Sadly, the front desk messed up taking a business call, which is deeply unimpressive. when I checked on Monday, I told them I was due to take a call at 6am from a client in Spain and the girls on the front desk assured me they have 24-hour coverage on the front desk. Being on the 18th floor, I couldn't just nip down close to the scheduled time, so I phoned the front desk... and it rang and rang and rang for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, my client is phoning from Spain and similarly, no-one is picking up. The client, my publisher and I are all swapping emails and still no-one is picking up. Eventually a man does pick up and I say, 'where have you been?'. 'Right here', he replies. So I tell him about the calls, and he claims no-one rang through. BUT I RANG THROUGH! So frustrating. So overall, a well-located hotel (bring ear-plugs - Canal street is noisy even if your room, like mine, is not on Canal Street itself - but a business hotel this is not!

Booking a hotel in New York is never that easy. You usually have to choose between location and cost, and getting both is pretty rare. NYC has a good number of hip boutique hotels that spawl across Tribeca and Soho, but these usually come upwards of £300 per night. If you are like me, it's great to stay in cool and hip hotel, but a great location and price that isn't going cripple me is more important.The Sheraton Tribeca is located on Canal Street, a busy road linking the Holland Tunnel and Manhattan bridge and splits the Tribeca and Lower Manhattan neighbourhoods. At first glance you feel like the hotel is sandwiched between two busy lanes of traffic, which it is, however you are also positioned within 15 minutes walk from some of the nicest places to eat and drink in Manhattan. A Metro stop is around the corner so you can reach the heights of Central Park and Times Square easily, however if you want to sightsee around either of these locations then I wouldn't stay here and instead opt for somewhere further north.Walking out of the door of the hotel to the north is the delights of Soho and Greenwich, with the Meat Packing district about 30 minutes walk. Bleekers Street, famous for eateries and live music is 15 minutes away. 15 minutes to the east is Little Italy and Chinatown, and 15 minutes to the south is the WTC.Inside the hotel the rooms are of average size, a little dated, but clean and comfy enough. The sound proofing isn't great as the doors don't really keep the noise out, however the beds are very comfortable which makes sleeping after a long day of walking the streets nice and easy. All in all if you are looking for a good location then The Sheraton Tribeca ticks the boxes especially if you are a foodie and live music junky. Don't expect boutique decor and long velvet curtains or you will be disappointed.Transfers to JFK are 1.15hr and Newark approx 1hr.

very convenient location in the heart of Manhattan! elegant terrace with panoramic views on the club floor! nice linens in the rooms and comfortable mattresses for a healthy sleep! Hotel suitable for both short term and for the long journey!

The front desk folks are all really nice. The hotel is a good location if you want to be down here. The gym is OK as long as there are only 2 or 3 people in it. The free breakfast is probably OK if you get there the minute they open, otherwise it is really picked over and sort of gross by 10:00 am. The housekeeping is what really made me drop it to 3 stars. I stayed 5 nights and I had to finally ask for them to vacuum my room and clean my desk and my sink. Plus the housekeepers bang the doors of whatever room they are cleaning 10 or 15 times. I do not understand why they can't stick a towel in the door but instead they let it slam shut each time they go out to their cart. It woke us up early every morning and then in the late afternoon when I would try to rest before going out to dinner, bang bang bang all over again. So, housekeeping is not good,not very clean, but the rest of the people at the hotel are really nice. If I had to work down here again, I would maybe have to stay here just for the location.

two thumbs up for price and value the staff was attentive the room was clean and neat we used points for one night and paid 271 for the second it was a great deal for Tribeca in new York city...canal street and the Holland tunnel are at your doorstep snacks at the rooftop club were convienient.

The hotel is conveniently located at the corner of W. Broadway and Canal, at the confluence of TriBeCa, Soho and Chinatown. There is no place in the hotel to purchase snacks or forgotten items like razors or anti acids, which was inconvenient. Also, the little place I think they called the Link, or the Line, where supposedly you could get a coffee or tea or breakfast pastry, was in the lobby and unstaffed both mornings I was there. Also, the "lounge" is also in the lobby and is not by any stretch of the imagination a place where you would want to hang out and have a drink with friends. Basically, this is a good, basic place to sleep, but not to spend any time in. I have to say, the young men at the door who were available to help you get a cab (which is not easy) were great. Friendly and down to earth and very helpful.

I chose the hotel for its location, downtown Manhattan. The staff were helpful and the room standard was good. Did not eat in the restaurant. Bar expensive, but then that was much as I discovered across NYC. The hotel was handy for the subway, getting back to jfk airport and walking down to Brooklyn bridge, staten island ferry, Greenwich village/hi line and the 9/11 memorial museum. I would recommend this hotel for part of a stay in New York as it is a little less hectic than around Times Square/Empire State building etc. Other reviews have suggested a room on the upper floors. We were on the 7th, not much of view, canal street.

This both the smallest and dirtiest room I have ever stayed at in New York. There are clearly some deferred maintenance issues throughout the hotel. The toilet in my room constantly leaks and one of the two buttons is broken. The exhaust fan in the ceiling is filthy. The carpet in the room and hallway is showing signs of age and stained. The exterior window looks as through it has never been cleaned. From a housekeeping perspective... eww. There was thick black hair on not 1 but 2 towels in the bathroom. The room was not throughly vacuumed, it looked like shredded straw rappers were strewn about. But worst of all, when going to bed I noticed that one of the 4 pillows had a disgusting stain on it (see included picture), so I pulled back the sheets and saw the bottom sheet had rips all along the fitted sheet portion and found several hairs between the sheets. GROSS!I would have expected more of a Starwood property, I will no the returning.

Staff continuously lie to you when something goes wrong. We payed for a club room and were put in a traditional room that we were told didn't even have enough room for us (family of 4). We went to reception and told them that we payed for a club room and it were transferred to 4 different staff members - each of them telling their own stories of why we didn't get the room we payed for. Finally we were told by the manager that she would give us the room we payed for and refund us the difference. However she lied about the amount and said it was only a $30 a night difference when we were told by another staff member that it was $90 a night (which it was) and blamed the difference in numbers to the fact that the staff member was new and only had been there for a week. After looking into it we proved that it was actually $90 a night.Definitely not the service expected from a Sheriton hotel.

If you're planning to spend time in Chelsea, this is a very convenient location within walking distance to Chelsea Market, a bunch of great restaurants, and shops. Customer service was excellent -- Sal at the front desk was a real professional. He managed to get us checked in a little early, too. Overall, the hotel was just fine -- the rooms, while standard issue in terms of decor, are fairly spacious by NYC standards. The bedding was so-so -- mattress a bit soft for my taste and pillow too thick (but, I should point out, I did not try asking for a different pillow, which I probably could have). The linens were nice and the bathroom was clean. I think the one change this hotel could make is the LOBBY. It's tiny -- probably can't do much about that -- and really quite tired. The furniture and floors are dirty, and there aren't those little perks you find in other hotels like cucumber or lemon water. But, good service trumps all that, so I would definitely come back. Dinner at Mario Battali's La Sirena -- just across the street from Chelsea Market -- was spectacular.

Rooms were smaller the Sheraton Times Square, as was club lounge. Front desk staff very friendly and professional, but management has some glitches. Housekeeping was extremely slow responding with basic needs, sometimes requiring a wait of an hour and a half and/or multiple requests.

Room was comfortable & clean. Room service breakfast was quick and attentive with average food. Front desk staff were very friendly and especially helpful at finding a good Italian restaurant for dinner nearby.

Just returned from a great stay at this hotel and will return for sure. The location, amenities and service gives this hotel five stars. All the staff are excellent from concierge to front desk, club lounge to housekeeping, nothing is too much trouble. Would recommend a club lounge room, as the rooftop lounge with amazing views of the city and Empire State Building are fantastic. It was my sons 21st birthday during our stay, special thanks to Colin, Rhonda and Megan for making it so special.

I'm a Starwood platinum member and This was my sixth stay at this hotel. I love the location especially if you're flying into or out of Newark. It's between soho and TriBeCa and Chinatown so there's something for everyone. The club lounge is awesome. There's always something to snack on they are very generous and it has a beautiful rooftop area. The rooms are ok. You can tell it's an older hotel but that's ok because the staff are wonderful. On one of my precious visits they found out it was my wedding anniversary and sent us a bottle of wine. It's close to the subway. Can't go wrong here.

I have stayed in MANY SPG properties in the city and in Brooklyn (W, Westin Times Square, Sheraton Times Square, Element, Four Points Soho, Aloft Brooklyn, Sheraton Brooklyn) and this is my favorite place to stay in the city. Close to subways, great restaurants, wonderful VIP lounge and terrace with a superb view of the city. There's something very cozy about this hotel.

I was here for a very short overnight trip for work. The hotel is conveniently located and clean. Staff was very nice even very late at night. The rooms are decent size for New York City. There is a restaurant and Starbucks right in the lobby.

My son and I just returned from an amazing visit to New York. The Sheraton Tribeca was a great choice for us. When we arrived we were greeted by Rhonda who was extremely gracious and personable and was that way with every single encounter we had with her. She was always positive and upbeat! Our room was on an upper level with a great view. The location of the hotel was perfect; a short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge, Soho shopping and restaurants in Alphabet City. All of the staff were friendly and ready to give us a helping hand should we need it, We will stay there again!

Big compliments to Rhonda for making the stay most enjoyable. She was super friendly and customer service focused! We need more Rhonda's working at every hotel. The rooms were normal size for NYC, but we're newer and clean. Would definitely recommend!

My husband and I came to town for an extended long weekend away and can honestly we were blown away by the service at this hotel.We checked in early and right away they stored our bags and gave us a bottle of water. We received a call when our room was ready which allowed us to enjoy a full day exploring the city. Our front desk rep Sal was wonderful from the get go. This would be the pattern throughout our stay; asking how are day went, offering water, advice, and always with a smile. Consistently great service from all the reps; it was their mission to ensure our stay was the best possible, they even gave us a free drink at the bar when they knew we were celebrating a special occasion.Room size was great for NYC, very clean and the rooftop patio is a must.Fantastic hotel, cannot say enough great things

My wife and I visited the Sheraton TriBeCa this past weekend for a short getaway. Overall, it was a great experience and I would stay again in a heartbeat. My thoughts:Pros:- Club lounge offers awesome views of Midtown skyline. - Customer service is exceptional. - I'm not sure if it was a one-off thing, but they offered us a flat-rate ride from hotel to Laguardia. $55 considering it took 1.5 hours because of traffic. Meter would have been much more. Cons:- Smallish rooms, but you're in New York. No room is large in NYC and you're not spending time in your room, so it was ok with us. - Location if you're looking for the Midtown sites (Times Square, Central Park, etc.). We've visited New York many times and we wanted a different location, which is why we chose the Sheraton TriBeCa. If you're looking for a hotel for your first time visit to take in the Midtown sites, you would be better off looking elsewhere. Otherwise, great location for World Trade Center, Brooklyn Bridge, etc.

Stayed here recently. The hotel is clean and the staff is very accomodating and nice. The rooms were normal size and the beds are fine. I would stay here again. Very close to China Town and Little Italy.

Very friendly staff especially the barmaid. Had a drink in the when we returned after a tiring day sightseeing. Room was clean and quiet right opposite the lift. Hotel is well located although outside you get accosted by the Canal Street traders selling handbags and fake Rolex watches. Canal Street is well placed for the Big Bus tour and about 20 minutes on foot to the 9/11 memorial.

HelloPlease review the attached photos from my recent stay at your hotel. I have filed a complaint with Starwood and I'm following up with your hotel. I am a loyal Starwood member with the Starwood credit card and this is the type of room you offer a loyal customer. Next to the elevator, overlooking the loud rooftop a/c units, with a nightstand that won't fit next to the bed and I have to stare at it while I'm trying to sleep and when I wake up, a broken toilet that won't flush......you should be ashamed. The manager offered two free drinks. Thanks for making my 50th birthday special. I would like the 12,000 points deposited into my account so I can use it for a W or St Regis.

We booked our stay at Sheraton TriBeCa through Hotels.com, relying on their rating was a big mistake. During our 5 days stay at this hotel our experience was complete disappointment; there were issues with the front desk; two of their agents were pretty rude so was the cafe clerk. The breakfast at the restaurant was inedibly bad. There were multiple problems with our room as well; the phone set battery was permanently dead we asked for a new one but no response. Cleanliness of our room was unacceptable, the rug smelled like feet, sheets and bedding had prior stains on them and were of poor quality. The wallpaper was peeling off and full of marks and stains. The windows were grimy from not having been washed. The furniture were worn looking, the fan in the bathroom didn't work, we asked for repairs but got no response.

I had no expectations at all of this hotel. But from the moment I arrived "Ronda" gave the most warming welcome you can ever imagine, she offered me a free wine, the club member access and a room looking to the empire state building. The hotel has a beautiful view from the 21st floor (member's club) and decent breakfast. It is in a good location and has a bar and a restaurant.I will definitely come back.

Again, we were shopping for a new place to stay & this seemed to fit what we were looking for. It was a little more in price but was well worth it! Ck in was easy. Only thing that was not to our liking was the accessible room which was my fault in booking. When we realized that we were too tired to ask for a change . The room was clean &nicely furnished. The other complaint was the air conditioning blowing at the head of the bed! The buffet breakfast and the evening happy hour were excellent. Lots of choices and the different people serving were all gracious and amicable. Bellmen were right on with getting us a cab and transportation to LGA. The hotel is located right around the corner from our favorite pub, Nancy Whiskey. It's also a short walk to Chinatown and Little Italy. Subway is right near also. The views from the club lounge were wonderful. We had a coffee maker in the room but drinks and snacks were available all day in the club lounge. We will be returning on our next trip!

At a recent family event, the 10 of us stayed at this hotel over the weekend. The check-in was okay, however I got to point out that the female front desk greeted us inappropriately with a "hand" gesture asking us to come over and we were only 2 feet away??? No "good afternoon" or "hello"? I should have said something but was caught off guard and quite surprised with the unprofessionalism that I was speechless.We had access to the club lounge which was not bad, they had specials from 5:30-8:30pm serving wine, salad and light snacks. The only turn off was the "tip jar" and the server was being a little over the top at times speaking loudly. Again, it shows unprofessionalism and looks cheap for an establishment like this. It was self service for club members, the tip jar shouldn't be there. I left one of my favorite belongings accidentally at my club level room. I didn't realized it until I checked out and reached home. I called the housekeeping manager and left her two messages on a Sunday and Monday, and she never return my calls. I called the front desk and the associate was very understanding and contacted the person who inspected the room. She called me several hours later and said he didn't see anything. She suggested me to call housekeeping again the next morning but again no one picks up the phone. She asked me to contact guest relations manager if I can't get a hold of housekeeping but I got a voicemail. I left a voicemail for the manager to call me back and she never did. After 5 hours later, I called front desk again and I got to speak to the same associate who assisted me and she said she personally went to the housekeeping manager and told her the issue, and they looked through the lost and found again but couldn't locate my belongings. She said that there is nothing else they can do unless the cleaner found it and give it to them. So I said the cleaner stole it then? She says most likely it was. But because I left it there, it was difficult to ask it back from the cleaner?? At this point, I gave up!! Credit is given to the front desk associate for helping me but the problem was not solved. They knew who cleaned my room and it was easy to confront that thieve to give me back my belongings. But they didn't! The managers at this hotel are good for nothing, afraid to talk to their guests about an issue that occurred and let their associate deal with it.
user_name:
RavelsbenC
New York City, New York

review_body: I am an SPG member and am so disappointed by my recent stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. I reserved a Club Level room for one night. Upon arrival I noticed the rust in the bathroom both on a shelf fixture and the shower curtain rod. The walls were scuffed, the carpet old and there were no luggage racks. I did not complain that night and decided it was one night and to just deal with it. The following morning I needed to iron some clothing and was appalled by the stained ironing board. I was hesitant to put a piece of white clothing on the board. After showering with poor drainage in the tub and standing in ankle deep water, I called guest services. I asked for a manager to please come to my room as I did not feel the room was Club Level room quality and hopefully not even what I thought Sheraton standards were for a regular room. I stated I would like a manager to see the room and I wanted to point out the issues. I really felt management would take one look at the rust and ironing board and be appalled. The employee asked if I wanted to change rooms. I responded I was checking out that day. She told me she would tell the manager my concerns "when she comes to work" - no manager on duty? On a Saturday morning? Then she hung up! I was in the hotel for several more hours but did not hear from anyone.When I checked out I was asked if everything was satisfactory. I again listed my concerns. The clerk told me she put 1,000 points on my account and acted as if that should satisfy me. I showed her a few pics I had taken and she just shook her head. I really am dismayed not only about the shabby room but the way I was brushed off by staff and ignored by management. I paid about $350 for a dismal one night stay. So disappointed in Sheraton. I usually only write positive reviews but not this time.

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for just under a week and it was a fantastic hotel. Great location, right near almost every subway, and just a couple of blocks away are many great restaurants, shopping, bars, anything and everything you could ask for in NYC. The staff was so friendly and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was the best (thank you again Collin!). Even the littlest of things, for example, saying have a great day when we left in the morning and welcome back when we came in at night was such a sweet gesture and made our stay seem so comfortable. I've never experienced a staff like the Sheraton Tribeca staff.We stayed in a club room and I would HIGHLY suggest it as you will receive one of the high floor rooms with an amazing view, and to top it off, access to the rooftop lounge that has complimentary breakfast, snacks and beverages all day, and from 5:30p-8:30p hor d'oeuvres, wine, beer, and select liquor drinks. Next time I'm in NYC I will definitely be staying at the Sheraton Tribeca. No doubt about it.

I have booked rooms for colleagues on business travel through booking.com. When the guests arrived, they were very badly welcomed and it was impossible to find their name in the system. One of the guest had to wait 2 hours before getting his room until the receptionist could finally find a solution - and you have to understand that the person has just travelled 12 hours all the way from Europe. This is not acceptable. This is probably due to a miscommunication between booking.com and Sheraton TriBeCa but there is no way that the guest has to be treated like that. But it's not the only problem we faced. Upon clients departure, the hotel has not provided the receipts of the guests stay (everything has been prepaid but no proof of payment has been sent to me) AND on the top of that, an extra amount has been withdrawn from our company's credit card without any justification. When we received the credit card invoice, I have tried during basically A MONTH to reach them to obtain documentations. After 3 weeks, we finally received the receipts of the stays. It was last August; and until now we still haven't received the documentation related to the abusive withdrawal and no refund. Although its location is good, this hotel is average for a 4* hotel. I have nothing else to say about the hotel itself, but I surely don't recommend this hotel due to the lack of professionalism of its staff.

I enjoyed my stay very much. My room was very nice, with a spectacular view of the Empire State building. The rooftop was amazing as well.The location is excellent for exploring SoHo, Little Italy, and even West Village

We stayed here for a combination of business and family. The front desk and staff were great and the TriBeCa location was ideal for downtown area NY activities that are less touristy. The Antica restaurant is very good especially for a hotel. That's the upside. The downside is the rooms are 2nd rate and smaller. So if you can deal with the latter it's worth the stay.

The staff were extremely friendly and polite. The rooms were a comfortable size and the hotel is located in a perfect position for Little Italy and Chinatown, not to mention some of the hidden gems within a block. Have to give a big shout out to the barstaff too, awesome people.Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and will definitely be back

Very disappointing stay. Booked through a discounted travel site so got the smallest room at the hotel. Decor from the decades ago, although the bed was comfortable and the TV flat screen. The grab and go breakfast was very poor with no fruit option over the weekend and no fresh pastry. We tried to approach the manager with our complaints but none were available over the weekend and no one followed up during the week. The advertised roof deck can only be accessed by loyalty card holders. The hotel is immediately surrounded by very shady characters but after a block or two one is in the heart of TriBeCa and Soho.

The hotel is located conveniently close to my office which is a big plus. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is very clean. The room is weird! The closet is very very small and not functional, the shower is a disaster in the making because water can easily drip out. My other concern was that the bed was really old.

I took Amtrak into NYC Penn Station and then the subway to the Canal Street station. From there it was just a short walk to the hotel. Check in was efficient, though it can get very busy and the check in area is relatively shallow, and my room - overlooking Canal Street - was nicely appointed, comfortable, and, importantly, quiet and had black out curtains. Had a great view of the Empire State Building in the distance. All the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Very welcoming environment. There is a nice Italian restaurant on the ground floor as well as a business center, bar, and coffee shop. Seems like a lot but the lobby is so well designed that it doesn't feel cluttered. There can be longish waits for the three elevators - up and down - at peak times so plan accordingly.

I have stayed in this hotel for 6 nights for the business trip. The hotel is not really modern or not new, the reason that i choose this hotel because it is close to my office. The other advantage would be close to shopping area, which you just needs 10min walk under good condition of weather, you can access the shopping area near by.One of the issue would be the Room Key, i have experienced that few times that the Room Key was not working when you back to the hotel room. This is really frustration that every night when you back to hotel after all day tired work, you still need to test and try if your room key is workable or not. Don't know why this could be happened so often in such a group hotel. Also, the staff is not very helpful to resolve & they have asked me to go to reception again to check on what happen on my room key...This is really bad experience for staying this hotel.Besides, the cleanness of the room is not really satisfy, feel the room is very dusty, especially on the table area. Also, there should have a free bottle of distilled water can be provided to room guest daily but my room does not....All in all, lots of areas to improve and hope this hotel can be getting better next time when I will travel to NY again.

I have stayed at the Sheraton in Tribeca twice now while in town for work, and have had fantastic experiences both times. The rooms are a standard size for NYC (smaller than you're used to, but liveable), but are immaculate, well priced relative to the area, and have very comfortable beds. The roof terrace is an added bonus and the location (right next to the subway) is very convenient. Shout out to Rhondalisa at the front desk, who was incredibly positive / attentive.

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for a little 5 day trip. This was the best hotel experience I have ever had. Super helpful staff, nice and quiet rooms with very comfortable beds. We got a king bed which was super soft and had really nice pillows. We slept beautifully after long days of walking in Manhattan.I really cannot say enough about the staff. Apart from everything else being amazing, the staff were incredibly friendly and polite. When we return to Manhattan, we will definitely be staying here again.

I stayed at this hotel for almost one week in a Club room. It was nice to have Club Access, but it didn’t quite blow my socks off, as the Club food was nothing to write home about and they would run out of certain items (particularly during breakfast) and not replace them. However, contrary to the previous review, to me the selling point (redeeming quality) of the hotel is the roof terrace. The views are pretty good, particularly on a clear night looking at the lights of the empire state building.The location is pretty good, if you like the SoHo/ Tribeca area. (This was our first time in the area and we really liked it, as it is a bit bohemian / grungey.) The rooms are small and tired, even by NY standards. Personally, I would have expected more of a Club room. (It is literally impossible to swing a cat by its tail. Lord knows what the non-club rooms must have looked like.)Housekeeping was pretty bad. It was not uncommon to see dinner trays in the hallway outside rooms well into the late morning. Again, I would have expected more.On balance, next time we’ll probably stay somewhere else.

I picked up a room at Hotel Tonight for a great rate. The hotel is on Canal Street, which was convenient for a couple of meetings I had planned to attend. The staff was gracious. The room however, petite. There were two small windows in the corner, so it was also rather dark.I did add club suite so I could grab soft drinks, waters, and a snack or two. Since I was there for only one night I did not ask for a room change. But frankly I would rather not stay again.

This hotel is not a good value. I am SPG Platinum and tried to use my Suite Night Awards - not only were my Suite Night Awards request not granted, but I received one of the worst rooms in the hotel and no club access. The receptionist checking me in was brusque but efficient (no welcome, no thanks for being a member, no option of what I wanted as my platinum amenity). The rooms are small, even for Manhattan. The city skyline views they tout on the website consisted of a view of the entrance to the Holland Tunnel. No one was available to help me get a taxi when I had to leave at 4 AM to catch a flight, meaning I had to schlep my luggage by myself all over the block chasing one down. There were a large number of empty bottles and used plates and cutlery left on a table right outside my room (not by me) and it took 2 days to clear - even after mentioning it and even when housekeeping was right there, they did not clear it!
user_name:
TardisCitizen
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel in great location. The top point is the Club Lounge on 21st floor with grand terrace. You can pay to access it ($50) per day per room. This includes breakfast and evening snack with wine and beer. With Amex SPG card access is free.On top of it the service great too. Highly recommended.

My husband and I came to New York for one night to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary. From the minute we walked into the lobby to the minute we left the staff were absolutely top notch. Kate at reception was a true star and helpful. She made our stay a really special one with some added extras to make us feel really special.The room was clean and well appointed, a great location, great view. The club lounge and rooftop bar are absolutely worth booking. Free drinks, finger food and breakfast .. Wow!Thank you!!!!

We stayed 4 nights on the top floor with great views of the river and with access to club lounge. Room was big for nyc having king bed, pull out sofa bed and a small round table with chairs. Check in was a bit slow with front desk staff being awfully perky.  We called housekeeping to make up the sofa bed and basically he came in pulled it out and said there u go in a condescending manner...if that's all I wanted gosh I think we could have managed that...I then had to explain that my daughter has extremely bad allergies and I wanted the bed made with new laundered sheets. He tried to convince me the sheets are changed automatically after every stay though he could not guarantee that it was done.. I highly doubt this is standard practice as the sheets looked dingy and stale. After explaining the reason a few more times, he reluctantly went out and got new sheets and grudgingly made the bed though he would not get us new pillows or blanket. Having club access was definitely a plus in our stay. The breakfast was basic (eggs, sausage, some fruit, juices, baked goods, coffee, tea etc). The outdoor terrace was a great place to hang out and enjoy views of the city. The evening hors d'oeuvres n drinks were great and the gentleman who served the drinks was extremely friendly and helpful. The kids liked the Dare type cookies.Location was great for lower Manhattan but was a bit tricky and busy for us since we drove. Parking was in a lot around the block..$65 for valet and $57 for self park.

On the surface, there is no reason why this shouldn’t be an excellent hotel. Location is good, near several subway lines. Room sizes are on the small side, but that’s only to be expected in NYC, and facilities (in-room coffee maker etc) are well thought out. The top floor Club Lounge has fantastic views over lower Manhattan and the two rivers.Nevertheless, without doubt this was the worst Starwood stay (indeed, probably the worst stay anywhere) that I have experienced in over thirty years of travelling.The organisation and delivery of housekeeping services is this hotel’s greatest problem.On two of the four days we were there, housekeeping passed us by and phone calls to Guest Services (on both occasions!) resulted in accusations of the Do Not Disturb sign being left on the door- it wasn’t: there was a strong sense that Guest Services pushed back and blamed the guest for any issue that was brought to their attention. Servicing eventually happened, though we never managed to get any Shower Gel left in the room, or Non-Decaf coffee bags for the coffee maker, either. Add to this a bathtub that needed an engineer in order to drain, and air conditioning only part-functioning throughout the first night and you’ll get a sense of some of our frustrations. The magnetic-stripe room keys are clearly past their best; both of ours needed recoding on practically a daily basis - and yes, of course we weren't keeping them near phones or clasps.The greatest single error, though, resulted from only half of our laundry order being returned. Eventually the hotel accepted responsibility for this, but only after blatantly accusing one of us of telling lies. When “Perhaps you’re mistaken and you never gave it in” was rebutted with the promise one of us had taken a photo of the order form, duly dated that morning, the - very rude and abrupt - Guest Services handler stressed “We have checked the cameras and can see the floorman delivering all your laundry to your room, so you must be wrong and it’s in there!” Those were her exact words. Only after the point was made that, if she could indeed see two pairs of clean gents’ trousers going IN the room, she would certainly see them going OUT as well, did she backtrack and say- actually- she couldn’t tell what the laundry was after all.Staff on the front desk, meanwhile, were always understanding and accommodating, doing their best to solve all issues. We left without half our clothing but with a complimentary car to the airport and promises that our missing garments will be sent on to us as soon as they turn up. Time will tell… we’ll keep you informed of any developments, though we’re not holding our breath.So, if you’re looking for a well located hotel; you’re not too bothered about other services; and you value the Club Lounge view and can afford it or are certain to be given it then certainly consider the Sheraton TriBeCa. If not we suggest you can find much better elsewhere.

I want to preface this by saying I am not someone who reviews places ever, even is the service is suspect. I usually come on review sites like this and think "wow that person is high maintenance there is no way it can be that bad". But here I am. To start, the lady at the front desk was giving us a very hard time at check in because of our Canadian credit card. (We can't be the first Canadian couple to stay here). Next, all over the site there are pictures of a rooftop patio, when I requested access from the same lady she said I needed to pay an extra $30 to get up there, I offered to pay cash, debit or credit and she said it wasn't doable because of my room type. The amenities were bad, the location is sketchy and loud and when checking out the manager scoffed at me for having ordered 2 robes and calamari to the room for my wife's birthday. Moved to the Ace Hotel for not much more per night and it feels like absolute heaven. Don't be like me and take the cheap option! Other issues I forgot to mention:-leaky shower-no fan in bathroom-tv from 2001-terrible bar and room service

I really enjoyed this hotel. If you stay in New York, you know you'll have small rooms and pay a fortune. This hotel is a good value for New York. Yes, the rooms are typical size for a New York hotel, however, I had ample space. The rooms are very clean, and lovely. In addition, they have a free breakfast each morning which is a true value. The staff is also very friendly.

This hotel is smack in the middel of Tribeca. An area I enjoy as it is situated close to Soho, Greenwich Village and Chelsea. The hotel is close by to several subway stations. The rooms are classic american style rooms, I believe the hotel has been renovated some time 3-5 years back. The beds are very nice. Bathrooms equally so albeit a bit small. Just next to the hotel is a 24h-open Deli which I appreciated. Bought all the breakfast there. Would recommend this hotel both for business and/or other leisure.

Staff was overall friendly. The room was clean but outdated. The bed was ok but the pillows were terrible. Sheets and curtains were stained. Towels were torn. Airconditioning blowing straight to bed. Bathroom airvent didn't work. Overall air ventilation was really poor. Terrible noise from the streets. Pre-ordered breakfast was not delivered. Otherwise everything was ok.

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a long wedding weekend. It's comfortable, clean and within walking distance of lots of great shops and local restaurants (Check out Tribeca Bagels next door for cheap 24/7 eats). The front desk is unfortunately located very close to the front door, so it was often a bit chaotic in that area, but the staff are polite and incredibly helpful. The rooms are small but well laid out, and aren't exactly soundproof (lots of city and plenty of hallway noise, as we were located near the elevator).

Awesome welcome by Carlos, very polite!! And then Rhonda at reception was so kind and nice!!! Rooms are small yet nice and comfy. It was our wedding anniversrry, they gave us access to roof patio!!! Wow this is awesome view of NYC with free hors d oeuvres. Thank you so much, Ill subcribe ti Sheraton club!!

The hotel itself was modern and clean. Restaurant bar and computers downstairs and the staff were all very helpful. We were luckily allowed to check in a bit early which was great. Also had help in Getty a cab when we checked out. The bathroom. With nice and modern, and the bedding was very comfy. No noise in the room from the busy street outside. Canal street itself isn't nice, a few blocks further toward financial district much nicer feel. After dark there were a few groups of young men hanging around the streets, and while nothing was said or done directly to make us feel threatened it did make us feel a bit uneasy. Was within walking distance to a lot of areas such as Hudson eats, 9/11, Liberty cruises, little Italy and Chinatown. Overall,if the motel could be moved as it is I would stay again, but now knowing more about its physical location and what the surrounding areas are like.

Although the room was small, this was expected of a city like New York. The hotel staff were attentive, they held on to a package we couriered from Las Vegas for 2 weeks with no hastle, all belongings still safely where they were left. I did expect more from the "Soho" district as i heard this was a luxurious neighborhood, but that's not the hotels fault, The hotel is not too far from the subway and from bus stops, so transport should not be an issue, the hotel has a Starbucks at the ground floor which is perfect for grabbing a coffee and running out to the see the city. Overall an amazing experience at the Sheraton.

First time at this property and really enjoyed it. Fery the bellman was a great guy -- very helpful and happy to help !! All the staff were very friendly. Room size was as expected. Next door to the post office and really near bus and subway stops. Excellent location. All in all a very nice stay

Was told we'd been allocated a quiet room on arrival, away from street noise and the elevator. Wasn't quite sure what to expect, but sure enough our room was very peaceful. Stayed for three nights in mid July when the city was baking, but the aircon made the room very comfortable. Didn't use any of the hotel facilities, restaurant etc. but the receptionists, porters and concierge were extremely helpful and we got free wifi which hadn't expected. Great Deli next door open all hours and subway nearby. Would definitely stay there again.

We arrived at the Sheraton on our Honeymoon and they had chocolates and wine waiting for us in our room. Our room was a great size, really clean and the bed was so comfortable. We had a city view which was amazing. The staff are always willing to help and are so friendly. Central location with walking distance to 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park, Soho, China Town and Little Italy. Lots of selection of restaurants around and close to Hop on Hop off tours. Overall highly recommend!
user_name:
Alexia S
Wellington, Wellington, New Zealand

review_body: I cannot rave enough about the stellar customer service that I received at this hotel. 100% props to Colin Hughey, who took the best care of me, before I even arrived. Here are the details...1. I called before booking the room to get details about the room placement, what the inside looked like, layout, etc - you name it, I asked (yes, I'm a bit OCD). Colin is the one who answered. After over 30 min of all of these questions, he was never annoyed. This alone made me want to book the room.2. So I booked my room, and got upgraded! But before we go there, please let me elaborate on the customer service here. When I walked in, I literally felt like I was greeted as though I were I celebrity. Everything was extremely kind; you could tell that they loved their job. The staff wanted to make sure that any of my questions/concerns were addressed. I cannot stress enough how pleasant this staff was.3. I walked into my room on the 21st floor, with gorgeous views, a lovely welcome gift, and access to the club lounge, which serves food for breakfast and happy hours. The view from the outdoors access of the lounge is just so awesome (rooftop). My room was super clean and spacious, which was great since I was staying there for a week, prior to a 2-week Europe trip.4. Location cannot be beat. It's right in Tribeca/SoHo. A bunch of great restaurants (really good Italian one around the corner), and quick access to the train (got me to my BK Dumbo office in 16 min).I was seriously speechless at the quality of customer service before, during, and after. And this, coming from someone who has literally traveled the world (Asia and all over Europe, Caribbean, French Polynesia, etc), and stayed at multiple five-star resorts... I'll tell you this: the customer service here was as good (in some case better) than some of the 5-star resorts at which I have stayed. This is my new fave in NYC, so much so that I almost didn't want to share this new secret! ;)

We liked the location here a bunch. Close to Soho and downtown and Chelsea and everything else you need with a unique Canal Street backdrop. Fantastic rooftop lounge with tremendous views. Rhondalisa at the front desk is an asset to the SPG organization and made us feel welcome and important every time we walked by. In contrast, I'm not sure the person that checked us in cared much about where we stayed. It was a deep contrast but the good far outshone the bad.

We arrived very late after a delayed flight for our July 4 weekend trip to NYC. Great location close to subway to get around. Walkable distance to Stock Exchange and free ferry ride to Staten Island. We also were upgraded to Club Level with free breakfast and snacks throughout the day. Great rooftop lounge and we were even able to see the fireworks from our room for the 4th. It was great!

so have stayed the last 4/5 years and always been good So the good points on location and sleep quality remain - as do the positives on helpful check in etc. I have always paid extra for a Club Room for the inclusive breakfast, afternoon snacks and access to roof terrace. If I returned another time I wouldn't now pay extra for a Club Room The hot options at breakfast have been cut down (no bacon or potatoes) and its now plastic knives & forks - yes really. Afternoon snacks also a real let down - first night of 7 at least had small club sandwiches but after that not much really and no hot options which is different to previous years. So hotel still a good option but wouldn't pay the extra for a Club Room

I had the worst hotel experience in over a decade thanks to Sheraton TriBeCa. It was pre-booked through corporate for a conference and prior to flying in I tried to get it switched to no avail. My gut was right. Upon checking in the first room we went into still had candy/cookie wrappers and crumbs left in it on the nightstand from the prior guests. We moved a room down the hall that was "clean" and the sink stopper wouldn't open. So at about 3pm we called down and requested an engineer to fix it. Went to the gym and came back at about 7pm to find it untouched. Called down again to let them know no one came and got ready and went out to dinner. Came home at about 11pm to find it was still not fixed. Called again and they said they would send someone in the morning. Mind you this whole time we weren't able to wash our hands or brush teeth etc. in our room because the sink wouldn't drain at all!! Luckily we were able to shower and use our gyms bathrooms that evening... Finally the next morning at 7am we call the *FOURTH* time to get someone to fix the sink. They said "they would *try* to find the engineer". What does that mean??! Engineer rolls in at 745am and doesn't have it fixed by 8:10am. Asked him to step out so I could shower before my meeting and he said he would be back at 830am. He uses our room towels to semi dry the floor leaving brown water and gunk everywhere. 9:15am and still not back so we left for the morning. Literally have to call a fifth time on day two for them to get it fixed and cleaned. On top of all this obvious stuff, the room was dated and dark. Small as can be expected in NYC, but also filthy. (See photos of a human toenail clipping under a night stand and random unidentifiable objects and dust under and around the bed/night stand. No excuse under the sun for this. Will never return. Advised the event not to use this hotel going forward. So glad to check out of this hell hole.

Stayed here for a few days for a recent business trip. In the middle of a great neighborhood (more local) off of Canal street in Tribeca. Was able to do all of my business in lower Manhattan without fuss. Better at night that Midtown with some decent restaurants nearby. Close to the Holland Tunnel, so a great location if you are flying in and out of EWR. Nothing fancy, but nice people and a solid business hotel

This hotel was amazing! Great staff-especially Dion from the club lounge. Club lounge is amazing...makes your stay. Free food and drinks from 5:30-8:30! Rooms were clean and newer. Couldn't ask for more!

Wonderful small hotel with excellent staff, great beds, quiet, Great views, patio on 21st floor, easy to get taxis, newspapers everyday, Nice TV package, in room safe. Slow elevators at rush hours, however stairs are not bad.

No way this is a 4 star hotel. Room was dirty. Street noise was bad.Hair in the shower and dust on the furniture. Same drink straw in hallway for 2 days. Bed lacked a fitted sheet and wound up sleeping right on a pee stained mattress. Avoid this place. It's tired and neglected. Try SOHO SIXTY. Light years better. Stayed there same time last year.

My wife and I got here around 10:30am. We were meeting friends for lunch and wanted to drop out bags off before we went. We never expected what happened next!! We were greeted at the front desk by Mia. She was absolutely delightful. Pleasant, personable, funny, kind and professional. My wife and I had just experienced an employee who is a true credit to her position. More people should be like Mia! So many people in our world are miserable at what they do. It is sad to deal with most employees. Mia should run the hotel. We let her know we just wanted to drop the bags off because we knew it was too early to check in..... She called housekeeping and had our room ready in 10 minutes so we could freshen up and use the bathroom before our lunch meeting. Wow!!Thanks for the great experience. We will be back. Chris and Lori h

After a lot of research I tentatively booked a suite, after phoning direct and wanting to know more information I was treated so badly over the phone I cancelled my booking, what is it with these businesses that the staff think that they are better than the customer these people who pick up a phone need to be taught some phone etiquette and manners

location is good, if you enjoy Soho and Village. Walking distance. Sadly Canal St is still a crappy street. We got to use Citibikes and got around the area and the city in a fun way. rooms were very very small but modern. For the price paid, it was a good hotel to stay. If back in the neighborhood, it will be a place to stay again. Love the pillows and the bed!!

Probably one of the hotels with the friendliest front desk staff in Americas. I have no idea how they managed to hire such constantly chirpy employees but they must be doing something right there.The location was the main highlight of the property, just a stones throw away from Chinatown, little Italy and Soho, good food was aplenty within walking distance. The subway station was also under a minute's walk away.The room we got was a corner room, the bed was comfy and we had a pretty swanky view of the empire state building. Room was cramp and small though - I hit toes twice on the roller desk chair because it was just not enough space between that and the bed. I'm a small Asian girl so you can imagine the space really isn't big at all.The property itself needs work, it definitely feels dated and old. One main gripe I had about the hotel was the lifts which had a system that would end up making guests wait way too long just for the lift to arrive.We had club access and went just once. breakfast was very very very basic (you have to make your own waffles) and the club lounge looks like a staff canteen.This hotel is okay for a very short trip and if you're out and about many hours in the day. We might try another SPG hotel in the vicinity next time.

Walking distance to World Trade Center and great restaurants and shopping in Soho. Lobby is always crowded because check in is right inside the door. Long waits for elevators. We travel with carry on only, so our luggage is small. The first room we were given was so tiny that there was literally no where except the desk to put my small suitcase. To walk to the bathroom we had to push the chair all the way under the desk and squeeze by (We are average size people). We went to the front desk to ask to be moved, and they insisted there were no rooms available, even though it was afternoon, and I am Starwood Gold. It was so unpleasant that we went back the next morning, and were finally moved to a room that was reasonable size for New York. Otherwise we would have moved hotels. Do not bother paying for club floor. It is extremely crowded and they run out of stuff. Breakfast is until 10:30, and by 9:15 they were out of bread for toast with no plans to replenish. The appetizer period is jam packed with people making this their dinner, and getting free drinks, even though it is supposed to be cash bar. We plan to check out the boutique hotels in the area for our next trip.

Arrived at 4 pm. Room not ready. Friend arrived same time next day. Same story.Room dark and a bit dingy. Cupboard door hanging off its hinges. Asked to change. Told fully booked. Advised to check again following morning. Did so, told could move to lower floor but room would be same (dark and unimpressive), despite $300/night price tag.Parking advertised at $55/night. On arrival, it would cost $65 a night "because it is a mini van. Disappointed. However, hotel location good.Asked for airmiles. Unhelpful receptionist said couldn't do this because only credited SPG points. Showed her the 12 foot high poster advertising Emirates Airmiles credits at the hotel 6 feet from her head. She denied her ability to give Airmiles. Asked her to credit SPG membership points. She said she had no record of my SPG membership number despite me giving it to Sal the receptionist the day before. Then said she couldn't credit SPG (Starwood) points at the hotel. Singularly irritating. I am former General Counsel of a business group that owns several hotels, including Sheraton and Four Points hotels. The service was disinterested and unacceptable. This was my first stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa. It will be my last.
user_name:
Khalid K
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Hotel was clean and friendly. The location is amazing. It's within a 5 minute walk to most subway lines, shops, restaurants and tourist shops. Very easy to get to most of the tourist sights. You have Soho about a 10 minute walk away to all designer shops and little Italy and Chinatown within 10 minite walk too.

Staff were incredible. Room was clean, nice and relatively big considering nyc. Beautiful rooftop for starwood club members facing empire state building. I will be back at this hotel soon. Pizza, breakfast and shopping very close. Like literally soho is across the street.

From what I can gather, if you don't have "club" level status for your stay, don't bother staying here. We didn't, and massively regretted chosing this hotel for a miserable 5 night stay. This hotel is nowhere near 4 stars by any stretch of the imagination. If you are a one night stay businessman then fine, if you're a holidaymaker, go elsewhere.The receptionists are very nice and polite. As are other staff we encountered.The room was very small even though we booked a "delux" (HA!!!) king. The room was terrible. The carpet was brown and covered in dark stains. The bedding was old, had holes in and the pillows were disgusting. Even the curtain was stained!! We'd slept really well in our hotel off Times Square and this was a real come down, we didn't sleep properly at all and it spoiled the end of our holiday.The bathroom was ridiculously small, and was smaller than just the shower we'd had in the hotel off times square. No space whatsoever. It was dirty and old fashioned. The sink plug didn't work. There was no bath plug. The towels were old, ripped, all different and stained.The desk chair seat wasn't attached to the chair. The tv was a joke, we had no signal on about 50% of the channels so couldn't watch anything. Our room overlooked Canal Street, which seemed to be the busiest street in NYC, 24/7. There was a traffic jam the first day we arrived and cars honked none stop until gone 3am. It doesn't matter how high up the hotel you are, you'll hear it.Housekeeping were a joke. They took towels away but didn't replace them. Didn't bother coming in some days. Never replaced anything we'd used in the room, just made the bed. I had to ask at reception for some new towels and some toilet paper!!!!When other guests on our floor had room service, they left their dirty plates outside their rooms. And there they stayed for 24hours. Even after I mentioned it to reception, they didn't get moved. The day after it was more plates, glasses and pizza boxes. Then we had the treat of coming back to two full trash bags left outside our bedroom door!!I'd spent a long time researching hotels for our holiday and feel like I made a massive mistake staying here as we couldn't wait to leave. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

we booked 3 nights in this hotel and had good time even if the price was high. The hotel is located near china town and little Italy,. the staff was helpful and friendly , they speak many lunguages. The breakfast was reach. our room was large , like all sheraton hotels, and wiith all modern comforts

We had an amazing stay at the Sheridan TriBeCa. Rhonda at the front desk gave us the warmest welcome and really went out of the way for us. She even recommended a great restaurant (Macao on church) on our first night there.The rooms are pretty basic but comfortable. The area is great for anyone that enjoys the eccentric side of the city - Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy. Just steps from TriBeCa, West or East Village. It was pretty quite in the evenings.We had access to the club floor for breakfast and happy hour everyday - which was really great.

Need to tell you that I am really disappointed with my stay. I will list the problems below.1) I asked a travel agency to book my hotel, as I am used to do. When I got here, the receptionist told me that I would not be able to get my points in SPG( Fidelity card) because I have not booked thru the SPG website. It is a surprise to me- and not a good one- because I am paying in the same way and the other times the same travel agency booked the hotel to me and I have received my points as usual. 2) I will have to leave one night before. It means I have planned to leave on Sunday, but I will have to leave tomorrow ( Saturday). Expedia, who booked the hotel, said Sheraton will charge the Saturday night fee anyway. It is an absurd, because I haven't canceled my reservation! I just need to leave one day before. 3) concierge: I was trying to get info about plays/ theaters in the city. I could not find anyone at the Concierge. I left a note and asked to leave the information in my room. Didn't have a feedback. Then, I finally met someone there and asked to check the cheapest price to watch Aladdin. She called me a couple of hours later and said it was 299 dollars. I decided then to go to the theater after work to check it. I got a ticket for 80 dollars and it was in intermediary place, because the cheapest price was 50 dollars!! I think it is really complicated since it is a touristic city and the hotel should offer a better service and support to the client. Again: I am really disappointed!4) yesterday I arrived from work after a long day and there were no hot water in the shower!!! How can a 4 stars hotel have this kind of problem and don't offer any feedback to the client? I called at the reception and the girl told me it was a problem and they didn't have idea at what time they would fix it!! I am sorry, but I am sick ( strong cold!) and needed to have a cold shower in a hotel 4 stars? You have to agree with me that it is terrible! And the girl said I would be compensate for this problem. Until now, I have not received nothing! Neither an apologize call. - Toodles bed dirty. How can it be possible?- Hotel is not in a good location/ neighborhood.

I often come to New York for work and decided to try a different hotel. I was very happy with the Sheraton. Front desk were great. I had a small issue with my booking and the took care of it quicky with no drama. The room was comfortable. I have to add the Club Lounge on the 26th floor was a great added value. Breakfast abd afternoon tea was well with the price. And the view was really nice. Again all the staff were excellent. Finally the location was one of my top decision points. Highly recommend.

We are not fans of staying within Times Square, but we still want a decent location. This hotel is within walking distance of ChinaTown, Little Italy and SoHo. There are also 2 subway stations within walking distance. Positives - Front desk staff is super attentive and friendly. Club Lounge was worth the upgrade as we were traveling with family. We had breakfast there every morning and an afternoon snack/drink. Rooms are small but manageable. Negatives - Housekeeping seems to be a universal issue. Heard guests complaining to the front desk and they also messed up my request. The lobby is small so depending on what time you check-in, it may be a little chaotic. Suggestion - Request a high floor to avoid some of the noise from Canal St.

I just came back from my 4 nights stay at this hotel. I loved it. It was clean, elegant, well distributed. The staff is friendly. There is a lovely woman who always has an amazing and contagious smile. Sheraton TriBeca is perfectly located. Just around the corner you can see a subway station that can taken you everywhere. The surrounding area is amazing. You can have stores, cafes, restaurants, clubs... The ground cero is 10 minutes away walking.I recommend 100 % this hotel

I stayed at this hotel twice while traveling to nyc for work. I enjoyed staying here. The property is fairly new and well built. The club lounge is probably the best any Sheraton has, mostly because of the open rooftop that gives you a tremendous view of the city. You may have to walk more to catch the subway to downtown compared to other areas but wasn't a big deal for me. Overall a very positive experience both times.

Spent one night at the Sheraton Tribeca and absolutely loved the hotel. It was a bit hard to find at first using our Google directions as we went passed the hotel (scaffolding in the front). Just went around a few blocks and pulled up in front while we checked in. Used valet parking and the guys were great. Even better? The front desk especially Sal. I am used to NYC being filled with rude, brisk people and everyone at the Sheraton was the complete opposite. We are platinum and we were thanked for our business and loyalty to Starwood. Booked two rooms and received club access. There was a slight snafu with one of the rooms not having two beds so Sal gave us a certificate good for two drinks at the bar ("where the hard stuff is that the Club Lounge doesn't serve"). Rooms were small but that is very typical of New York. Since we were there only one night, it was fine. I did notice that my husband's and my bathroom door was different than the one my son and his friend occupied. I did hear a some noise all night long from Canal Street though we were on a high floor so I put the ear plugs in. The club lounge patio was large and offered a lot of seating and great views. Of course, during the peak happy hour time, one woman was stretched out on a sofa using it as her personal tanning bed. Most people had a drink and then left. Did I mention that the food as well as beer, wine and soft drinks, bottled water etc. were complimentary.Location was great to get to an event in Times Square via the subway. We also walked easily down to the National September 11 Memorial & Museum. We also had great pizza by the slice just outside the Sheraton to the left on the corner across the street. Cheap and quick. The club lounge host recommended. Also, immediately to the left out the front door is a little grocery/market/convenience store that sells beer, some wine and sandwiches etc. Cheaper prices than the convenient stores closer to the subway.Honestly, this was such a great stay, I wish we could have been there longer than one night. Also, have to comment about the review below regarding the toilet. Those buttons on the top are water-saving features.

Decided to come down to the city for the weekend when we got a rate for this hotel too good to turn down. Very friendly and helpful service. All nyc hotel rooms are small, but they manage to put in everything we needed. We did request and received a quiet room - high and in the back. The room was very clean, comfortable bed, easily adjustable temperature that operated quietly. The hotel gets a 4. Neighborhood maybe a 1. If SOHO and Tribeca are supposed to be trendy, Canal street was left behind literally in the dirt. I would recommend this property if you get a good price. Just spend your time exploring other parts of the city.

not sure if it's the warm greeting upon arrival and going out of their way to let us check in early, or if it's the friendly "have a great time out" or "hope you enjoyed your day" when we returned from our NYC wanderings, but it's just such nice touches that are so unexpected in NYC but greatly appreciated. And if you can get club floor access, the lounge is nice, but it's the roof deck on the 21st floor that is just one of the finest oasises in the city.

Really good option for downtown. It is basically at the border of Tribeca and SoHo with Chinatown a few minute walk away. Numerous subway lines closeby. Room was nice with a good view.
