Club lounge was excellent. Well stocked with drinks and snacks, open bar in the evening and a rooftop with amazing views. Staff was very friendly. Enjoyed my stay here very much.

Our family spent three nights here and we left with mixed feelings. The good:*The Club Lounge is truly superb -- open balcony on 21st floor with stunning views of Manhattan on three sides along with tasty snacks and drinks. The staff here really hustled to take care of everyone. A+*Location is a short, easy walk to SoHo, Little Italy and ChinaTown.*Front desk staff and bell service staff make check in and check out fast, easy and welcoming. They always greet you warmly and sincerely.*The lobby and rooms are clean, inviting, modern and well maintained.*The price is lower than many other comparable mid-tier Manhattan hotels.The not so good:*On several occasions housekeeping failed to bring extra towels and toiletries (that we had requested) and we had to repeatedly call them.*The rooms are small.*The fitness center is tiny and not up to standards for a mid-tier Manhattan hotel.*Traffic is almost always congested on Canal (in front of hotel) and around hotel because you are very close to entrance of Holland Tunnel.Even with the caveats, we would still consider returning here due to the competitive room rate and the wonderful Club Lounge which we enjoyed each morning and evening. Plus, we tend to enjoy Lower Manhattan.

We love the Sheraton brand, so chose to stay here for a week long visit. The room was very small, even considering NYC standards. We paid extra to "upgrade" to a club room, however, we were kept in the same room and allowed access to the club floor...our room was on floor 9, the club on floor 21, hardly convenient considering there are only 3 elevators for the entire hotel. The bed was not a typical Sheraton, much less comfortable, the pillows were flat. We're only provided 1 towel per person. Room was not restocked with clean cups with room service. Disappointed!

I'm back here after more than one year; this time with my family. There was a clear de-improvement in the service: both front desk and housekeeping, adding to the scaffolding outside, did not make us pleased. I know it may be hard to maintain servicr, but... We had reservation for three night, at the front desk they said we did nit; their system showed only two nights. However, we had the printed reservation so they ended up granting the printed info. Nevertheless, stressful! The location is great and we like SoHo.

This was our last stop on a one month tour, which included stays at 5 SPG group hotels. The two other Sheratons we had stayed at were tired and distinctly average; this one was a different proposition. Who would have thought a New York hotel would have friendlier service than ones on the South or the mid-West? Well, this one did. The major advantage for us, being Platinum members and therefore having access, was the SPG lounge n the 21st floor. The roof terrace was brilliant, with clear views of the Empire State Building and the Hudson River. The young lady who ran the lounge was very good, very professional, and dealt well with some fairly difficult customers - this included people lighting cigarettes on the terrace. Perhaps the hotel should put up some "No Smoking: signs to avoid guests eating food being choked by smoke.Overall I would recommend this place. It has a good location, close to the subway, and is in an interesting area of Manhattan. But the selling point for me is the staff and their service.

Just wrapped up a few days at this hotel. Let's start with the good. The location is excellent. Tribeca is a nice neighborhood and you are essentially on the border of wonderful Soho and very near the West Village. So location wise, this place is really great. It's a given that NYC hotels are really expensive especially with respect to value. My room was the cheapest I could book on their site and it was roomy enough for one person. Might have been a little tight with two people but would have been manageable. Just not a lot of space around the bed for walking around the room. My shower was very modern and nice and the bathroom was just fine. I also felt the front desk women I dealt with were very sweet and accommodating. I did not check out the gym as I was going to get a lot of fitness in during my trip via walking the streets of the city.The first floor offers things like a mini cafe, an Italian restaurant, and a full bar. I also seemed to notice a business center for internet, etc. Okay, so that's all well and good. Let's talk about the things I did not like First off, what is up with bathroom door having a rather large split down the middle of it when closed? Who thought this was a good idea. Essentially, if you really wanted to, you could look into an occupied bathroom if someone was in it and had the door closed. Really weird and gross. I've attached a photo in my review so you can see what I mean. Also, the flushing mechanism on the toilet is annoying and confusing. One, it's not a handle. You need to reach directly behind you and push a button. Second, the button is essentially two buttons in one that can be pressed individually or both at the same time. I can assume what is supposed to be pushed for when but again, how about a simple handle on the side of the toilet? Perhaps the idea here is that they won't break off as easily? Regardless I find it puzzling and it's in a bad location on the toilet. (I've attached a photo to show you what I mean.)The immediate interior is also no good at this hotel. As soon as you walk in you see a huge pillar that essentially takes up prime real estate at the check in desk. There simply isn't too much space in the immediate front area of this hotel because of this damn pillar. I imagine this hotel is a mess during long lines for checkout in the morning, etc. You should consider the Hilton Garden Inn. Roughly the same price as this hotel and very close by. I would probably stay there next time just to compare. Hilton Garden Inn has a nicer restaurant in the hotel which you can tell just from the photos online. Overall, yes, I recommend this hotel. Great location, friendly staff, solid price. But I wouldn't call it anything more than solid. P.S. The pillows were way too soft and not comfy. Would have appreciated something firmer.

I never thought you can get a great view anywhere in Manhattan. We were lucky to get a free upgrade to presidential suite. I can not imagine how astronomical the rate for the suite was, but by no means I could describe it as presidential. Considering it was Manhattan, the size of the suite was tremendous, but decor, furniture looked like they were well kept....since 1980.The view from the suite was good, but club absolutely had the best views. I can not remember what I ate, I just went there to sit on the outside terrace and enjoyed the view.

Sheratons have not been getting the TLC they needed under Starwood, so maybe that will change with the new ownership of Marriott. This one, however, was not broken down and dingy, despite being heavily trafficked and in a busy area. Well, there were a few items that needed repair, but overall it looked pretty good. While the room was pretty basic, the concierge lounge for Starwood guests had a wonderful view and pretty decent food & drink. We got a very cheerful and enthusiastic reception all staff we encountered were the opposite of the NYC stereotype. The bar and restaurants, while we didn't try them, looked very nice. Basically, it would be nice if other Sheratons were brought up to the level of service and organization we experienced in Tribeca.

The rooms are small like most NYC hotels. The service was decent - not great but not bad either. The room is decently appointed as is the bathroom. We had a suite with a large balcony where the balcony looks like it might just be bigger than the room itself! The balcony is on the backside of the building and faces an alley where the garbage truck collects garbage so it's smelly and noisy. The rooftop terrace offers fantastic views of NYC. I agree with other reviewers that it is decent but not quite high-end.

My husband and I left the kids home for a weekend away in NYC, and stayed at the Sheraton in Tribeca. We were very impressed with the hotel and there's nothing I can think of that I would have changed! When I booked the room I added a note requested the highest floor possible, and they didn't disappoint when we arrived and they sent us to the 16th floor. Although straight out our window was another building across the street, we could look down the street a little and see a great view of the skyline. They even did a great job handling at 3:30am fire alarm (which, luckily, turned out to be false!) - while the fire company and alarm company were checking things out, the staff provided bottled water to all the guests who were gathered in the lobby and in front of the entrance. Talk about an exciting first night! The rooms were very clean, decent sized, and everything was in great condition. The staff was friendly each time we left and returned to the building, and there were lots of great restaurants and spots for drinks, as well as the subway, within easy walking distance - we would certainly consider staying there again on our next trip!

I stayed here with my mom over the weekend. The hotel was lovely, staff were friendly, location was nice. UNTIL.... Sunday evening we dropped off our shopping bags after a long day of shopping to head to dinner. To our dismay, when return our Bloomingdales bag with my mom's dress and shoes for my brother's wedding was MISSING! Gone. Vanished from our room! We went to speak to the manager, Colin, immediately. He reviewed the video and entry to our room. He confirmed that over the day housekeeping had been in 3 times. THREE. Using 2 different keys. Two of these times were while we were at dinner. He reviewed the surveillance video and only saw them leaving with bags of towels and sheets... as if they couldn't have hid it inside. He bought himself time by saying he would chat with the maid the following day (at this point it was 1:30AM and we have a flight to catch the next day). We waited around all morning for him to confront the mail... hadn't heard anything... we eventually touched base with Colin when he said he would **maybe** file an insurance claim if we had the receipts. We gathered our information and went back to chat. At that time, he came off as insulting and patronizing. Basically said "sorry you can't prove it" and dismissed our claim. He said he would file a claim with the insurance- but we got the feeling nothing was going to come from this. He completely knew we had to catch a flight back to Canada and took complete advantage that we were powerless and didn't have time to file a police report. End of the day, we have no confirmation of any insurance claim being filed by Colin, a half apology and hours wasted trying to convince this man of our story. We came to the Sheraton Tribeca to enjoy our stay in NYC as we went dress shopping for the wedding and now not only are we dress-less, we're out the money spent on the STOLEN dress. Please, if you have the courage to stay here after reading this HORROR STORY, lock your things up. They'll take what they can get their paws on and won't compensate for it.

This hotel is in a great location. It is right near the metro, and not too far from the popular neighborhoods of Soho and the meat packing district. There is a great little bagel/ deli right downstairs from the hotel as well that you should try!The actual hotel itself is OK. The beds were really nice and comfortable however there was no bar fridge in the room which made it a bit difficult, and no microwave (however not so common!) and the rooms are quite small. Housekeeping did do a good job at cleaning the rooms every day. Luckily I requested a room on a higher level, as being on level 4 and facing canal street it is very noisy. I moved from level 4 to level 8, and on the opposite side from the busy canal street. Initially at the desk one of the ladies said no to me moving rooms, however I rang reservations when I was in the room spoke to another lady who helped fix it up (it always helps to ask!!). On a whole, the hotel was OK, the service was good and it is in a really good location.

Great location, decent sized rooms. Air conditioning that you could control so you didn't freeze. Staff friendly. I only stayed one night but would definitely return. Highly recommended. I didn't eat in the hotel but it all looked good. Also had free internet in the rooms which was nice.

Really loved this hotel! Rooms were small but modern and had everything we needed. We paid extra for a club room which provided breakfast, snacks and access to the rooftop area! It was totally worth the extra cost the views were stunning.Location is good right next to china town and subways!Would definitely return.

This is a fantastic hotel! I have stayed in the city several times, this hotel is far enough from the tourists but close enough to the action. The views are to die for. Rhonda at the front desk is a gem. I felt like we were family. William posses an awesome skill set to be able to motivate a fantastic staff and everyone we encountered treated us like royalty. We will certainly be back!

Stayed end of May 2016.This is a great hotel. Room was a decent size, clean and one of the most comfortable beds (& pillows) I've had in a hotel!!!The staff were really friendly and helpful.There is a nice bar and internet & printing facilities in reception.We upgraded to club level (after I'd asked) - 2 options were offered, either upgrade for access to the club lounge and sun terrace with breakfast/snacks only or a full upgrade to a club level room (including access to the lounge & sun terrace, breakfast and evening snacks & drinks). I would recommend asking about the upgrade option as the room we had was on the 19th floor with good views over the river and Canal Street and also high enough to not be bothered by street/traffic noise. The evening snacks included various dips, cold cuts, cheeses and biscuits but, best of all, wine & beer!!! Breakfast was a selection of breads (mainly different types of bagels), cereals, sausages, scrambled eggs, juices, tea/coffee. Soft drinks and tea/coffee are available 24hrs (for club level).The room was a good size and clean with decent facilities. Club level includes free WiFi access which was pretty good too.Hotel location is great - Chinatown & Little Italy are nearby, a 15 minute walk to Greenwich Avenue for some more bars & restaurants. A 10-15 minute walk to WTC. Canal Street subway is a couple of minutes' walk away to go uptown for shopping. Only downside is that, in the evenings, it becomes a bit seedy with a lot of homeless people on the street - not necessarily unsafe though.

Cannot say enough about this hotel and their staff. We had a flight delay which put us in after midnight. Nelson was awesome in getting us checked in quickly. We had two connecting rooms on the 19th floor with club lounge access. Rooms were clean, small( but what isn't in NY) but everything you needed. Still very loud even on the 19th floor. Lots of sirens and you can hear the hotel room doors slamming shut. If you are a light sleeper I would recommend ear plugs. They have snacks (granola bars, chips,pretzels and cookies) along with bottled water, soda, tea and coffee in the lounge. One of the best city views on their patio outside. You can enjoy your food or drinks outside. In the morning they have cereal, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, waffles, bagels, fruit, yogurt and toast. Nice little perk and probably saved our family of 4 easily $30+for breakfast. They also have a happy hour at 530. Fruit, cheeses and snacks were available in the evening. Every person on the staff we encountered were friendly, made us feel welcome and always helpful. Minutes from the subway station, 15 minute walk to Chinatown, Little Italy and shopping. Great area. Would definitely stay here again.

We are locals from the 'burbs who decided to spend two nights in the city. Our room was perfectly adequate, not as small as I feared from reading other reviews. Street noise was not unbearable either, our room faced Canal St., traffic was bearable. But our 1st morning there, striking Verizon workers started honking horns and yelling at 7am and didn't let up. Apparently their replacement workers were also staying at the hotel. Strikers decided to make their, and us innocent bystanders', morning pure misery. I know this wasn't the hotel's fault, but definitely left a blemish in our minds on the property.

Overall I really enjoyed my stay here, and would consider booking again. I came on a weekend in early June and stayed for 2 daysRoom/Property: Stayed in a room on the top floor. I realize that this is NYC, but the room was very small, so small in fact that the chair that's made to go with the desk didn't even fit, so it was off to the side. Having said that the room was very clean and well maintained. I also made use of the business center in the lobby which is a great place to get some work done. Location: Conveniently located near Tribeca and Soho - and near the ACE and 123 trains - great if you love shopping and want to stay downtown, but a bit far, if you have friends on the upper east like I doStaff - Great staff all around, made me feel like a king even though I was staying on points - the housekeeper even wrote a handwritten note thanking me for my stay. that's never happened before. Front desk staff was super nice and accommodating, let me use the business center for hours after I had checked out and even offered me water. All in all great service
user_name:
Sobarino
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband and I had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Chose to upgrade for access to the Concierge Lounge and was more than satisfied with the great breakfast spread: make-your-own waffles, oatmeal, sausage, eggs, bagels, pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit - exceeded expectations. Evening hors d'oeuvres included cheese, crackers, salad, smoked meats, snack foods, cookies wine and beer. And, all of it to be enjoyed from either the indoor lounge or the outdoor patio with a fabulous view of the Manhattan skyline. We were happy with our room - a standard king - bed was comfortable, linens were clean. Bathroom was great with a fantastic walk-in shower. To top it off, the staff was very friendly - always looking for ways to make the experience even better. Special kudos to May and to Sal - who were both outstanding. Hotel is convenient to all major Subway lines. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again!

The room was great, it was clean and taken care of each day. the staff were welcoming and friendly at all times. The location was awesome as we could get on the subway, walk or take uber any time. we loved it here.

This is a good central Hotel the room are a good size for being mid town and comfortableLocation is great for getting out and about and close to the subway Staff are helpful and polite Price is reasonable

For the 2nd year i a row I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca on a work trip to NYC. Canal street is an interesting stretch, but, this is a solid location at a great price point. The staff - super helpful & courteous. Free wifi was good and the outdoor lounge / deck on the 21st floor affords you a great view. The rooms aren't spacious - this is NYC though! I'd go back in a heat beat!

The Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel met and over exceeded our expectations!!!! As a couple, we have always wanted to come to New York City together, as we have each seen the city separately. From the minute we arrived at The Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel, Nicolas (at the front desk), was energized, friendly and completely professional. He had us checked-in within minutes and the room we received was beyond our expectations. We then needed assistance with scheduling our weekend plans, and Sass (the concierge representative) got us 3 amazing reservations. Sass took into consideration exactly what we were looking for and she delivered beyond what we could have ever expected. These reservations showcased how amazing New York City really is. Corey and Sal (both at the front desk), provided us with great recommendations for sight seeing that we took him up on and we were completely pleased with. Deon (at the Club Level Lounge), was extremely attentive and professional, it really showcases how well Sheraton Hotels train their staff. We watched first hand how Deon served a room of more than 60 people, with ease and contributing such a fun atmosphere for us on our vacation. Thank you Sheraton Tribeca for a wonderful holiday that allowed us to reconnect, enjoy great food and see what New York City has to offer.Our room was perfect and quiet, spacious and clean and exactly what we wanted and more. Overall, we couldn't have asked for a better experience with the staff. The lounge access with the drinks and appetizers were phenomenal and such a great addition for guests, not to mention that rooftop terrace has an impeccable view of the city, WOW!! There was ALWAYS a friendly, warm smile and helpful attitude anytime we walked up to the front desk. We truly felt right at home and that we could ask for help and assistance anytime we needed it. We absolutely will 100% recommend this hotel to our family and friends. The location was perfect and close enough to everything. Tribeca and SoHo has such a beautiful vibe that everyone needs to experience. Sincerely and looking forward to our next return!

We got an amazing deals when we booked this hotel. Normally something we would struggle with to afford.We got a great roon on the 10th floor with a view on the city overlooking the Empiire State building. Had a king sized bed which was actually huge. And free Starbucks coffee in the room. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was as well. Great big shower.The most important thing though. It was clean, which should be the number one thing on anyones list.We had a great time here and the because of the location (in between Tribeca and SoHo) we would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Stayed for 3 nights, 4 days.Happy staff with the big smiles, but went into the room and it was dirty - hair in the bathroom, the two glasses in the bedroom were dirty, marks on the bedsheets. Asked for the room to be changed which was done almost immediately. Now what were the chances of me find a bathroom with tiny strands of hair in a corner of the loo again? Slim I guess, but I saw them close to the door of the shower area. Ignored it as we were after a long journey. Before going out later that evening (5pm), we realised that the locker in the cupboard was not working. Told the person at the reception, said we'll send someone but nothing had been done when we got back past 10pm.The sleep quality that night was extremely poor, which went through all three nights. It was a big king size bed, but it really sagged. As my partner is heavier than me, I was basically sleeping at an incline! This really ruined my stay at the hotel as one wants to feel rested to explore a new city.As we were really tired the first night, we put the do no disturb sign outside our room - didn't want room service knocking at 10am. However, we did end up leaving our room by 11:30 am for the day when we removed the sign. The house keeping was visible across the corridor as they are in any hotel at the time. We also reminded the reception about our locker still not working.We come back around 8:30pm after a long day to realise that our room has still not been done and neither has the locker / safe been fixed. Go to reception and tell them and after we told them what time we left and removed the sign this guy says (and this is the stupidest thing I've ever heard and the man saying it jolly well knew he's talking trash!) "the problem is you removed the sign too late, but which time house keeping has already done a round to check which rooms need cleaning and which don't. If you need cleaning your room, the sign should be removed between 8am and 9am in the morning". That's ridiculous because it negates the purpose of a sign, if you really have to put an alarm to put that sign back on!! He followed to say the staff leaves by six so no one can do anything now, but agreed to send someone for fresh towels and to make the bed. Absolutely unpleasant experience. The next day we reminded them again about the locker / safe which was finally done by the time we went back that evening.Overall that interaction with the staff was not nice, the room cleanliness levels were average, not something to expect from a Sheraton and worst of all was the sinking bed which really left me begging for a good night's sleep.Would not recommend.

Near enough to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and Central Park, this hotel is an easy walk to most of mid-town and convenient to the subway. Rooms are a bit small - but that's the norm in NYC. That's not what makes you want to stay here.I travel here for work frequently. Despite being a decidedly tourist hotel, I stay at this Sheraton for many little things, and for two major reasons. One - the hotel gym is one that 'locals belong to' - meaning, it's no afterthought, converted hotel room. There are several treadmills, bikes, cross trainers, in addition to a full weight room and one set aside for 'floor work' (stretching etc) that's a bit out of the way. Two - Muhammed in the Concierge Lounge on weekdays consistently has a cheerful smile. Not just for me - I've just 'celebrated' my 51st stay - but for everyone I see him interact with. That kind of welcome in a big city makes my experience easier and makes the Sheraton a 'home away from home.'

I stayed here for 2 nights and would definitely stay here again. Highlights:*I couldn't have asked for a better experience with the staff. Sal checked me in and was able to accommodate my requests. I told him how disappointed I was with my last hotel where I spent 5 nights with family, and he immediately went to work seeing what he could do to make my experience here better. The other staff members were also extremely pleasant to deal with. There was always a friendly, warm smile and helpful attitude whenever I walked up to the front desk.*The location is conveniently located to at least 3 major subway lines. Minor downside is my comfort walking in the neighborhood alone at night, so I made it a point to return by taxi in the evenings.*The rooftop has a great view. With lounge access, you get 24/7 snacks and drinks, and the happy hour is substantial. HH had not only wine and beer, but a nice spread of appetizers. I didn't get the bartender's name, but he did a great job and kept the place running smoothly.*My room on the 18th floor was quiet -- especially appreciated after my previous noisy hotel. It was very clean but small. I had a corner room with a queen bed, and it would have been tight with two people, with not much room for storage. It would have been fine for a couple of nights for two. It was perfect for just me. I also appreciated having an a/c that worked. The room overall was very comfortable.*I didn't spend much time in Chinatown, but walked over to the LES Tenement Museum and Russ & Daughters Cafe. Highly recommend both.I look forward to the next chance I'm able to stay here. Thanks for a great first stay here, Sheraton TriBeCa.

What a nice surprise! Very customer focussed front desk staff. Room with double queen. Always convenient. With a view as well (1613). Good bathroom, water pressure so so. club lounge good food (really - fruits as well), with a terrace, which is nice in early morning sun breakfast.Location not very stylish (Canal street) but good for Uber, and get around financial district , downtown and midtown. Close to DUMBO as well. Would for sure go again.

The room is clean and has a good size (considering that you are in Manhattan), maybe a little noise outsideThe breakfast is poor, we tried just one and the quality, the options and rude attitude of the waitress invited us to explore Soho area

Really awesome staff. Beds were very comfy. Decent room for NYC, but I have stayed at better 4 star hotels in NYC. Price was very fair. Area of town is a bit icky and dirty, but I still felt safe. close to Subway stations. I would have given it 3.5 stars, but the truly wonderful staff bumps it up to a 4 for me. I would give them a 4.5 if I could.

As background, I'm SPG Lifetime Platinum, averaging 100 to 300 nights a year for the last 14 or so years. I have stayed at this property once before, a few years back, and I had a nice upgrade to a room in a low floor with a patio. So I thought, why not try this place again. WELL, it's fine if you are not expecting much or if the view from the club room (which is nice) satisfies you enough. For me, it's all about the room I get. And I got crap. Not only did they put me in a TINY room directly across the elevator (just to make sure I hear every conversation going to and from there in the mornings) but the (nice) lady that checked me in made a huge deal about my "Chinatown and Little Italy" view which, at this hotel, means THE CRAPPIEST VIEW (the others would look South, North or West…all are at least a view…see attached pic). AND nothing in the room waiting for me…no wine, no cheese, no card to welcome me. Again, I wouldn't care, except I spend hundreds of thousands of dollars a year at SPG properties and the big FU I got from this place at $369 (+ tax) a day is not appreciated. NEVER AGAIN!

I found this hotel to be quite nice and very reasonably priced for New York City. The staff are the ones who made my first impression exceptional. Very friendly and helpful.My room was very nice, clean, and well appointed. It was very comfortable. Not a negative, just an observation, my room did not have a refrigerator. Not sure if any rooms do, just be aware and maybe ask if they have rooms with if one is needed.Good location, although Canal street is quite busy.I will definitely stay here again.

I was quite excited about this hotel at first given location and price. I stopped staying here after a few weeks of travel as I found the rooms to be quite dark with their dated carpet. The biggest disappointment for me was the hotel lounge - at night they would still have out the pastries from breakfast that morning. It just did not sit well with me. The lounge however has one of the best views in the City.

This hotel is normally the go-to for tourists: inexpensive & near the subway lines. However it's also good enough for business travel. One plus is that it's near the F train, which takes you to Penn Station faster than any taxi would. The rooms are comfortable, there's a bar downstairs and plenty of delicious restaurants close by. Who wants to stay midtown when TriBeCa is so much more fun? The staff's demeanor is more geared towards tourists than tired business travelers. Other than that, it's a real find.

Great location for Lower Manhattan, a few yards from the Canal St subway. When we booked in we were told (by a very pleasant receptionist) that we were on a lower floor but as we were staying 5 nights, let the desk know if we wanted to change to a higher floor.We didn't feel too bothered about changing but realised the room was poorly laid out with no real storage for luggage or the clothes from the bags.This, along with the "Human Alarm Clock"which started at 6.30 am from Verizon strikers right outside our window (head office personnel staying in hotel), we asked to be moved and got the distinct impression that they were bothered, which it turned out to be true as we asked again later and got another no.Rooms clean and modern, reception staff either really friendly or not bothered.Disappointed in a small detail, that they had a coffee maker with coffee packs too big for the machine, drenching the tray. Also only enough coffee and creamer for two coffees, should be at least four to allow a drink in the evening and again in the morning.

Loved staying at this hotel. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful. It is in such a great position you can walk or subway around town. It has a restaurant, coffee bar and business centre. It is pet friendly. Next door is a little juice salad bar.

We were able to check in early after an overnight trip. Thank you to all of the wonderful staff at this property for a relaxing stay. Good location close to the subway and walking distance to many areas of interest. The view of the city from the Club Lounge balcony was spectacular. Lounge food offerings were standard Sheraton. Overall, this Platinum guest was impressed.

The staff at the Sheraton Tribeca are top notch and always make my stay enjoyable and comfortable. Weekly travel can take a toll and this particular Sheraton has all of the essential amenities, location near the Canal St. Subways, and Tribeca dining. If you're looking for a comfortable, convenient, and lower Manhattan hotel location, this is one of the better business hotels to choose from.

Just visited NYC and stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca. Good location, centrally located to SoHo, Tribeca, Greenwich Village, 10mins walk to Broadway and the subway on cnr of Canal St. Vast array of great shops and places to eat, all within walking distance. Hotel is clean, well maintained, staff in general are courteous, efficient and professional. Special mention to Mai and Nicholas (reception staff) who went out of their way to make sure I was comfortable during my stay, (Mai elevated me to an upper floor which was quieter.) Rhondalisa extremely welcoming to SPG members, but noticeably indifferent to the needs of non-SPG members! I stayed in Room 1911 (19th level) 1 King w/accessible shower for those in a wheelchair. Great views of surrounding area. This disabled access room can accommodate a wheelchair with relative ease, however turning circle is limited. Toilet transfer is from left side only. Bed super comfortable. No pillow menu, no minibar or fridge in room. Bathroom, consisted of shower with pulldown seat and handheld shower, toilet and handbasin in one room. All clean, modern and well maintained. Block out curtains in the room made all the difference and a necessity for staying in NY to subdue street noise, sirens blaring 24/7. Room service was slow, very large meals but very pricey, a burger w/fries $29USD incl.tax/tip. Hotel is situated b/w a gym (Planet fitness) and 24hr deli, Yogaworx yoga studio 10mins walk on Broadway.Would stay here again, accommodation was good value and clean. Easy to get taxis from this busy location, taxi ride in yellow cab to airport flat fee $52 (allow 90mins one way) depending on traffic.
user_name:
Charmaine W
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: My wife and I have just returned from a trip to New York staying at the TriBeCa Sheraton its location is great the hotel was spotless and the staff were out of this world , doing anything they could to help us ! We have both loved staying with the Sheraton and I would class the staff as friends I have met rather than staff Thanks for a great stay see you soon
user_name:
Stuart L
Derby, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed at Sheraton Tribeca for 5 days for business. The hotel, room, and location was quite decent, so I'd give 4-5 star for that.However, I wanted to report that something was missing from my room / suitcase. I called the hotel immediately after I checked out, so the item (if I had left it behind) should have been in the room or lost & found. Each time I called, they said they'd have someone call me back but nobody did. Since the hotel didn't bother to respond to my multiple calls and inquiries, I'm just going to assume it was stolen from my suitcase because I am almost certain I had packed it in my suitcase.

After numerous visits to NYC, and staying near times square, we decided to stay near the area that we prefer to visit while in NYC.First impressions were such a surprise. We were greeted with smiles and super services by Mia. From curb to room, took about 10 minutes, including a nice briefing about the area by Mia. Upon first glance this area might appear a bit unsafe, but we quickly found out that that was not the case. We took several evening stoles without a second thought. Location: This hotel is on the border of Tribeca and Soho. Easy walks to World Trade Center, Flatiron, Nolita, Greenwich Village. Subway is about 500 feet from the hotel. Subway ride $3 unless you get a discounted pass. Several restaurants and pubs are around the corner on Church Street. We really did enjoy being able to walk outside and not hit a "wall" of people which is so common while staying in Mid Town.Hotel: Lobby is nicely done and fresh. Adjacent to the lobby is a very nice bar, Sheraton Link, and an Italian restaurant.Rooms: Our room faced Canal Street and was very quiet. We were concerned that facing the street would be very noisy, but our room was on a high floor, so street noise was very minimal. Rooms are New York small, but nicely appointed. Room was very clean and the bed was divine. In facing Canal Street, we had a gorgeous view of the city skyline.There is a lovely roof top lounge to enjoy. We also enjoyed the club lounge offerings which were one of the most generous I have seen in a while. (Breakfast, Evening appetizers, and late night snacks)I previously mentioned Mia, as she was the most visible to us during our stay while coming and going. But I must also mention the rest of the staff. Everyone was cheerful and the service wonderful. This is our new NYC hideaway! Looking forward to visiting again!

If you don't mind being on the busy part of canal street, this is a fantastic option in lower Manhattan in a great location. Good things: The 6 train subway stop is very close by, the Hudson river and west side park are a 15 minute walk away. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and recognized my SPG status. We were in an executive club floor room, the room was small, but clean and comfortable with new decor. The best part of the hotel is the club lounge, which has a fantastic northern and western view of the city and river and a very good menu for food and drinks. This is definitely an outsized value hotel for NYC in the summer months.Less Good items: The elevators are small and slowThe section of canal street is very busy with cars, it's not a pedestrian friendly secton of that city block

Clean rooms, friendly staff and great skyline views from their rooftop lounge. Sal at the front desk saw to out every need. Breakfast and happy hour a pleasant amenity. Easy walk to the Brooklyn Bridge and 911 Memorial, which was our bucket list must do's.

We loved our stay here. First time in New York City. Started off with a very warm welcome from check in staff. Was great to discover an unlimited supply of coffee and drinking water. Loved the coffee machine with quality coffee.Clean room with very comfortable bed. Large room to for New York standards.Great location. A couple of minutes walk to Canal Street subway. An easy walk into the heart of the city. Easy walk to Chinatown. Close to convenience stores. Good bagel shop next door for breakfast.We would definitely stay here again.

All the people in the reception was very helpful and nice, always trying to please. The rooms are big enough (NYC average size) and fast internet.The location is very convenient if you want to walk through Tribeca, Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy. It's only three streets from the nearest subway station

I stayed here my a friend and our 2 daughters and we all had a blast. Everything from the amenities to the gracious front desk staff to the attentive servers at the cocktail hour and breakfast was remarkable.The property is very conveniently located to the subway, good restaurants, and different points of interest around the city. The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are modern, clean, and (by NYC standards) spacious. For SPG visitors, the hotel offers a lovely cocktail hour hosted in an indoor and outdoor lounge. Gorgeous city views are available whether you chose to sit in or out. The property also offer a generous complimentary breakfast in these lounges, which includes both hot and cold options. I had an amazing first experience at this hotel and would highly recommend a stay!

1st time we have been to New York so we were a little unsure. We had a plan of the main things we wanted to see. We traveled from JFK in a yellow taxi to the Sheraton Tribeca. Upon arrival we were greeted by the very efficient staff in the lobby. We were allocated a room on the 16th floor with a view of the New York sky line and the empire state building. The room was clean and comfortable. Bars and restaurants and general amenities all good. The hotel is well placed for the transport system.The underground is within a few minutes walk. The hotel is also within walking distance for little Italy and China town.  We used the underground system while there and found it the best way to get around. Any questions we had while in New York the hotel staff would always be on hand to offer advice and information, and always had a smile. At check out the hotel staff organised our taxi to the airport all we had to do was get in the car. We enjoyed our stay in New York. The 9/11 memorial museum was a particular highlight for me. The Empire state building, Ellis island / Statue of liberty, Cruise the Hudson river. Central park. Excellent.

No parking onsite, need to access a garage across the street. They offer valet but it is outsourced across the street. Staff very attentive, aim to please. Very cool roof top and view of mid town skyline.

I returned here, as I wanted to be in the Tribeca area, and my friend had a free SPG night that he needed to use. So I used it! This Sheraton is really on the very outside edge of Tribeca. It's really in Chinatown, although that's not nearly as sexy. Still, the location is truly convenient.I was on the 12th floor this time, in a connecting king room, and it was much larger than I remembered my last room. This time, the closet was actually useful. There was enough space for an armchair, and the room actually felt spacious for one person, maybe even two for a short stay. The bathroom was especially large for NYC, with lots of counter space and little bits of storage. I wish the lighting were brighter in the bathroom, but it's a minor complaint. My room came with club lounge access, so I had breakfast in the lounge, which was a hot mess. It was way overcrowded on a Sunday morning at 10AM. There were 2 staff members who did all they could to manage the overflow of people, and I appreciated that. The crowd Sunday morning was a weird mix of tourists and frequent SPG guests - I wished for a little bit more peace and quiet. The breakfast itself was decent. There were scrambled eggs and sausages for hot items (though in tiny containers that were quickly emptied). The best items were the pastries. I didn't think I would like the croissants and apple tartlets, but I ended up having two of each!I still have an issue with the front desk. I had to wait both for checking in and out. It always seems like a mess, which is disappointing. Also when I checked in, I was not told about club lounge access. That was confirmed when I called down to see what time breakfast was. The front desk staff needs to polish up their act.

This is really more of a 3 star hotel. The location is good for shopping and places to eat plus its near the subway. The rooms are very tired and shabby with scuffed furniture, towel rails coming off the wall etc we had upgraded to a club room but were very disappointed. Breakfast in the club lounge is included with the club room and the food was good but it is extremely busy and difficult to get a seat. The saving grace is the view from the club lounge terrace which is spectacular. There is free beer and wine between 5.30 and 8.30 when you can sit and watch the sun go down over the skyline. The terrace however also needs some upgrading . The staff are very friendly and helpful . If you are looking for a reasonable price with free breakfast etc and are happy to balance the poor rooms with the view then this is the place for you.

First, a tip. If you are driving in, book online a parking space in one of the close by garages. You will save a lot.As far as the hotel goes, our room was tiny! We often stay in N.Y.C. and know that rooms are small. This room did not have space to open one carry on bag! After rolling a bag on the side walk, the last thing we needed was to open it on the bed or the chair. We were on the 3rd floor, facing Canal street- the noise was awful! Sirens and cars during the day, trucks and sirens throughout the night. We were told the hotel was fully booked for the weekend, so no change. The lever on the toilet was broken, and the outlet on the bathroom wall was loose. Poor night sleep as the mattress was sagging. We were unable to change the room on the following day. When we returned at 10:00 PM, the room was not cleaned. The bed was unmade, the bathroom had the dirty towels on the floor. The girl at the front desk apologized profusely, and changed our room (yes, all of a sudden there was a clean room) and offered a free breakfast- does not make up for the inconvenience as far as we were concerned.. BTW, the second room was slightly bigger, facing a quieter street, and mattress was not sagging. This was the worst Sheraton we ever stayed in. Next time, we'll go back to the Sheraton in Brooklyn.

My husband and stayed for 3 nights for a short stay in New York. The hotel was a great base to explore from. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, shower was powerful ... Would have appreciated proper bath sheets but apart from that small niggle it suited our needs . It is an old style hotel and the decor is a bit dated as a consequence , but the location , a few minutes walk from Soho , china town , Greenwich village is ideal. The staff were super friendly and helpful and I would definitely be happy to stay again on my next trip.

It's never a guarantee but when a hotel can work magic to accommodate a early arrival off a red-eye flight, it's highly appreciated. Such as is the case here, where I arrived at 6:45 AM and they accommodated me with a room (after I had emailed them of course). They got me on an upper floor so it was relatively quiet so I could get a nap in. The room size is enough for one person (knowing how small rooms in NYC are) so that's good. However, the reason I didn't go to four stars is a couple things: the sink was leaking a bit, and the housekeeping was not complete -- dirty glasses left behind and not replaced, only replaced one towel vs. three that I started with for some reason. Just seemed like a rushed job. Next, room service -- while the food tasted good, the delivery was a little messy: left out a water bottle I ordered and didn't take it off the bill, and when calling, the person taking the call didn't understand simple requests and required someone else to get on the phone to complete the order.

We stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa several times a year, and keep coming back for 2 reasons: (1) great downtown location, near the subway and restaurants, and (2) superior service from the staff. We get early check-ins and upgrades to Club fairly frequently, but it's the little things they do that make it memorable. For instance, last year, when we told them we were celebrating our anniversary, they sent up chocolate covered strawberries. The staff seem to take a lot of pride in working there, and make us feel like we're at a luxury boutique instead of a chain.

Well you'll tell me, how not to have fun in NYC..... fair enoughRoom was exactly what to expect, good size very clean.The front desk staff, they were fantastic just by passing thru on your way out, or in they would always put a smile on your face. Great, hppy, dynmic and helpful, what else do you want.The location was great for tourists, super close to the underground but also very easy to walk to mid and downtown...Will probably think on coming back there for our next New York stay.Steph

My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca on Canal St for 2 nights. The location is just a few blocks east of Holland Tunnel and a short walk to Soho and Greenwich Village. Check- in was very easy. The staff at the front desk was great. Although we tried to upgrade our room to the concierge floor, they were fully booked. However, we were nicely offered concierge floor use and free wifi, as we had good Starwood status. Our room was small (typical Manhattan) but very nicely laid out and clean. The bathroom had modern fixtures and a nice shower head. Plenty of hot water. I like good showers.One small criticism- our bath towels could be a bit bigger. Bed had a padded top and provided heavenly sleep. Although we overlooked Canal St. w/ great view, the room was very quiet with good quality soundproof glass. I just needed to open the window to feel like I was on the street.Overall, our stay was very pleasant. The staff was exceptionally nice and helpful. Special acknowledgment to the front desk, and concierge lounge staff, and bell hops who really work hard and helped us giving directions, hailing taxis, etc. My wife really liked the concierge floor and their staff. They put out breakfast, and happy hour treats. The rooftop has an extraordinary view of NY skyline and hudson river.

I am travelling to NYC on business for the first time in many years. I am using HotelTonight to find rooms near where I am working. This has worked out well for me so far.Last night I used HotelTonight to book a room at the Sheraton Tribeca. I got a rate of $185 + tax = $216/night which is excellent for NYC. If you book at the very last minute day-of you can get an even cheaper rate.I arrived first thing in the morning, and was able to check in immediately to my room (proving that they really are not full). Good checkin experience, friendly and efficient front desk guy.The hotel was good. Extremely comfortable bed, clean and modern bathroom. Room was adequate size, a bit tight in places but not at all a problem. Small desk, again not a problem, I would not want to spend a lot of time working in my room. For me it was perfect: a decent fitness center, a restaurant, perfect location, near subway, and VERY comfortable bed. Good wifi, which is important.I will be back in 2 days and plan again to use HotelTonight to snag an excellent rate!

I absolutely love this property. Perfect location, clean rooms, wonderful staff. This was our second stay in 6 months couldn't ask for a better place for price! Restaurant is also good for a quick bite, little pricey tho but to be expected in NYC.

We booked a Club Superior Non-smoking room with Lounge access almost two months ahead. And when we checked in at 8pm there was no available room. We waited half an hour at the reception and got a "similar" room located on a lower floor. The room we got is much smaller and didn't get cleaned properly. Bed sheets were not changed, no floor mat in the bathroom, no mouthwash, no tissue...... Not to mention the noise we got. The lounge also pretty sucks, no enough food, in a very small, awkward room. If you want to stay a hotel room like this, you can simply choose much cheaper motels or extended stays. Surprisingly disappointing experience.

Although I required, they denied to present me the total due amount when I checked out. Besides, the check is confusing. It doesn't tell the correct amount paid. More than half an hour to have the detailed check and I didn't get the receipt. The same happened to a couple of other guests.

I just returned from a week stay at this hotel; booked 3 rooms, all Club Lounge accessible. There, my wife and myself in a Superior room, that has a coxy living room area; (paid with SPG POINTS, 5fth night free, THANK YOU), could "stretch out", prior to, and after, gathering with my Brother, and my Godson and girlfriend, quartering at the other two rooms. Another Brother also flew in from PR, with his wife, and joined us for a week of FUN!; Broadway Shows, NBA games, restaurants, shoping, and walking up and down, in and out, museums all over the place. At least 3 different subway stations within 3 blocks of the Hotel, one literally just around the corner, made it really convenient headquarters. At the Lounge, we would "reconnect" before 10am for breakfast; where Ligia would meet us, and present us with plenty of MUNCHIES/BREAKFAST OF CHAMPIONS options. The "cocktail hour" gathering late afternoon, wine and cheese, hourdovers, salad options, NICE! The gym on the 2nd floor has several "stations" where at least 3 to 5 of us could conviniently work out a good sweat daily. I definitelly plan on making this my GO TO NYC hotel, this being my second time here. I have been to other hotels, probably more luxurious, but definitelly way more expensive, and not as conviniently located. The SPG bonus points acumulate dramatically quick if you do register to the multiple offers they have.Looking foward to a future stay there. Basebal games, US OPEN TENNIS coming up this summer and fall.

Oh my I've stayed here many times without a problem but the wireless never worked during my stay and the tech support was HORRIBLE!Talked to them two nights in a row with the same pedantic diagnostic.Horrible customer support, unusable Internet, untenable for business stay.

The Hotel staff are super friendly and helpful. They all have excellent local knowledge .Great for restaurant bookings and finding quick transport to any Manhattan location. Good for airport transport. Staying downtown is so much better than midtown where there are constant crowds of tourists. Tribeca is also very close to Soho and Chelsea and greenwich and West villages. Close to brilliant shopping and amazing attractions.

An average urban Sheraton overall, but what earns them the one-star rating is their willingness to stick their customers with room 210. If you're checking in at this hotel and this is the room you're assigned: feel slightly insulted, politely decline and head elsewhere for accommodation.See, room 210 is sited right beside the fitness center, which makes it extremely noisy whenever anyone chooses to use the facilities. Cycling, running or elliptical noise is particularly disruptive to sleep. And it can happen at any time of the night or early morning.In a hotel where management has any sense of decency, this room would not be available for guests.Of course, the management knows. Which leaves one to ponder why, of a full consignment of guests, one was chosen to be hosted inside the room that sounds like a washing machine at 5AM. A personal insult?I hereby vow to never come back.

I always stay in this Sheraton when I'm in NY for business. The location is convenient for my office and for various subway lines, the staff are ALWAYS so friendly and welcoming and the rooms are comfortable. I'd happily recommend it.

great area for downtown Manhattan, near all the Canal street subway stations, so really easy and quick to get uptown. China town and Little Italy on your doorstep and so close for Greenwich, Chelsea and the lower east side. Fantastically friendly and helpful staff. with nice clean, comfortable rooms. As in other reviews, they are not the most modern rooms, but you are in New York, what are going to be sat in your room for?. There is a nice little bar on the ground floor. All in all a brilliant hotel for the money. I will happily stay there again.

I loved this hotel and the location (blocks from Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, Subways, Wall Street). The staff is very friendly, helpful and always say hello and goodbye. The hotel has a lot of comfortable amenities like the towels, bedding, extras on the 21st floor club level (open terrace, snacks, beverages)The only concern I had was the noise level on the street. It is very busy, often sirens and lots of horns what seems to be 24/7! The hotel has a great sound barrier from room to room but the windows are not sound proof. If you are a lite sleeper, this is not the place for you.

Right near subways, Chinatown, little Italy, soho, the village, freedom tower, Wall Street. Great staff, comfortable room. Wonderful rooftop club with breakfast and happy hour. When you come to NYC you don't stay in your room. We walked 5-6 miles a day strolling around the great neighborhoods. We'll be back.

Very clean. All what you need hotel. Just the necessary. Very convenient. Perfect near-zoho location. Wonderful staff, Specially Rondalissa. Vending machine in every floor, free and speedy wifi access. Great upper deck with magnificent ny skyline.

This Sheraton property is very old, I mean old! The welcome was genuine but there were no bells or whistles here and the rooms were very dated and basic, no water available, no extras for SPG members whatsoever, no water, fruit, welcome letter or room upgrade. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, in fact, I suspect is smaller than my wardrobe at home - it's insane. Checkout was basic and again nothing special. The location is great in Tribeca, a short walk downtown and to Soho but don't expect a luxury Sheraton property, it aint that at all. Starbucks coffee served in the ground floor cafe is bonus. Friendly but nothing over and above.

Stayed at this hotel and it was in a good location in Tribeca. The room was a large king room with city views and a good-sized bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The lobby was nice and the staff was friendly. There were some issues though. The bedroom is large enough to fit a small dresser but there wasn't one, so you had to fit two people's clothes on this tiny wooden cubby. The hair dryer plug is too large to actually fit in the bathroom plugs due to a shelf and a mirror, so you have to use it in the other room where you can't see yourself in the mirror to do your hair. The pillows have seen better days. They were extremely lumpy. We asked if they had other pillows but we were told all the pillows are the same. Lastly, give yourself an hour to leave in the morning. We waited 20 min for the elevator and each time it came it was too full to fit us and our luggage. We had to leave for the airport so we ended up walking down ten flights of stairs with our large suitcases or else we'd have been waiting another 20 min given the popular morning hour, so leave plenty of time.

Went over Valentines's weekend, cold as heck but we were happy to enjoy the city; the staff there were incredible by assisting the spouse of our friend when he wanted to surprise his wife with chocolate covered strawberries; the bar was convenient to unwind and never crowded; rooms were big and quiet; Our bed was soo comfortable, I crashed so well every night.

With our corporate office not far away, I had typically stayed at a boutique hotel a few blocks away. This time there was to much of a price difference so I tried the Sheraton Tribeca. Both are similar walking distance, but I have to say, I really liked this Sheraton. The location is nice. The check in, was quick and easy with the staff being very friendly. The room was clean and not as tiny as I have seen at some NYC hotels. I loved having the 24 hour deli RIGHT next door for a quick sandwich and easy access to something to drink. The only suspect part was the breakfast. The food was average, and the service not so great. I would give it another shot though. Checkout worked well, and it was a great 2 night stay. I will stay here again!

The hotel has free wifi in the lobby, but not in the room. There's also airport shuttle, depends on which airport will be different price, just call the hotel. Location is great and close to any subway stationStarbucks at the lobby, and if you need to go to bathroom, you will need to go to the second floor. Room is clean, bed is comfty, but they forgot to remove the used paper cup. Try to get the back facing side room, otherwise Canal St can be very noisy.

Although the staff tried to feign effort, I would not recommend staying here. Tripadvisor sent me to A.moma who sent me a confirmation for a room with double beds and another room with a single bed. When we got there they said they were all out of rooms and we would have to have two rooms each with one single bed, which did not work at all for our work related trip with three grown men. When it came time to make it right they said they couldn't do anything since it was A.moma's problem, but if we had booked through their website directly they would've "found a room for us" basically pointing out the fact that they were lying but not having availability. We left and found another hotel and had to pay a lot out of pocket for it. They just overall seemed very unorganized and chaotic. I did step into a friends room earlier that day and it seemed clean but very very very small, just FYI if you stay here. I know that's typical NYC, but this was just not worth the headache.

The service was great, the room was not bad, a great view of the streets, not to far from the subway, I would say tribeca hotel was the best hotel I have stayed with, also not to far from chinatown or little italy.

The location of this hotel is the best in class, as it is walking distance from Canal street subway station, and bus stand. The hotel staff was very welcoming and accomodating. Try to ask for a room as high as possible. If you take the club rooms, there is a free access to the lounge on 20 floor where you get nice view while eating/ breakfast. Water, cold drinks, coffee snacks are free 24 hrs.

Bottom line, rooms are terrible, old and SOOOO noisy. A good bargain for the chain supposed standards but in the end not worth it. Went there sereval times using the points, the only thing that made it bearable was that I did not pay...

Tge location of this Sheraton was great. It is close to all subway trains,a short walk to all the designer shops in SOHO,and a 15 minute walk to Greenwich Village where great music awaits!. Washington square is bustling with activity on warm spring days. Tibecca is an awesome area with every type of eatery avaiable.It is a 5 minute walk to China town and 10 minutes to Little Italy. The club room has much to be desired but the manager didn't hesitate to take it off my bill. Breakfast in the Restaurant was better. They brought a refrigerator quickly when asked,extra hangers were readily available and extra towels were no problem, as well.The staff even let me stay until 4pm when my flght was changed, at no extra charge. Mia was ineradicable as were the concierge and the night manager was super.The rooms were not fancy but larger than most in New York. good Starbucs Coffee in the rooms as well as as much bottled water as You could drink.I would stay again ,for sure!

Room not as tiny as you could expect for New York, very comfortable bed and nice, if small, bathroom. My only criticisms is that look is a bit outdated and the water flow in shower was a bit weak. These are very minor considering the excellent location. A real annoyance was to have to wait a long time for the elevators. There is a nice bar area and a very convenient Starbucks inside the hotel. Staff was friendly. Overall a very good experience

Stayed here for 4 nights on business. Hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby, which is a major plus. The room was small but had an outdoor patio which is unprecedented for nyc. The location could not be better as you are a 10 min walk from soho. Hotel service was somewhat lacking but I felt that the rest made up for it.
user_name:
Emmy M
New York City, New York

review_body: Convenient location to SoHo and TriBeCa. Couple blocks away from train station. Gold SPG member but was giving a miniscule room, does not honor early check in or check out. However, it can be a good value depending on your travel dates. I'd go back again if i need to stay near SoHo and if its around $150 per night. If not, look elsewhere.

Just back from a birthday weekend in NYC and a 2 night stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. From my early check in on Friday to an easy check out on Sunday, every staff member I met was exceptionally friendly, warm, welcoming and most of all pro active and efficient. The warmth was surprising for a big chain like this.I met Tina and Nicholas upon arrival and they were both generous with the smiles and did everything possible to ensure our stay would be a comfortable, enjoyable one. Though our room was not ready that early, they assured us it would be a high floor, room with a view when we came back a little later. The concierge guys were helpful and very nice as well. Rhonda completed our check in later with her infectious, bright energy. The club lounge access was a huge plus and the view looking north towards the Empire State Building is lovely. Would probably be a great deck to enjoy in warmer weather. It did get a little crowded quickly around breakfast and cocktail hours. But did not detract from the experience or view.Our room while small, was towards the back of the building and was quiet and clean with a supercomfy bed. Wifi worked a treat. The hotel's close proximity to a huge number of terrific cafes, restaurants in Tribeca and Soho is a plus. And Chinatown dim sum is also a short walk away. Subway access everywhere else was easy. Would stay again - the staff are easily some of the hotel's best assets.

After my earlier unsatisfactory stay due to the old mattress (that was a while ago), i decided to give one more try here at the Sheraton Tribeca. When I checked out on 25th Feb morning, I very clearly gave 2 comments to the front desk.1. I spotted cobweb directly above my work desk, next to the TV - Very visible from anywhere in the room. Wonder what sort of cleaning do they do ????2. My bed linen was "TORN" and since I had opted for their "green..." plan, I ended up using the same linen for week's stayThe person on the front desk was very apologetic. He said that he will take care of these and he said they will respond to me within 24 hrs about the corrective actions they take..Well, Its almost a week since I checked out.. I haven't received any message from Sheraton explaining anything.. (Not that I care much about their "corrective action" email) But cobwebs and torn linens are not expected from a chain like Sheraton. In case anyone doesn't believe me....let me know. I HAVE VIDEO FOOTAGE AND PICTURES TOO !!I just wish they maintained the look and feel of that lobby in their rooms as well !So bye bye Sheraton and NEVER AGAIN @ Sheraton Tribeca

It is difficult to find a hotel room in New York City that doesn’t blow your budget and has sufficient room to turn around in. Well, in researching hotels for a long weekend trip, I came across a good price deal for the Sheraton Tribeca - around $110 a night which is very good for New York. I had never seen the hotel and was concerned that it might be one of those small-roomed deals with a view of the neighboring air shaft. But imagine my surprise – and pleasure - when I found that the Sheraton sported a bright, nicely done lobby, a fairly large room (certainly by NYC standards) that was spotless, beautifully decorated, had all the amenities you could want and (while this might not be the same for all their rooms) a large window with an expansive view of Canal Street. We were on our usual gallery/museum jaunt and the location of the Sheraton with two subway lines within three blocks and two more within four blocks, served us very well. Then too, I had not visited the 9-11 Memorial which is about 10 or 11 blocks to the south (we walked it) and took this opportunity to do so. Restaurants around the hotel are plentiful and varied from small, hole-in-the-wall places to some of New York's finest dining experiences. Could not ask for better. The Sheraton’s staff were absolutely first rate, if a bit overly-enthusiastic. I don’t need to be greeted every time I cross the lobby but that’s what the staff did. They were efficient, very helpful and knowledgeable about Tribeca and seemed genuinely pleased to help us. In all the times I've visited NYC over the years, I don't think I've come across a friendlier crew. I cannot recommend the Sheraton Tribeca more highly. Every aspect of the hotel was near perfect. (Slow elevator was the only minor irritant but this seems to be standard for every NYC hotel.) If you get an opportunity give them a try. You won’t regret it.
user_name:
ScottInIndia
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed two nights on a weekend in February at the Sheraton TriBeCa. It was a fantastic stay - everything was seamless and check-in was a breeze. Great rate, too! The check-in lady was very nice and knowledgeable and gave us a two bed room even though I'd booked a king in error. The Wifi was free. Beds very comfy. Air conditioning worked great. Tip: Go up to the 22nd floor and look out the north windows for a great view of the Empire State Building and uptown. Make sure to do it both during the day and at night.We did eat at Antica, the Italian restaurant in the hotel. After a long week we were too tired to go out, and this was a fine choice. Arrived at the restaurant and it was completely empty, but open... and we had to wait a few minutes for anyone to show up and come give us a table (which inevitably ended up being "sit anywhere"). Great service, and we didn't want for anything. The gratuity was automatically applied for anyone staying in the hotel, which was unusual but fine, it was what we would've tipped anyway. Highly recommend this hotel!I would not recommend using their car service to get to LGA - it was more than a taxi (by around $10) and the Escalade we got was VERY foul smelling, and the driver kept taking phone calls during the ride. He also quoted us $50 when we got in the car but two minutes from LGA he told us it was $55. He also had me sign the tip screen (he used the Square app on his phone), and it was all in Spanish so I was unsure what I was signing or tipping. Ps - the candies they have at the front desk stations are like CRACK. So good.

Check in was flawless. Staff was amazingly friendly. Car was valet. $55/night. Fair for NYC. Location is great if you like TriBeCa, Soho, canal street. Room was very nice and clean. Turndown service was perfect. We got a late check out and it was great. We did not try the restaurant. The Internet was perfect for work. I had an issue after my stay and unfortunately I feel bitter about my stay because of an issue I had with management but I won't change my review because of it.

The Sheraton Tribeca is in a prime location with wonderful staff and amenities. The Sheraton Club lounge was always stocked with great food and happy hour was a ton of fun with amazing views! The room itself was very clean and in line with what I'd expect from the Sheraton brand. From the front desk representative at check in, to the bell hop at check out - our experience with the team was wonderful and we were always welcomed back after a day out with smiling faces. The location is extremely convent to everything in Tribeca, Soho, and we even walked down to Battery Park City and the financial district. We will be returning to this great hotel soon, you can't beat the value for the great experience!

My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for Valentines Day weekend. We were greeted like family from the front desk staff. Our room was very clean with an amazing view of the city. We had a mini fridge in our room which was a plus as I am pregnant and having cold water and snacks made my stay great. I also forgot to bring my fan from home but the front desk sent one up right away. It was crazy cold this weekend so upon arrival on Friday night we opted to eat at the restaurant in the hotel. Everything was delicious, great service and nice atmosphere. The club lounge was awesome for a light snack or a drink before dinner. And breakfast in the morning was even better. Chocolate Chip Waffles and a great selection of Tea. We ordered room service for lunch and that was quick and yummy too. The entire staff was very accommodating. We had the pleasure of meeting the front desk manager Katie - who was very friendly and went out of her way to make our stay very memorable. The door men were amazing too! Being so cold out they were very helpful in arranging for car services when we ventured out and getting our car from the garage when it was time to leave. We cant wait to go back!
user_name:
Karen M
Wading River, New York

review_body: When planning to go to New York, I dithered over what location, uptown,downtown, midtown, I checked out every hotel. I finally decided that I would stay down in the TriBeCa area as it had good access to all other areas, and what a good choice I made. When we arrived we were greeted by Mia who welcomed us to the hotel & swiftly checked us in. Our room was warm, clean & had a view of the 'Empire State Building' from our window. We chose to travel the subway for our sight seeing and the hotel was perfectly situated with the subway 2 mins walk away, $31 gets you 7 days unlimited travel. Soho, Little Italy, Grenwich village, Chinatown were all within walking distance. Eating & drinking in the hotel was expensive, very over priced, were charged $36 for 2 drinks....wow!!! The hotel had everything we needed for our trip, comfy bed, clean room, warm (it was freezing outside) & good location. Front desk staff were helpful, friendly & are an asset to the hotel. We enjoyed our time in New York & would defiantly look at staying in the Sheraton TriBeCa again.

On Sunday we checked in and noticed there was no mini fridge in our room so we went down to the front desk to ask for one. They said they would have one delivered while we were gone. We came back to our room that night and our room was left cracked open. I called down to the front desk and they said they were very sorry and would take this very seriously and send someone up with a machine to check the door lock. I called them back the next day to see what they found out and they told us that it showed we were the last ones there and we had left it open. I told them that was impossible because the mini fridge was in our room and we didn't get back until that night. She said they would have someone look at footage and get back to us. So the next day I called again and they told me they had footage of someone coming out of our room and leaving the door open. Which really freaked me out because I knew it wasn't us! I asked to see the video and they said someone would be there the next day and they could show us. So our whole trip from Sunday to when we checked out on Wednesday I had to deal with the situation and then them telling me it was our fault. Finally Wednesday I talked to someone who said again that we left our door open and that they would try to find the footage for us to see. When we went down to check out and look at the footage the woman came up and said ok the person leaving the room was blurry and it might of been one of our maintenance workers. Still not taking responsibility for it! She said we are very sorry what can we do? We got one night comped but it wasn't even worth it. My whole trip I was arguing with these people. I understand accidents happen but I'm writing this review because they blamed us the entire time and didn't take responsibility. I will never return to this hotel again!

Ideal location between Soho, Lower East Side and Tribeca, Great restaurants and cultural sites, Customer Service good, room on the small side, but it served our needs. Clean and comfortable, nothing fancy.

The staff at the Sheraton Tribeca were fantastic. Mia at the front desk was especially friendly, helpful and professional. She assisted with a cancellation of one night the week before my stay. Knowing the reason for the cancellation, she made sure to inquire how everything had worked out.It was a very busy weekend and there were no rooms ready when we checked into the hotel. Mia was very apologetic and said she would try to expedite the process for us. Within a few minutes we had an upgrade and a room.All the facilities in the hotel were clean and well maintained. The room was small, but it's New York City and I wasn't planning to spend time there aside from sleeping anyway.
user_name:
tjbucher
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I am a Starwood Lifetime Platinum member and prefer to stay at Sheratons in my weekly travels when available. I have been coming to the Sheraton Tribeca every couple of weeks for about 5 months. I am not going to stay here again.Positive - Location. Right above subway station and close to restaurants and Soho shopping. Staff are overall very friendly, seem genuinely welcoming.Negatives - The rooms on each floor are mostly spread across one side of a hallway with elevator banks and utility rooms on the other side. Unless you have a room at either end of the hallway, you have noisy elevators, dinging and doors opening and closing all day and night. Service is spotty. Rooms are not assigned as promised, things don't work - TV, heater, window, etc. I was promised an upgrade on my next trip after a variety of service failures and returned a week later to have one of the smallest rooms in the hotel. Keys don't work, the bar service is spotty and often you can't get a bartender to serve a drink. I made a car service reservation through the bellman for a trip to Newark Airport in the morning and the car was not there. Bellman are often hard to find and getting a cab in front of the hotel is difficult. Its seems every time I stay there are minor service failures and if you bring it to management's attention, you don't seem to get any response. Actually a chronic disappointment.

Amazing staff who are incredibly friendly. Picked this hotel on a whim but am so happy we did. The area is great - very walkable and near lots of great restaurants. The hotel room is nice, comfortable and very clean. The staff are great - upgraded our room, provided us with two free drinks, and made us feel very welcomed. Excellent drinks at the bar, too!

This property is one of the low-end Sheraton's, so don't be fooled by the name. It is easy to miss, the frontage almost hidden amongst store fronts in a rather commercial area. You need to walk at least a couple of blocks to find an eatery, a few more to find anything that classifies as a restaurant. Warning - don's buy a glass of wine at the bar, not unless you recently won the lottery. But on the good side, the staff are pleasant and the fitness centre adequate, so for a couple of nights, quite acceptable.

I booked this hotel at the last minute because I wanted to stay in the area and this was the perfect location.It does not have the same luxurious feel as other Sheraton hotels I've stayed at but the really friendly staff and service made up for it.The rooms were average size, although the bed was comfy.Location wise, its great but Canal St is jammed with traffic nearly all day and night, so when you take a taxi, you probably want to get dropped off a few 2 streets back and walk to the hotel, since you will sit in traffic for 20 minutes just to move 100 metres.

Stayed here in December as I was attending an event in NYC, Couldn't fault the staff, always friendly and welcoming, rooms were clean and tidy. every thing was taken care of no matter how big or small. No faults here!
