Excellent location, very nice staff always happy to help, great rooms! The rooftop terrasse has one of the greatest view. It's a nice spot to do a happy hour (BYOB!) if the weather permits.A less corporate Sheraton that fits exactly with the mood you want to be when visiting NYC!

This hotel was extremely helpful to 2 new timers to New York. The staff was able to assist and offer great ideas. Hotel is close to the subway rails. The hotel offer a shuttle car to the airport. Highly recommend!

The staff was amazing! Corey and his supervisor made sure we had an amazing experience while celebrating my birthday in NYC. He even brought wine and fruit up on my birthday! I wanted to make a poster for the Today show and this very sweet hotel representative brought me poster boards, markers and scissors! The room was very clean, OMG THE BED!!!! The location is convenient to shopping, sights good food. Best experience ever! We will definitely stay again!

Hotel center, wi fi in the room and in the lobby, breakfast is not included but is cheap if you want to make and offer everything. The rooms cozy and always tidy; there are tourist sites around and so it is not as crowded as Times Square, but it moves very well and in my opinion is the perfect area of Manhattan. The staff is great, you can make friends!

Tribeca meets Chinatown meets little Italy. A great value for the money in a really great location. Helpful staff. Good bar scene. By NYC standards a decent sized room. You can walk to so many different neighborhoods from here and it doesn't feel touristy
user_name:
PW11803
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff at Sheraton Tribeca did an amazing job with assisting us with our last minute needs for our wedding day and evening stay at the hotel. We were initially given a very tiny room and I immediately realized the chaos we'll be in on the morning of the wedding so I requested to be moved to another room. They did hear me out and gave me one that's a little bigger and everything was great! The staff were very accommodating and really sweet. Evereyone we saw in the hotel greeted and congratulated us on our special day.It is also a couple of minutes walk to the A, C, E, N, Q, and R trains! And a few blocks away from little italy and chinatown! We'd definitely be back!
user_name:
Donna_Hipolito
New York City, New York

review_body: My (new) husband and I stayed here over Christmas and were very pleased with how everything went during our stay at the hotel. Initially, we were disappointed not to have been given a Empire State view but we soon got over it! We were on the 19th Floor, just a hop on the elevator to 21st floor where we had full use of the Club Lounge & Roof Terrace which was worth the extra money for sure. Wifi was great, we were able to Skype home on our Christmas Eve wedding day! Infact, we had a very quiet and sneaky wedding ceremony on the hotel's rooftop terrace with the Empire State Building towering behind us and it was perfect - the roof was completely deserted so it was private & beautiful so this hotel will always hold special memories for us as a couple. It's a great spot for seeing the city, there are a few different subway access points nearby and all the most popular Manhattan sights were just a short subway ride away. Staff were always on hand to wave hello and goodbye to us every time we left and couldn't be more helpful. Thanks Sheraton :)

The room we stayed in was small, but this is expected for a reasonably priced room in NYC. It was clean and well put together. The Staff, especially Rhondalisa at the concierge desk, were amazing. They were friendly and accommodating. Made great suggestions for where to eat and at giving directions. My husband and I were so impressed with the staff more than anything that we said we will most definitely be returning to this hotel the next time we need a hotel in the city.

For my personal needs on this holiday, this hotel fits the bill perfectly. It's right slap between supercool Soho, Tribeca and not far from the Village, but in itself is not a supercool designer led hotel - more on that later. It is also quite frankly if you want to use the subway, one of the best located hotels in all of Manhattan since virtually all lines to the East or West sides converge within a few blocks of one another on Canal St. Navigation between them is fast on Canal St compared to the midtown sidewalk scrum.Within 50 odd metres of the door you can take the A subway straight to Howard Beach for the JFK Airtrain or vice-versa. Takes about an hour airport to hotel. If you're travelling alone this is far cheaper than a cab of course.Some have mentioned the immediate area as being depressing and feeling somewhat unsafe. Sorry, don't get this. There are probably about 5-10 trinket/T-Shirt shops to the East of the hotel on Canal St that are pretty downmarket, and sure you can have a few guys hanging round outside. This is New York, not Beverly Hills. 100m to the West on Canal you have a Maserati dealer. Yep, real downmarket.....Canal St itself is of course a very busy thoroughfare, and so the property fronting it is not the ritziest or nicest looking. Step left or right and you are immediately in a different world - Soho or Tribeca quiet and atmospheric streets, with amazing independent restaurants and Cafe's, and all the types of shops with character you could possibly need. This area is great for just wandering and seeing what you find for dinner, lunch or gifts etc. Battery Park is probably 30mins by foot, Washington Square 20mins, Broadway Shops 10mins, and Midtown is 20min by Subway. If staying on Times Square is not your main concern, this is a great area.Now to the hotel itself. It's surrounded by the type of characterful districts I love in New York, but itself is somewhat more middle-of-the-road. Sure there are local landmark pictures adorning the walls and the decor is certainly not "bad" - but if you're looking for Boutique hotel ambiance, style or character this isn't your place. It's not quirky, but if that's not what you're looking for that's just fine. Sometimes a writing desk or bathroom not comprising a glass bubble in the middle of the room is what you want. The facilities tick the boxes but probably no more: The gym is fine for a 20 minute workout but no more, the bar and restaurant are clean and presentable, but not exactly characterful. The club Lounge has a great view and we were lucky with the weather - being on the terrace to admire the view was fine. But the Club Lounge itself is overwhelmed with numbers especially in the morning, and this means the cleanliness and standards slip. If the facilities can't cope with the numbers, don't offer it to so many - simple. Having said that the breakfast selection was fine and better than expected, and the evening drinks/snacks were useful for those wanting to stay in (certainly saves the pennies)I had a Suite, so other than the Presidential room these were the biggest and nicest in the place. No problems - clean, well presented, a touch dated in some parts but perfectly nice and well appointed with settee, chairs/table etc. Great for a longer stay. Other rooms are obviously smaller but I can't comment on them.The staff were, without question super friendly. I checked in several hours later than the rest of my family, and I was immediately welcomed by name - "welcome, you must be XXXX" - nice touch. This standard continued with us being welcomed back each time, and the front desk staff also helping with some gift wrapping needs which goes above and beyond expectations. Front of House is an asset to this hotel, and probably adds another notch to the grade for many people.So, a balanced review I think. If you go understanding what the hotel style is and where it is, you'll be just fine - I was for my needs this time on a family vacation, and I've stayed all over New York. If you want Soho chic or Boutique cool/bar scene, you need to stay in a different hotel.

Outstanding customer service from every single person I encountered. From check- in to the bellmen upon departure, everyone was truly excellent and went above and beyond to make a personal connection and provide great service. Rooms are very nice (especially the showers), nice lounge, good coffee shop with excellent pastries, nice restaurant. Definitely recommend.

Good hotel for business or pleasure. Staff were very friendly competent and helpful Rooms were small but more than adequate as we were out all day. We were offered storage for our extra luggage to create more room. We would stay again as the location was great to get around lower Manhattan and a subway ride is nearby to get to upper Manhattan

No idea how this is a 4 star - it seems more like a 2/3 star to us. Pro/First impression: the staff was EXTREMELY friendly & super cool. I still think this, but it is unfortunate that we don't think as highly of the facilities themselves.They also left a welcome bottle of wine in our room since it was our anniversary. Again, super friendly folks. The area itself is both a pro & con. The actual street and aesthetic of where the hotel is is super depressing. It's very very run down. However, it is a convenient area in that it is only a block or two from the NICE & visually pleasing areas of Soho & Tribeca. But the cons...- Aesthetic: the rooms are tiny (ok whatever) but they do not look nice. Sounds like some may be remodeled? but I assumed ours was not as it was an all yellow & brown room. Looked extremely out dated, bare, and stale.- View: the view from our 14th floor room was very depressing and bleak. It overlooked super dilapidated buildings and graffiti. - Shower: the shower smelled like sour mold (dirty washcloth smell) from the moment we arrived. I honestly always wanted the door shut bc of that smell. I couldn't find out what was causing it bc it didn't LOOK dirty, but there was just that dirty washcloth smell, must be mold somewhere. Even every time it would be cleaned by services, it would still have that smell. Not awful - but not pleasant.- The flush button on the toilet was visibly broken & partially missing.- The room trash cans were two blue commercial recycling bins. Both the same. Looked like a work office - not very 4-star chic if you know what I mean. I love that they had recycling but the fact that both the bins (next to each other) were the same, you had to decide yourself which to use as recycling and which to use as a waste bin - I doubt that the people picking up the trash know to make this assessment. Worry that it's all just grouped together as trash in the end.- No amenities, no mini fridge.- Towels were the very rough, thin, cheap kind. - TV was fuzzy.- Elevators always took forever with often lines to wait for them (not really their fault though). Towards the end, one of the elevators was broken, though.The cleaning lady who serviced our room was very sweet & nice, once left a cute happy new year note on our desk - again, staff was wonderful, facilities not so much. We were really baffled why this was considered a 4 star - most 3 star we stay in are significantly "nicer" than this was.

I have stayed at this Sheraton 5 or 6 times. The location is good-ish; it's not in Chinatown or Little Italy or Soho or Tribeca, but is accessible to all of them. I have always had good service from the staff. The rooms, and especially the bathrooms, are smallish even for NYC. I've not seen the same need for renovation as others.I am SPG Platinum so have access to the Club Lounge. The outside is a spectacular place for breakfast in the summer. The last time I was there, there was no protein offering for breakfast, and the quality of the croissants had declined.

I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff was very understanding and accommodating. The rooms are a good size, clean, and have everything one may need. The beds are very comfortable. They have a gym that is quite nice and it's a pleasure to work out there. There is a restaurant in the hotel, Antica, which has great food and amazing service. Every day my room was immaculate, with fresh towels. I had a very comfortable, pleasant stay here.

Small rooms but ok,no minibar in the room but icemachine and autoseller for softeners in the corridors,elevators they have big delays.Room cleanlesse 7/10 ,stuff very helpfull ,the rooms are a little bit noisy because of the windows.Complimentary black starbacks coffee and machine in the room.Ask for rooms not in the Canal Side

The hotel is nicely decorated, the rooms are comfortable and the views from the rooftop are great. Breakfast is not great in the club, but it is close to many excellent choices to dine and go shopping.

We chose the Sheraton Tribeca for the location for our first visit to NYC to celebrate NYE. Every staff member from the welcoming and baggage toting bell staff to the spectacular desk team (Mia and Timothy in particular) worked to make the Sheraton a great choice. For a first visit this is great location and the staff work to make each visit enjoyable. The helped with cars, shows, food, and flight delays. The hotel itself is somewhat dated and the rooms are NYC small, but comparable for the price range. Everything is clean and safe. Tip: Crave Espresso two doors down on Canal St is magnificent for breakfast.

When I arrived I was greeted by wonderful smiles and some witty banter that really made me feel welcomed and, as a platinum member, at home. However, that was really the only great part of the stay. Otherwise the room was small even for New York standards, the breakfast was almost embarrassingly minimal, and the club room was average. Overall it is a good price in a good location, so a fine place for a night or two - but nothing special.
user_name:
ssl332332
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Excellent location convenient to Chinatown, Little Italy, Tribeca eateries and subways to all Manhattann. Unfortunately, very rude fellow working as the attendant in the SPG Club Lounge. A real lout, actually. Didn't see anyone on duty in the fairly full and lively lounge when I entered with my companion at about 8:45pm, so reached into one of the mini-coolers at the back for a bottle of tonic water. This was apparently a no-no. A thin African-American man wearing glasses, probably in his late twenties came up behind us shouting, "What do you think you're doing!" and saying that things close at 8:30 and if we wanted anything we had to come through him so he could get it, etc., etc. So loud, obnoxious and rude, we didn't even realize that he was an employee at first. Then he brusquely asked, "What do you want?" I replied calmly that I was trying to get a tonic water. His next question was, "One or two?" I said that "two would be nice," which apparently wasn't the right way to answer, because now he raised his voice again, "ONE OR TWO?" in a very belligerent way. His final act of insolence was to hand me the two small bottles of tonic water over his shoulder without looking at me or acknowledging us further. Another couple at the cooler on the other side were just cringing for us and just as bewildered by his attitude and behavior. We walked over to look out onto the terrace, but we left after a couple of minutes. It really was an unnecessarily tense atmosphere and we didn't feel comfortable there. Sad that we couldn't enjoy what is a really nice lounge and it left a bad taste after what had been a fantastic day. The kicker is that on the way out, I noticed a giant handwritten sign marked "TIPS" taped to an ice bucket on the counter near the coolers!Reported the incident immediately to the front desk supervisor (Mairovi) and indicated how strongly we felt about it. She took our information, confirmed it in the system and said she would let the management know about what occurred. Was disappointed we didn't hear anything the next day, and still haven't been contacted 48 hours later. I can only guess that she wanted the info in order to suppress the automatic emailing of the Guest Experience Index survey Starwood sends after every stay, because a bad rating really hurts them. Sure enough, haven't received one for this stay. Funny how that happens. Shady.All a great pity, because the rooms are nice and other staff members were great. Especially front desk agents Mia, Leslie, and the entire bell staff who helped us safely store some unique items. Leslie in particular, worked with my Starwood ambassador to provide a welcome gift surprise for my sister, who was also staying at the hotel. Nice hotel, but just be careful of the guy in the Club Lounge! Certainly didn't live up to the Starwood Service Commitment promises.

Had to reshuffle on short notice and ended up staying at the Sheraton Tribeca. Friendly service but the hotel is in serious need of a renovation. Rooms are spacious and beds are good but... room cleaning is quite "relaxed". Stains on the bath-room sink, bed made so-so etc. But the most serious oversight is the club-lounge. The poor team is always understaffed and are running to keep up -and failing. Every morning something at the breakfast table was missing, plates, bagels, fruit salad... you name it. Also the club-space is so small that it is always overcrowded. I wonder what Sheraton is thinking.

Very impressed with this hotel. Convenient location, friendly staff & an extremely comfortable room (which comes in handy when you've flown from Australia!)Upon checkin, we were upgraded to a room with a view of the Empire State Building, and the night views are amazing. We were also given complimentary wifi, which was very generous, although we wonder if it's because we were staying 11 nights.Only downside is there's no mini fridge in the room. My husband & I thought we could buy some things to have in the room, rather than having to buy food out all the time. Overall, a good stay.

My husband and I had a 50th birthday part to attend in the city. it was also my husband's birthday, so we decided to make a night of it and stay in the city. We picked this hotel because we were using SPG points and the location to where the party was being held. We are from NY and work in the city so we were literally using it as a place to get ready for the party and then crash afterwards. The staff was very friendly and attentive upon arrival. We stayed on the club level where you have access to the roof deck and the lounge. the lounge was packed, given that it was the holiday season a lot of people were in town. It had a nice selection of beer, wine and food. The deck was beautiful, great views of the city.

This was our first trip to NYC. I took the advice from a friend and found this hotel in Tribeca. The only reason I did not give it a 5 is because the restaurant was crazy expensive and not super. We ordered a $9 bottle of water and it was expired. Also, the "Big Bowl of Berries" was a small bowl of strawberries. Other than that, it is in a fantastic location and we had a nice view. There are plenty of deli's for eating and getting drinks that are more reasonably priced. There is a Post Office next door which allowed us to mail souvenirs that we would have mailed from home anyway so we didn't have to travel with them. There are many subway stops very close by so getting where we wanted to go was no trouble at all. We got an unlimited 7-day metro card and rode the subway wherever we wanted to go. The noise was not too loud. It is a city after all. Also, we did not have to wait crazy amounts of time for an elevator. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and always wished us well upon departure and arrival each day. I would definitely stay here again or at least, in this area. It wasn't too touristy and helped us feel more like a part of the NYC culture for the week.

I have worked in hotels for a long time, so I have an extremely high standard of service and amenities. The hotel was in a great location and was very clean. The room was slightly small but this is NYC and it was a lot larger than I was expecting for this city. The amenities are great, the Club Lounge on the 21st floor is one of the best things about the hotel, but the real winner of this hotel, is the STAFF. Seriously, the staff here and the best I HAVE EVER ENCOUNTERED. It was almost ridiculous how good they were. Mai at Reception is an absolute super star, that girl needs a bonus ASAP. Ebony who worked in the Club Lounge is an absolute sweetheart, and very knowledageble. Roberta from House keeping is the BEST. These ladies all know what they are doing - they create memorable impressions and really make you feel so, so welcome. Seriously, the hiring and training of ALL the staff here is truly exceptional. I will never stay anywhere else. Thank you guys!

This hotel is right on the edge of TriBeCa, Chinatown, little Italy, and soho so a great place to explore from. Our room was high up and had an amazing view of uptown with the Empire State Building! TriBeCa has some really interesting and nice restaurants and bars to visit in the evening, and shopping is really close too. Our room wasn't huge but expected for New York, bed was big and comfortable. Staff were really helpful and informative and went out of their way to help!

My wife and I stayed here whilst in New York for a film festival the rooms were neat and tidy but very small. Breakfast was ok (a small buffet), the staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is close to transport and shops and about 1 block from the world trade centre site. Would stay here again as a couple but not with kids

hotel is perfectly located right next to Soho, Tribeca and Chinatown., very comfortable , and the entire staff is absolutely fantastic.always smiling, always helpful, always attentive. we could not expect more.perfect 10

Wanted to stay in a different part of the city decided on TriBeCa after looking at the reviews. Staff are the best part of this hotel extremely friendly all over the hotel. Views from the club room and 21st floor of city skyline breathtaking at night.Rooms have all you need and more the only downside was the breakfast in the club room always running out and very crowded. Deon in the club room for drinks first class. Would easily stay again.

Just spent 5 days in New York and stayed at the Sheraton TriBeCa. We booked a club room and stayed on 20th floor which had a view out towards China town. The room was a nice size, bed was comfortable and pillows fluffy and had all the amenities required. The club lounge on 21st floor had a great view including the terrace which looks out towards the empires state building. Soon looked after the club room at night and he was a star!! Club room or lounge has wine, beer, cheese, crackers, olives and fresh fruit etc all served between 5.30pm to 8.30pm each night. Club room is also open 24 hours a day for light refreshments, snacks including tea and coffee so is really convenient. Staff at the hotel are all super friendly and greet you at reception each day when you leave or return to the hotel - it's amazing the difference friendly smiles make each day! Only slight downside is the breakfast in club room is a little crowded at times, typical American breakfast style ( sausage and eggs, muffins, pastry, cereals, yoghurt and oats and very fresh bagels daily) The breakfast staff are not as bright as the rest of the hotel, though they offer you vouchers for the downstairs restaurant if the lounge is too crowded. The hotel is convenient to Canel street station, and lots of restaurants and easy walking distance to Soho and Nolita and lots of other great areas. The Sheraton though hasn't got a lot of obvious signage or large frontage if you a walking in the street, though signage is ok from the distance. Be sure to check for the street number as we nearly walked past when we 1st arrived.

Spent 4 nights here last week and glad I did! Got upgraded to a deluxe room on the 16th floor with an AMAZING North facing view of Manhattan. The room was very clean with a roomy bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The best part of the hotel though was the staff who were absolutely lovely, extremely nice and super helpful. The Club lounge albeit small had a GREAT patio with the most amazing views of the city. The hosts there were great, only complaint about the lounge is that the food choices were limited and never varied like other Sheraton's.It is situated in a great area with Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown nearby. There are many restaurants and shops around, there's a great little wine store a few blocks away on Grand street, the subway is just around the corner on W Broadway that will take you right to the hotspots in Midtown (E train). What I love about this location is that you get away from the Midtown madness and get, I feel, a more calm local vibe which is excellent. Tip: The ladies at the front desk recommended the 'Roll and Go' restaurant. Definitely go there for a GREAT slice of New York pizza (all for a mere $2!), it is only 1/2 block away on Canal and W Broadway. Soooo yummy!I would definitely stay here again!

We checked in for a short weekend to celebrate our anniversary- Tina greeted us with a wonderful smile and was extremely helpful- she helped find a perfect room for us so that we could see the empire state building! She really helped to kick off a perfect weekend for us- thank you tina!!! They even sent up champaign to help us celebrate- What could be better? Overall the room was very nice. It it was Tina and Rhona later in the evening that made the stay great

So what was wrong? It should have been a room with a city view, but wasn't. The room was next to the gym - thump, thump, thump on the treadmill at 6am. The used glasses where not replaced, the coffee machine was obscure (also not replenished), the phone didn't work to call home. The first early morning wake up call didn't happen. Did I complain? No. I didn't "need" a view, I was awake early anyway. The coffee that emerged was meagre but palatable. There were plenty of glasses in the room, and some plastic cups.But ... the room was good - good size, immaculately clean, the most comfortable bed ever, a usable desk, a comfortable armchair, and a generous efficient bathroom. Everything I could want. I didn't complain about the view because the room was so good without a view, I didn't see the point in asking for a change.And then ... cheerful, helpful staff - only everyone I met, I don't know about the others. And the restaurant - fantastic staff (only everyone I met); wonderful food (only everything I tried); impressive service (only every time).As others said, it is a fantastic location, convenient for everything. It was exceptional for the price I paid.

I visited this Sheraton Property in early December on a weekend for pleasure. The location of the hotel is great in the Tribeca/Manhattan, so everything is easily accessible via short walks/metro. The entrance of this hotel is a bit difficult to find as it is hidden among many storefronts and a planet fitness gym. The room was clean and standard as expected from any Sheraton property. I didn't spend much time in the room as I wanted to explore the Manhattan. I had a bit of trouble getting into my room as the lock was broken and wouldn't read the key cards. However, Rhonda at the front desk was gracious enough to help me with the issue and apologized incessantly for the troubles I was experiencing. She even knew me by name even for the few days I was staying there. Great customer service!The main feature of this hotel is the rooftop club lounge. The view from the roof looks north into Midtown. Landmark buildings such as the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building can be seen in the skyline. At night, the lights of Times Square are easily visible. From 5pm-8pm, I believe they serve drinks and snacks in the club lounge.
user_name:
Branden L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We arrived on Dec 8 and received an unbelievable welcome from the front desk(Nelson). For the next 4 nights we were treated like royalty. We had access to the concierge level which includes full breakfast and early evening cocktails with snacks. All of the food was done so nicely. It was tasty and plentiful. Some of the folks that tended us included Corey, Tina, David. I wish I had written down all their names. Also, a special thanks to the maid service that was excellent. They also have a 3 star restaurant in the lobby. We had a fish dish that was outstanding! One last point is the great location. It is across the street from SOHO and 4 blocks from Chinatown and Little Italy. It is hard to find a better location!

Greeted warmly each visit by a caring staff who knows us by name and honors our room requests. and honors our room requests. Panoramic club room views and outdoor patio, comfortable, quiet room with comfy bed, pet friendly and a great location to major attractions and public transportation keep us returning to this hotel.
user_name:
mightymelanie123
New York City, New York

review_body: I just came back from a 4 night work visit. Hotel is OK, has all the basics and room was clean and OK. Disappointing that there was no option for breakfast tea in the morning only Coffee and 2 herbal teas. Sugar was not replenished. The room service was not great, The man on the phone couldn't here me and i couldn't near him. First night i only got my food and they forgot to bring my drink order. On last night no one even picked up the phone, so i left a message for my order and no one called back and i didn't get my food and went to bed exhausted. The reception staff and bell boy were great, very friendly and welcoming and helpful to make sure i didn't forget anything in cabs.

This hotel is located on Canal St. It's NYC so there are food options and transportation right by the hotel. But, there is nothing really around at night and can be a quite boring area for a tourist if you don't have business in the specific area. That said, the hotel is a great place to stay. The staff here make an obvious effort to greet and connect with the guests during their stay. I noticed staff greeting everyone who walked through the door and each employee observed gave excellent, informed service. I stayed here with my two small dogs. There was no extra fee. (Great!) Moreover, the staff seemed happy to see my dogs each time we entered the hotel. Some hotels, while pet-friendly, give you some very dirty looks when traveling with pets but these people were absolutely great and most important, welcoming. Room service selection ok, could be more options. Everything ordered came fresh, on time and accurate. All other services used with no problems, bell, concierge, etc.

We had a very enjoyable stay in this hotel recently. We were in New York for a wedding in Tribeca. The hotel was very convenient and we walked most places. There are many good restaurants nearby. The underground stations are very close too! the room was comfortable and clean. The service on reception was excellent. We were looked after extremely well. The restaurant in the hotel - although a little on the expensive side - was served by very friendly waiting staff and the food was good. We would go back again.

I was checked in by Rhonda who was very friendly and efficiently explained the hotel restaurants and club amenities. My room was small but the bed very comfortable. The snacks and breakfast in club room were fresh. Staff also friendly. When the breakfast room was full I heard them offer vouchers for downstairs breakfast. Hotel area within easy walk to soho and around TriBeCa. View from my room of Empire State. Canal st traffic a bit loud.
user_name:
judManhattan
New York City, New York

review_body: In summary - a thoroughly disappointing and frustrating experience. I was here with my partner for my birthday - the hotel had agreed in advanced to put on some 'extras' to make it a special occasion - the extras turned up late and the concierge who was meant to organise flowers had been 'unavailable' all week so this hadn't been seen too - no apology was made for this lapse in service. If my partner hadn't been in contact regularly with the hotel staff to try and organise this I would have accepted these little slip ups - but he and I were both let down by laziness and poor communication within their team. In addition to this - Housekeeping failed to replenish teas and coffee/towels every day and had to be chased up, hotel management didn't seemed too concerned about this low level of service when we raised it several times. All we were looking for was recognition that this wasn't great and some reassurances that it wouldn't happen again, which we didn't get. The substandard customer service continues. On checking out - further frustrations as the receptionist attempted to charge us again for the room (pre-paid several months ago) and when she finally conceded we had already paid - proceeded to charge us for the water in the room. We confirmed with her that we had not used the over priced water bottles and she agreed that this was correct and she would not charge us. Surprise surprise - on our return to the UK we find we had been charged. This underhanded behaviour is despicable and undermines the trust between hotel and customer. Luckily, the rest of New York was wonderful - so do visit, but use another hotel!!

Hotel is basic but comfortable. Location is perfect as the subway station is a few steps away. Lounge on the 21st floor is an experience as it offers amazing views of NYC. Staff is professional and friendly - Rhonda at the front desk was beyond helpful. Very reasonably priced. Walking distance to boutiques, restaurants, bars, etc. I will be back.

My husband and I were travelling to NYC with another couple who had never been. We have been numerous times and typically stay in either the UWS or Midtown. I could not locate a hotel in either of these areas whose rates were not prohibitive for our dates (the perfect storm - World Series/Halloween/NYC Marathon). We landed at the Sheraton TriBeCa as it was affordable. Some of the TripAdvisor reviews made me a bit nervous, but truthfully, mostly were unfounded. It is in a hopping area (Canal and Broadway) and as safe as any other location but is really central to so many great spots. Couple of pointers. Try to get a room away from the fitness room/elevators - a tad noisy. Also, pay the extra for the Club package. Worth it. Avoid the "fake China Town" on Canal and head to the true one only a few blocks southwest. Would definitely stay again.

My room was on the 5th floor and spacious for new york it was clean if a little dated. The housekeeping didn't replenish the coffee which was a little annoying. The restaurant was a rip off and I wouldn't recommend it. The head waiter was rude and continued to be little the other waiter throughout service and could be heard shouting from the kitchen area. Food was mediocre. Hotel is convenient if you are on business in tribeca but other than that not much to offer. Front of house staff very nice and helpful too.

We loved the hotel - great location - walked all over downtown and easy subway access to upper east and west side. Lots of food places nearby. Views are beyond compare - we had sun rise from our 21st floor room and the club across the hall with a beautiful terrace had a wrap around city view. Totally Orti paying extra for the club floor -breakfast, snacks, happy hour and Internet included. The room didn't have enough drawer space but it didn't matter. Can't say enough - we go to NY twice a year and this was one of our favs!

I'm very confused by other travelers awful reviews of this hotel as we've stayed in NYC multiple times and found this hotel to be the best yet. Great location almost perfectly in between Tribeca & Soho keeping anything you could need, including incredible restaurants and shopping, within a short walk. Staff was super helpful & attentive. We were on the 6th floor, so nothing high up or fancy, and our room was a great size for anywhere we've stayed in the city. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

We stayed here as a party of four in a room advertised for four people, and paid above the odds for it. The room we got was a standard room where we had to sit on the beds for one person to be able to move around. There were inadequate facilities in the the room and continually had to ask for it to be serviced for 4 people. As Starwood guests we were so surprised by the state of the hotel which we found to be simply like a poor motel. The location of the hotel is in a very rundown part of Tribeca, where we felt quite unsafe to be walking through! we did not feel this anywhere else in Manhattan, having walked from top to toe of the island! It is around the corner from a sub way so you can escape relatively easily!We had the use of the executive club lounge for breakfast and snack etc! This to be honest was ok but the food was not replenished and so it became a little like a bun fight for not only the food and drink but also for the inadequate seating arrangements.We ate in the hotels restaurant and I can only say what a rip off, with an exceptionally rude maître d' and food that bore no resemblance to the menu and quite frankly was inedible! My sons meal arrived looking like a plate of sick with a skin on and was cold! It was supposed to be parmisan chicken! Most of our meal sent back to the kitchen. At no point were we asked whether our meal had been ok and we were presented with a rather incredible expensive bill, which added a service charge to rub salt in the wound. We did mention this on check out to reception staff who said they would take it up, they did not.Overall one to avoid!

I am a loyal and long-time Starwood hotel customer and I could not have been more disappointed with this hotel. Simply put, there was blood on the sheets. I called to request that the sheets be changed. I called a second time. And a third time. And a FOURTH. After one and a half hours, someone showed up with an extra blanket. They didn't even bring clean sheets. I waited another 15 minutes until they finally brought clean sheets and changed them. This hotel is filthy. Just don't waste your time or money. Horribly disappointing.

Excellent hotel in an excellent location. Right next to soho, village, lower east side. Staff is very attentive and helpful Got a room on the 20th floor, great breakfast, great choice especially for Halloween night. Got to watch the parade on 6th ave.

This hotel is OK for New York, especially for just one night. The rooms are clean and not tiny, it's well located for that part of Manhattan. I still paid over $400 for one night, on a business trip. What was really outrageous were the prices at the restaurant. I went to dine there only because I was starving and didn't have much time. I accepted the maitre's suggestion of the day's special, rack of lamb, but didn't ask for the price. Big mistake: it costed $70 for six pieces of lamb chops! Total rip off, gun-point robbery. When I complained about the price, the maitre was quite offended and grudgingly gave me a 10% discount. And I was the only person in the place on a Wednesday at 8:30pm.

The positives of this hotel includeFriendly staffGood bedsInteresting locationGreat viewsHowever those aspects are outweighed by threadbare towels with one having a hole in itNoisy rooms if you are near a liftAn appalling breakfast in the club lounge which had plastic cups, little choice, no serving tongs and an absence of even the basicsVery few toiletries No where near the standard we have experienced in other Sheratons

Staff were so polite and helpful. Really went out of their way to make you feel welcome in the hotel. However got the fright of my life when we ordered four drinks and it cost $55. Went around the block to Nancy's bar and the same round cost €24. The stay was lovely, really big rooms for New York, very clean with a complimentary bottle of water. Great gym facilities and the subway is so close. Amazing bagel bar right next door. Would stay again but not for the bar.

I'm writing this review from inside my Harry Potter-sized room at the Sheraton TriBeCa. It seems impossible that I am in the same hotel that the other reviewers described.When I got to my room, I looked around trying to find the closet. No closet, but there was a space to hang clothes in a little armoire. There were NO drawers in the rest of the room (not even in the nightstand). Where do they expect one to store their underwear?!?!? I'm staying here for eight days - but it looks like I don't have anywhere to unpack! I checked out the bathroom- visible dust layer where the wallpaper meets the tile and just a shower - no bathtub. Bed had feather pillows - even though I specified that I was allergic.I unpacked and went downstairs to head out for dinner. I figured that I should let the front desk know that I am beyond disappointed with the room. I had opted for the lowest priced room (still $365 per night) so I wasn't mad - I just thought maybe this is what you get for the lower price and I maybe had the worst room in the hotel. The front desk was lovely- she told me that none of the hotel rooms had drawers (what?!?) but she would try to find me another room that at least had a tub and was on a higher floor. I was really appreciative that they were so accommodating. But then.....I arrived in the new room. It is about a third smaller than the other tiny room. It has a bathtub but still no drawers- just a tiny two shelf bookcase. The bed has a feather blanket and all feather pillows (I thought we've established that I am allergic?!?) There are weird dirty handprints on the doors. I would have preferred the original room but I have already packed up all my stuff and moved it at this point and it's almost midnight.I would have gladly paid a higher nightly rate to move to a better room (but she told me she was moving me to a better room...) I don't understand how the front desk could think that this was a better room. So I'm sitting here in shock. My eyes are watering (not because I'm crying about sleeping in a dirty closet disguised as a hotel room) but because there are feathers in my bed. I have NO IDEA how Starwood could put their brand on this place and I have absolutely no idea how this place could have four stars.

I stayed here during a 3 night business trip and we were all very happy with this hotel. It's well located, close to three different subway stations, bordering SoHo and trendy TriBeCa. The street where it's located is not pretty, but you'll be close to everything. The club arrangement allowed us to get unlimited free drinks and snacks (also warm) in the late afternoon. Breakfast was decent. Rooftop was the best part, we really enjoyed the views while having breakfast. Very close to the Meatpacking District, so you are a taxi ride away of nice restaurants and cafés as well.

Over the years I have stayed in this hotel on several occasions and it has never disappointed me.By New York standards it is reasonably priced and provides large rooms with all modern amenities and good wifi connection.Its in a great neighbourhood,minutes away from magical China Town,Little Italy,Wall Street with so many great little restaurants and pubs and endless shopping.I discovered a great garden by the seaside within walking distance.Even Midtown Manhattan was a very pleasant walk away.

Hotel was clean and in a good location, not too far for the subway station. the bar staff were great during the trip, even though we stayed over christmas, and were a good source of local information for other local Tribeca hideaway drinking locations.

Relatively expensive hotel at over $300 per night in downtown NYC. Convenient location on Canal Street to a nearby subway, shops and restaurants. Overall, service was responsive, but I had issues with actual cost of the rooms. It took several attendants to fix the cost, without achieving success in fixing the bill. Otherwise, room was clean and comfortable.

we felt pampered and cared for here after long days on NYC streets. The King bed was very comfortable and the room was clean and well designed. Maid service was excellent and courteous. it was convenient to have an ATM, bar (expensive) and restaurant all available there. Front desk staff were all friendly, responsive and professional. Hotel is located near subways and is convenient to all activities in lower Manhatten and Brooklyn. Canal street, where the hotel is located, is not very attractive but we felt safe. It is just a few blocks to Broadway.

Nice hotel, super friendly staff, excellent location.Walking distance from Little Italy, Chinatown and SoHoBut the real gem is the terrasse on the 21st floor. Ideal for breakfast witch a view at the Empire State Building.

My wife and I stayed here a night in August for a show up in the village. Everything is fine with the hotel , it's clean , the staff were very friendly and helpful . The rooftop area had great views . The biggest negative is the street its on , it's a tough grungy street . Driving there at the wrong time of day and trying to park is blood pressure inducing . The area behind the hotel is nice. We walked everywhere from the hotel and had a great time. I wish that hotel and staff were on a different street .

I have found in the past when staying in U.S. hotels, because staff rely so much on customer tipping, that staff go "out of their way" to assist you with everything (sometimes to the annoying level). However when staying at this hotel this was not part of either my two experiences there - the first when staying one night by myself having travelled from Australia (with two large suitcases and hand luggage) and being dropped at the hotel by limousine as I had travelled business class with Emirates (wonderful airline) and then secondly when returning some 4-5 weeks later with my 39 year old daughter to stay for 4 nights (on an SPG floor level) before once again returning to Australia (trip to airport in limo to fly out with Emirates) No one offered to assist me on either occasion with my luggage or anything else. When staying with my daughter we had to ask for sufficient toiletries for two people (even though the room was booked for 2 people) We also asked for some additional creamer satchels and teabags as the "long life" milk had gone off and we had to throw our tea out. Upon both requests a staff member begrudgingly turned up with the items and almost threw them at me. On a positive note, whilst the room was small, it was quiet, clean and typically the Sheraton beds were "to die for" - such comfort. I loved the area it was located in - within walking distance of Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy, and easy to reach other locations on the subway. When I stayed for the 4 nights with my daughter, as an SPG member, we were able to access free breakfast and the 5-8pm cocktail hour, both of which provided good food and sufficient tables. I would choose to stay there again, but this time in the knowledge that I was only getting 3.5 max quality and would need to take total care of myself, as I loved the area. If I was after better service or was traveling with my husband, who prefers good service, I would choose elsewhere.

Affordable (considering this is NYC) hotel at a great location. Walking distance to subway, Chinatown & Tribeca. Friendly services. The room (2 queen size beds) was a good size. Very clean, updated, quiet. Front desk staff was all very friendly and helpful. The hotel offer $50 flat rate for ride to LaGuardia airport, which is cheaper than what we ended up paying for Uber. Would take the hotel ride next time. The take-out pizzaria/sandwich place had great pizza by the slice for cheap. Would stay there next time.

Busy hotel, constant stream of people and an endless line at front desk. Not sure if this is the only hotel in the area but its swamped. No reason to stay here unless you are working in the nearby district. Like many other parts of NYC, lots of decent restaurants - sit down and fast food closeby. Chinatown also a quick 10 minute walk. At night, definitely not a busy place outside the hotel with lots of foot traffic so be careful if you stroll around. Service and quality are fine, but not fancy. A practical hotel for those who need a spot to crash after a business day.

We are a family of five adults and we stayed here for five nights in October 2015. On arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful and this continued for the full stay. We asked for rooms on the upper floors with a view and were accommodated with 11 and 16 floors one with a view of uptown. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The location is excellent with tube stations very close by. The hotel is a very good option for a short stay in NYC.

The overnight manager, Tim, was rude, inhospitable, and unacommodating. Basically the opposite of what I needed at that moment. He clearly does not understand the requirements of his position, which are to be hospitable and welcoming, the basic essence of what some good old fashioned basic customer service is. I had had an excellent two night stay at the Sheraton Tribeca, (for which I used up all my points to book!). Unfortunately, upon checkout, I had had such a smooth, flawless, perfect magical 72 hours in NYCand I was so happy, that I forgot my driver's license as well as my phone charger in the room. Oops. My bad. Completely. I did not realize that I had forgotten those items until it was 2 am at the Newark Airport, trying to get my Hertz rental, because I was going to drive to the Sheraton in Edison that night(BECAUSE I BASICALLY LIVE AT SPG HOTELS BECAUSE OF WORK). By this time, my phone was also dead, so I was stranded with no phone and no driver license and no store was open for me to buy a charger. So the nice Hertz lady understood my situation and did her best to help me. She got me the number for the Sheraton Tribeca and I called to ask if the staff had found my forgotten items. The overnight manager that I spoke to was defensive, rude, and made me feel bad. I was in a tough situation and needed reassurance that if I had left items in the room, my items were safe and they wouldve been found, and that as soon as housekeeping came in the morning, we would be able to verify if the items HAD INDEED been found. Instead, he was trying to argue with me when he asked for my number to call me back and I told him I could not give him my cell phone number because it was dead and I couldnt charge it because the SHERATON TRIBECA HAD MY PHONE CHARGER! But, he wasn't listening to me and I was so frustrated at the whole situation that I just wanted to cry. It is just appauling that a manager in the hospitality industry would not listen and understand when a guest needs some actual help/friendly reassurance in a difficult/scary situation. The incompetence at this level of management is unacceptable, and I am surprised that this even happened. I've stayed at SPG hotels in California, Washington, Oregon, Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona, Massachusetts, Florida, Illinois, even New Jersey, and in Mexico too, and I never once filed a complaint because everywhere I have been treated professionally, courteously, and SPG truly feels like home, but the Sheraton Tribeca simply did not have my back and I am disappointed and bummed at the way I was treated. So rude and awful. Sheraton Tribeca you really really really failed me.

My husband and I enjoyed a 2 night mid-week stay here in September. Have been to NYC many times for business and pleasure but this was our first hotel in this neighborhood. Drawn to it as a son now lives nearby. Very positive experience. Notably the comfortable bed and bedding. Decent but tight size king room (built-in closet/armoire type was to right of bed; only 1 person at a time could stand at it) and big enough for a chair. Good desk set up and adequate bathroom. Did not dine at the hotel but it looked inviting. Grabbed our breakfast on the run next door at the bagel shop/market. Clean rooms and lobby; friendly front desk and doorman. Location is not as charming as some of the neighborhoods very nearby but it worked well for us.

The hotel is very conveniently located close to the subway right on Canal Street making it easy to navigate. The room was clean, nice and modern; the bed was wonderful. Check-in was seamless and staff was friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Note Tribeca not Time SquareGreat Hotel Great locationFriendly attentive staffThe only downside is the Sheriton ClubOn the 21st FloorNot up to scratch.$30 dollars a day for virtually nothingMost mornings Stale BagelsFruit on some mornings if your earlyEvenings having to pay ridiculous prices for alcohol. Most Clubs include drinks but not here. Would suggest giving this a miss and going next door to the Tribeca DeliBest food best coffee very reasonably priced open 24 hours.Cheap alcohol also.

I found this a good, comfortable middle-range hotel in an interesting part of New York. Our room on the 14th floor had wonderful views and the window opened about 4 inches to let in fresh air - a welcome alternative to the air- conditioning which,incidentally ,was quiet. The bed was really comfortable and the water plentiful and piping hot. Coffee facilities were available in the room.All the staff we met were polite and helpful.I would recommend finding a diner for breakfast. I think the hotel let itself down here. Orange not freshly squeezed and croissants dry and out of a packet. Scrambled egg luke warm and hard. Breakfast was not cheap and more effort could be made to enhance what was otherwise a hotel to be recommended.

Friendly staff, 50 mins from JFK, excellent breakfast. What more do you need. Close to lots of cool streets and really easy to move around from. Clean rooms and in mine a bath big enough for a normal sized person to lay back and chill in.... I'd come back - definitely.

This is the fourth time we have stayed at this Hotel and we have never been disappointed . Great location , close to Chinatown , Little Italy , right in the heart of TriBeCa . Lots of areas within walking distance . I would say that the only draw back might be that it is a very busy Hotel with lots of activity going on all day but let me say this , the beds make up for it in a big way !Comfy, giving you a great sleep. Elevators struggle to cope with this busy Hotel , In House Restaurant would benefit from a more competitive pricing in regards to Breakfast , it might attract more customers that way . All in all , we love this Hotel and would always return . Staff helpful and attentive

My review does not focus on the location or stated amenities of this hotel - which I would say are all just "okay" - but rather the specific issue of room cleanliness which I found on my recent stay.The air vents seem to spew out dirty, dusty air. How can I tell? Because (a) the wall opposite the air vent was caked up with dark dustbunnies. I actually pulled the desk away from the wall, used a tissue to wipe off all of the dustbunnies, and pushed the furniture back. Gross.(b) the top of the room's windows - also in direct receipt of the air force - were blackened with soot and dust. I did not bother to climb up and clean the windows. I'm only 1/2 crazy, I guess.Aside from this, other glaring maintenance issues were present in the room: a broken switchplate covering a prominent electrical outlet. Grime on the shower door threshold. Mildew on just about every inch of grout in the shower. A slow drain in the sink. A broken hinge on the armoir door. The towels are all very thin, worn down, and thread-bare with little holes or fraying edges in some places. The towels also had some dark marks on them - permanent stains that should take the towels out of circulation. The comforter had stains on it. The wallpaper was scuffed and stained in a multitude of places, the walls just had black marks all over them. Also behind the desk, on the carpet, was a mountain of longterm dust. And on the ceiling - also by the air vent - orange stains from what looks like (very old) water damage, which of course should have been repainted and wasn't.This place is just not cleaned adequately. I stayed here on Starpoints because it is a good value in terms of point redemptions in the Starwood brand, but like everything on earth, you get what you pay for. It is far below the standard for a Sheraton property. I called the front desk to report these items and also reported these notes in the SPG follow-up survey and never got a reply from either channel.I'd have to say, as a 50-night/year Starwood guest, this particular property is far below par, just on simple cleanliness.There are additional minor problems with the hotel - that is, a very crowded Club Lounge (are they over-selling club lounge access?) and too few elevators, resulting in a very very long wait at peak times - when you are most in a hurry. But these could be forgiven if the rooms were clean.

Good things about this hotel:-Walking distance of great restaurants (if 15 minutes walk is okay for you), -steps from the subway, -friendly staff, -Starbucks in lobby and room. -very clean.Not so great:-Weird and mysterious didgeridoo sounds coming from somewhere within/near hotel during the night/early morning.-TINY room. Our room in midtown was way bigger and cheaper and nicer! I am no stranger to tiny rooms, I've lived in 200sqft studios, but this was almost dangerously small. We had only 2 suitcases and maneuvering around the room was quite challenging! -THE SHOWER. It looked fancy but everything about it was annoying...the "drain" is a 6" x 24" metal plate covering the real drain "presumably" and the noise the dripping water makes on it is so annoying. And whether or not the water will be hot when you decide to take a shower was a crap shoot. The water pressure was low, and it was impossible to turn on the shower without blasting yourself with cold water.I would prefer not to stay here again, but who knows, maybe the other more expensive TriBeCa hotels are just as bad.

Good location you can explore China town and little Italy and the Hotel near subway. Only we cant sleep well because all the traffic noise , we stayed at 7 floor maybe if you request to stay more higher level you not hear the traffic noise . Nice room, small bathroom.

My husband and I stayed in the Sheraton, for 5 nights, the first week in September. This was our 2nd stay to NYC and wanted a hotel in the TriBeCa area. The hotel was clean, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. We found the hotel to be a good base, as we were busy, so apart from sleeping and getting ready we didn't spend much time there. If you are looking for a 'swanky' type hotel then this isn't for you. The bar in the hotel is expensive, charging the same,for a glass of wine as the Soho grand down the road, however you would expect to pay that in the grand due to its beautiful decor.The rooms were of a good size, the bed was very comfy, we were on the 15th floor and heard no road noise. The room had no bath robes or slippers however a quick call to reception and these were supplied. Overall a good hotel, great value for money and the staff are very attentive and helped us with printing and booking reservations when needed. We would stay again if we had a busy trip planned. If you want a hotel that is going to wow you with the bar area and their atmosphere this isn't the hotel for you.

My wife and stayed here for the weekend in the late summer 2015. The location is great - even though we were right on Canal that wasn't so bad. On the 15th floor it was not loud facing Canal given insulated windows. The rooftop deck accessible only by club floor key access was ok but very crowded. This deck was understaffed and dirty with dishes everywhere. Probably just an undersized club floor given the size of the broader hotel. Overall it was a good experience.
user_name:
wifi_4430
New York City, New York

review_body: My first time at this property. It is renovated. For NYC, the rooms are very decent. I chose it because I wanted to go shopping at Century 21 (20 min walk). Otherwise, the location is not the best (unless you want a counterfit Rolex or Louis Vuitton bag, that just walk outside). The most pleasant surprise was the club lounge - with outdoor seating, overlooking the sunset. If you are staying here, I would highly recommend to upgrade to the club level. The views are priceless.

This hotel has updated rooms and lobby. Typical small NYC hotel rooms. Ask for a view of the Empire State Building. Make sure to upgrade to club level privileges. Includes breakfast, Hors d'oeuvre and a sweet terrace with awesome views. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Very convenient to all the trains. Also great shopping in Soho.

The Sheraton Tribeca is in a great location, except for Canal street. For some reason, the buildings across the street are all vacant and it makes the whole area feel really sketchy and strange, but don't hold it against the hotel, the hotel is awesome!Just behind the hotel is a cute little neighborhood. There's a Japanese place called Tataki on Lispenard street (right next to the cool looking Dive bar.) Dine in or take away, it's VERY reasonable, for New York, heck it's just reasonable.The hotel is bijoux, it's a gem, but small, that's New York. I loved my room on the Club Level, it was tucked away in a corner and had the best king bed I've ever slept in, other than my own. I will say that it is small. Very small. Interior cabin on a cruise ship small. So what? It was VERY functional and comfortable. No one comes to New York to hang out in the room.I will also say that I'll be staying here for the next couple of months for work, and I'm going to enjoy the very large shower, the shelving in the bathroom and the comfort height commode. The little wardrobe is perfect for my 4 days of clothing, The TV with the nearly 100 awesome cable channels is a great way to unwind when I get back to the room after a long day on site with my customer. I cannot say enough about the staff. Nelson at check-in took care of me, asked me how my day was, and made sure that everything was perfect with my stay.The folks at Antica helped me get some Pasta to eat late at night after a VERY long day. The room is impeccably clean and even in New York, in my little room in the corner of the hotel, it was very quiet, although close to the elevators and ice machine. There's a Planet Fitness right in the hotel. The Club level has a fantastic river view and breakfast is a varied assortment of carbs. Bagels, with all sorts of spreads. Fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereal and those wanting protein, hard boiled eggs for breakfast. Starbucks coffee, and an espresso machine for hot milk an depth charges. In the evenings there are cheeses, veggies, assorted nuts, pasta and hors d'oeurves. That carb thing...more protein!The Canal street subway station is right around the corner, and should get you everywhere you need to go. The SoHo pharmacy is an odd little corner of the world, with strange cosmetics and snacks, so check that out. The Black Burger is a very cheap place to get a nom. If you must, Dunkin Donuts is across the street. Imagine it gets weird, but in a good way after dark. TriBeCa bagels is right next door and open 24 hours, except for Jewish holidays. In all, I liked this hotel and I'm happy that I'll be staying there.

The hotel is only a few minutes from the underground and you can reach chinatown by feet. There are many shops around where you can buy breakfast. The room was very small but renovated and clean. The stuff was very helpful und friendly. It was a nice stay, we enjoyed the NYC trip.

Everyone we encountered at this hotel was helpful and friendly. They really seem to enjoy being at work and dealing with people which is not a common experience, for me, in Manhattan! The hotel is clean, attractive and very well-located. We could walk to nearby destinations easily and it is a few blocks from the subway.

This hotel is in a great location for Lower Manhattan, in walking distance to little Italy, Chinatown, and the 911 memorial...great for shopping at Century 21. The staff were amazing very accommodating and friendly. I would stay at this hotel again, yes the rooms are small but hey you only sleep there.

This is a nice, clean hotel. We tipped the front desk but they still wouldn't give us 2 beds or a room with a view. But they did give us extra pillows and blankets as requested. Loved that they had fruit flavored water in the lobby. I didn't really care for the area it is located in, especially at night. It's walking distance to Chinatown.

I chose this hotel because it was close to my aunt's (very tiny) apartment in SoHo. I know the area fairly well, so was surprised to find such a nice hotel. Our room had a great view, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. My only issue was that we didn't have any soap for the shower, wish I would have noticed that before I was rushing around in the morning. The restaurant had a nice breakfast - nothing too fancy, but decent if you need a quick bite in the morning. The lobby is really nice, a great respite if you need a break. I would definitely stay here again if I was going to be in this part of NYC.

This hotel is in the best location for those who lover lower Manhattan. Right on the cusp of Tribeca, Chinatown and Little Italy, there is so much to do within walking distance. The hotel rooms are small (but this is Manhattan and all rooms are small) but very clean. The hotel staff are friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again.

We were greeted with a big smile by staff member, Corey at reception. His personality and enthusiasm for pleasing guests was obvious in his dismeanor. Because of Corey, we will return to the Sheraton Tribeca in the near future.

For New York this hotel offers more spacious rooms than we've experienced during previous trips with two beds in the room. The staff were helpful and the lobby bar was a nice, comfortable place to relax after a day of walking all over the city. The problem with this hotel is the location is right on the edge of a an area of town where all the storefronts were boarded up with gang graffiti. It was very affordable for New York and was a good stay.

The Sheraton TriBeCa have a great bunch staff. Friendly engaging and welcoming. The room was satisfactory and no other complaints. Canal street itself took a little getting used to. Not the cleanest street, but didn't feel unsafe, But a short walk a few blocks away one finds oneself on Broadway and then TriBeCa itself.

stayed for 2 nights with SPG free night awards. Hotel was reached easily by A line from Howard beach / JFK air train. Check in was swift and friendly we opted for a club upgrade and paid a small fee per night, it was well worth it to secure a nice room on upper floor and access to lounge with continental breakfast and canapés in evening with great terrace to cool down on as temperatures we high 90's on our visit. We observed some guests abusing the pay for bar and sneaking free alcohol when staff backs were turned which is unacceptable, we made the club lounge attendant aware who dealt with it swiftly was very impressed! The club lounge attendant (didn't catch her name in evenings) was warm and friendly and worked very hard. TriBeCa area is nice lots of bars and restaurants and easy access around Manhattan and beyond. the hotel isn't perfect we didn't get our room cleaned on second day and check out was a bit sloppy and reception didn't seem to understand room charges and had two separate night bookings which seemed to confuse them - not sure what as must happen all the time. That said bed was perfect and air con was good - so have mixed feelings about hotel good and bad overall but I probably would return again at the right price.

During my short stay here, I thought that the service was very good. We had breakfast in the members lounge. The food was ok. The room was quite small and so was the bathroom. The walls were also quite thin so you could here the family next door. Perfect for a business trip, a little less for a family.

It was our first night in New York and we have a wonderful time at the Sheraton Tribeca. The hotel has a good location to walk around: Spring Street, Prince Street, Wooster Street and Broadway. In our case, we paid and additional 30 dollars to have access to the rooftop and enjoy a dinner and breakfast. The room was cozy and the mattress was very inviting.

Basically a low end Sheraton - has all the basics like a bed and shower. We had access to the club room for breakfast - basic and OK. The evening snacks were poor to bad the drink from the bar were extremely pricy and not of any value - beware these are not free as per usual for most Club rooms.Great location close to every thing down town although Canal street is a dump and noisy.

To be honest, for the low price we paid, my expectations weren't that high. However, I was incredibly surprised!! The rooms are typically NYC size, i.e. compact, but perfectly functional and have the benefit of a wonderfully comfortable bed! We were upgraded to the club floor and the views were exceptional - iconic skyline wherever you looked!However - there are two aspects to this place that would make me keep coming back - the staff and the location. The latter is perfect - all the major subway lines cross canal St so you can get anywhere in the city pretty quickly; it's moments from beautiful districts such as soho and TriBeCa without reflecting their prices and there's loads of excellent bars and restaurants a stones throw away.The staff are absolutely fantastic - warm, friendly and helpful. We didn't meet one member of the team that didn't display this attitude. Thank you Sheraton TriBeCa - we'll be back!

Very convenient location, being within 5 minutes walk to most metro lines' stations and within 10 minutes of shopping and food in SoHo. For families or singles, it should be noted that the streets surrounding the hotel did not always feel the safest. Our room was on the 7th floor and we could hear a lot of traffic (and sirens) through the windows. In addition, our room was located near the ice machine and you could hear whenever someone used the machine (or when the "neighbours" came and went).

I've been visit NYC a few times, stayed in a lot of great hotels. and for sure a few not so good.Let's start with say, Sheraton Tribeca is a very very good hotel. It's pricy but you get more than what you pay for. We book a room at the Club floor and this is my first advice, it's worth it, at least twice. The room was compared to a lot small, to NYC not huge but big and very fresh and clean.Breakfast which is included as a buffet is by far better than average, but the evening reception is very great, much more than expected. The balcony/terrace is just wonderful, a great view of the Empire State Building in the middle of 180. I save the best to the last, the staff at this hotel is very nice and helpful, if I where the boss, I would be proud of them. We loved and enjoy our stay, we'll be happy to recommend this hotel to all our friends and yes, we'll be back!

We recently had a long weekend in New York and as always the subject of location and hotels can be a tad trying. Normally we have stayed in Manhattan but this time opted for the TriBeCa area which is close to the CBD, and Greenwich village. We were not disappointed with the location and the jewels that we found around it. Some may not like the location all we will say is look beyond it.Check in was easy although if there were a party choking in the lobby would seem very full.Our room was on the 22nd floor with views of the roof tops of lower New York and with no skyscrapers blocking views. The view from the club room as also great especially at night.We had a club room and entry to the club lounge for breakfast and snacks from 17;30 till about 19:00.The room was small ideal if you are only staying for 2 nights but 6 it can at times feel as if you are living out of a suitcase. The staff were very good and kept the hotel clean. The mattress again was excellent but my pet niggle is microfibre pillows.However, we will be back in New York and we will be staying there again.

I stayed at this hotel for a week with my husband while he was in the city for work. It was located right on Canal Street amidst the real hustle and bustle of it all, for better or for worse. I didn't always feel safe walking alone of Canal as I experienced near constant harassment to buy purses or other wares, but, I also like Chinatown so its a mixed experience.The rooms were tiny, but, I think thats par for the course in NYC. Try to get one that does not face the big Fila Sneaker Billboard ad, you might get a nice view of New York City. Food in the hotel was super expensive, but it has a great, cheap all purpose deli below. Better yet, walk up a few blocks to Soho to get breakfast at the Chobani cafe or desert at the Momofuko Milk Bar.
user_name:
chavab2014
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The service was excellent despite the small quarters which one would expect for a city like New York. The location was great in lower Manhattan. Easy travel into Brooklyn or uptown via train. No real complaints.

I booked the wrong room, was with my son for his 21st ended up with a king-size bed. Corey on reception couldn't do enough to change our room to two double beds. The hotel seems to be in the middle of nowhere but if you go to grand street and walk down there's a hive of things to do. They subway takes you everywhere you need to go. The staff are amazingly helpful and chatty. The room was clean and had everything we needed. I have stayed in loads of hotel and this one has the best beds ever.

Stayed on the club floor of the Sheraton TriBeCa. I have to say the hotel is very clean, the staff is courteous and very helpful. I highly recommend staying on the club floor especially if only a few dollars extra as you get access to the club lounge, which includes breakfast, hors d'oeuvres at night and snacks throughout the day. But the best part is the view from the patio, which is breathtaking. The hotel is steps away from great shopping and amazing restaurants.I would definitely stay there again.

I've stayed here multiple times. The staff is rude, the rooms sometimes are cleaned, sometimes not. Multiple requests go unanswered. It's really a lousy place and usually not inexpensive. Even as a frequent guest with a high Starwood rating I get terrible service. I stopped staying there and will never go back.

Chose this Hotel for the location as I wanted to explore the lesser "touristy" areas of The Village ,Little Italy SOHO Etc.and elected to book a club lounge floor room with access to the roof top lounge. Our room on the 20th floor was smallish and we found it a struggle to manoeuvre around our two suitcases previous comments have mention the room layout and the furniture causing most of the problems and I agree.We also found the area to be very noisy as Canal St is v/busy( and a bit grubby) so having an afternoon siesta was difficult. The inclusive b'fast in the Club Lounge was quite limited and if you are not intent on using the roof top lounge due to weather then I'd suggest just choosing a std room..depending on price difference. The area did allow us to easily reach Battery Park ,walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and walk to many restaurants & bars.

My stay was brief and I was alone so I didnt do much of anything except watch TV and sleep. Hassle free check-in, clean room, standard amenities. The walls seemed a bit thin as I could hear activity in the next room , nothing crazy just a bit annoying. I'd stay here again. Close to Canal street shopping and all trains.

Stayed for 6 days here. The hotel is very central to everything, close to subways and right in the heart of TriBeCa and Soho. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The staff are cheerful and very accommodating. I would stay here again.

This hotel was very disappointing for my daughter and my self, rooms are very small for the $, you can't locked the bathroom doors (in list in our room), you can hear people walking on top of us and as far as cleanliness this room gets a 1. Needless to say, we won't be coming back or recommend this hotel.

The Sheraton Tribeca has a lot going for it: Location (close to SoHo and subway lines); really energetic, young staff; and well appointed, small but comfy rooms. The negatives are noise (even on the 17th floor, the traffic noises were at times problematic) and limited bar offerings (it was DEAD). We were able to get a really good deal too ($199 per night in Manhattan). Bottom line: Not ritzy but well worth the stay.

Room was a single with King size bed and room, carpeting and bedding was very clean and gave me a very comfortable feeling. Hotel staff was very friendly & accommodating with directions and any other needs such as toothpaste/toothbrush which I forgot to bring. Located in Tribeca but Soho,Downtown, Chinatown, Little Italy & shopping were all within walking distance and subway to Midtown (Times Square) was very close by.

Loved staying here ! Great location , short walk from everything , soho is around the corner , Greenwich village a short distance and also ground zero ! Staff were friendly and rooms had everything needed for a short stay .Super convenient for subway further into the city ! Would love to stay at the Sheraton in Times Square next time for all the action

Was not a Sheraton fan, however this stay converted me. Room was large for a room in Manhattan. Clean bathroom with shower no tub. Great water pressure and clean fluffy towels. Upgraded to club floor which allowed access to the club lounge and roof patio. Breakfast and free wifi with upgrade. Breakfast was crowded, only protein was peanut butter. Cereal, bagels, toast, muffins and make your own waffles. No yougurt, no hard boiled eggs, but apples, oranges and bananas.Very nice sitting on roof patio with views of Hudson River and Empire State Building, and food was served from 4-8 ish every afternoon.Great front desk staff, helpful, warm and professional. They seemed to enjoy their work always smiling.Location was excellent that allowed exploration of Trbeca, little Italy, Nola, lower east side, soho, east village and the village. Valet parking was great as well, happily handed over the keys after being stuck in rush hour traffic.

My wife and I spent 3 days in New York with this hotel as our base. Location is fantastic. ...3 different subway lines within 2 blocks..walk to 911 memorial, little Italy, Greenwich Village.Hotrl staff are very friendly and accommodating . The executive lounge includes wonderful views and a place to chill. Rooms were on the smaller side but we'll appointed and very clean.I recommend the Sheraton Tribeca

Okay so it's a business hotel but it is really nice for a family too. Great roof terrace and we paid the extra for the use of the business lounge and got free breakfast, which was gat. The location was pretty good, heart of TriBeCa. The rooms were nice and the staff very friendly.

We stayed for 5 days on family holiday and we had a great stay at the hotel. The room was nice and clean, the beds comfortable and the staff extremely service minded and helpful - especially Mily was a true star. The neighbourhood was a bit boring, but the subway station is just around the corner. All in all a great hotel, and would stay there again.
