This is a typical full-service Sheraton hotel with all of the expected amenities. Room was clean, modern furnishings, bathroom clean. Room service delivered on time, accurate, choices ok. All staff encountered were pleasant and helpful. This place is sometimes priced less I'm sure because of the location. It's in lower Manhattan on Canal st which is right on the edge of Chinatown with busy bootleg vendors lining the street. Nothing really to do in the neighborhood after dark.This is a good choice only if it's priced lower than similar properties, or if you have business downtown. Otherwise, this is not the best tourist-oriented hotel in Manhattan. Most of what you want to see is uptown which requires taxis and/or the subway.

Great hotel value for money great location, and staff who can't do enough for you. Needs some work in the Club lounge area.The location of the hotel is just perfect Greg shopping close by and an excellant selection of very good resturants close by. You also have the choice of three subway lines to travel up or down town.

First I have to say that the beds were great - slept well. The decor in the room needs some serious updating. The room was kept clean and refilled. Stayed at the Lounge level which is recommended. Breakfast is served on the 21st floor with a lounge area outside. Plenty of choices to eat and the view is great. Not enough info at check in

The room was extremely small and not very quiet. The noise from the street, ice machine in the hotel corridor and people talking in the hallway was easily audible inside the room. On the plus side the room was clean, internet speed was good, the AC worked well and staff were friendly. The hotel is within a half hour walk from 9-11 memorial and Whitehall terminal (Staten Island Ferry). Other attractions such as Empire State Building and Central Park are also walkable from the hotel. The price was reasonable for New York City but what I wasn't happy about was the parking situation as I believe they were untruthful about it at the time of booking (which I did through booking.com). It was stated that private parking was available at the cost of 55$ per day. But it turned out they only offer valet parking and the price is different based on the type of car you have (in our case 65$ per day for SUVs).

This hotel had good sized rooms with king sized beds and all amenities. Close to the subway. Only paid wifi in the rooms but free in the lobby. Only downside was the bathrooms which had no bench space or lid on the WC. There was a Starbucks in the lobby.

We spent 3 nights here whilst visiting Lower Manhattan. The room and bathroom had been tastefully decorated, but severely impractical. Minimal storage, just one single wardrobe, no drawers or bedside cupboards but a large desk, so we ended up living out of suitcases. The wardrobe also stored an ironing board which took up valuable space and the safe was up on the top shelf; so high that I had to stand on a chair to see what was inside as I couldn't reach it. The bed was soft but confortable. They charged 10 dollars a day for wifi, which is a rip off when you have spent so much on the room.

Before booking Sheraton, please take a word of advice, and read this review.We stayed at Sheraton Tribeca five nights this July, and chose the hotel primarily due to a good location. This was the only positive thing I can say about the hotel, besides a very helpful guy outside the hotel, who will find you a taxi in no time.First of all the room isn't at all spacious as the picture's indicating. They are very small, and with two normal sized luggage it really was a challenge to fit in the room.Secondly, the cleaning of the room was under average of what you would expect from a four star hotel. We found a belt under the curtains... A bit of an embarrassment for the cleaning service I'd say. Thirdly, and the worst thing, the indoor climate causes you red eyes and we experienced, that the ventilation system are not capable to cool down the room in the summer time, without you having a hard time with your eyes and your respiratory system. Therefore we only used the hotel room for sleeping. When confronting the hotel's service at the final day, when asking whether we enjoyed our stay, we were met with an arrogant attitude. Basically he said, that when we didn't complain from the beginning, it was our problem, not Sheraton's. On top he wasn't at all apologetic. I found that very rude. Who wants to use the vacation time to discuss with the hotel personnel about standards for a Sheraton hotel? Our advice to you - pick another hotel than this one.

Located on Canal Street just between Tribeca and SoHo. Great for Lower Manhatten visits. Friendly and helpful staff, nice rooms, good service. Good resutrants in the area, and close to the subway. Great shopping in SOHo.

From the minute I walked in, felt like I was at my second home The staff here are always fantastic trying there best to make sure you are comfortable ! Rooms are very clean and beds are super comfy... The new bar menu is so good !

The Sheraton Tribeca is close to great restaurants, the 9/11 Museum and many other lower downtown sights. Rooms are clean with the typical nice Sheraton bed. The disadvantages are minor but troublesome: rooms are tiny, even by NYC standards; lobby bar is noisy, industrial bright and just not inviting; the restaurant was closed when I was there; hotel on a very busy street with much noise.That being said, as I have business in the area, I will probably stay again but would not bring my family or stay for longer then a night or 2 at a time.

I've stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca many times, but not recently. It was really nice to return. This is a super property on a number of counts:-- Location is really wonderful -- easy walk to Tribeca and Wall Street, adjacent to SoHo and not too far from both West and Greenwich Village.-- Rooms are comfortable and clean (but not extravagant)-- Club lounge (if you have access) is fantastic, especially in warm weather as the outdoor terrace faces up the island and have amazing views-- Price is lower than most of the other Starwood properties if you are a loyal SPG guestOnly complaint is that check in area is small and often gets crowded during the peaks. Staffing usually feels short, so the wait can be quite long.Overall, this is a property that I really enjoy and look forward to returning.

We arrived for 5 nights at the Sheraton which we booked via Price Line. Price Line had erred in booking the 3 of us, my husband, 15 year old daughter and myself, in a room with only 1 king bed. The hotel didn't have any rooms available with 2 doubles so our options were to either all 3 sleep in one bed, add another room (and double our cost), or lose our 5 nights and stay somewhere else. Price Line does not refund for any reason so we were pretty much screwed. But the manager, Karim Gittings, was just amazing!!! He truly came to our rescue and saved our trip by not only getting Price Line to give us a full refund but he also arranged for us to stay in a different Sheraton near by. He was so kind and helpful - way beyond the call of duty! What would have been a really uncomfortable or really expensive 5 nights became a perfect experience because of him. We never really had a favorite hotel before but now we are all about Sheraton! Thanks again Karim!

I came to New York to complete work experience in a local veterinary surgery. The staff at this hotel are amazing and are so helpful. We would usually eat breakfast in the hotel, and the food was also perfect. I could find no fault! The room (1515) was cleaned everyday and the views from our window were just breathtaking. The neighbourhood where the hotel was situated in was good, there was lots of shops and it was very central, right next to a subway station and near bus stops. It took me a few days to get used to the madness in Chinatown, but after that, walking through it was perfectly fine. I came here with my mother as she had always wanted to go to New York, and she too agrees that this hotel was perfect for us. I would like to thank Dawn and Masavia especially for telling us about the city, like where to go etc and for making us feel so very welcome. We would chat to Masavia at the bar in the evening and he was so friendly and helpful. I would definitely be coming back to stay here if I came to New York again (which we will!)

Finding a decent hotel in NYC is like looking for a decent hotel in NYC? The Sheraton Tribeca is a great find which ticks most boxes. We arrived in the morning after sailing into New York on the Queen Mary 2 from Southampton and as such our room was not available. No great problem, they took our phone number and rang us when it was ready. The hotel is very busy so service can at times be not up to scratch but the staff explain why, which is fine. The bed was good, as was the bathroom. There was not much storage place but this is New York. We had some problems with the air con and they did try and fix it, it took a few attempts but it did improve. We were offered to move to another room but in the end it was okay. My only other concern was the poor Internet connection, but I believe the hotel is working on this. Overall a great place to stay.

The room was well appointed and although not large, not too small either. Nice amenities in the bathroom and everything that you could want - wifi, coffee maker, safe, hair dryer. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We walked to Greenwich Village a bunch of times and I felt very safe. Easy subway access to Times Square area etc. Deli next store for water and snacks. Coffee area/bar and business center in the lobby.

This 4 star hotel feels more like a 2 star. The room was small and cramped, especially for the price, and the breakfast was horrible. I was not fond of the location either. The only good thing was the service. Thankfully we spent very little time in the room. There are much better options in NY for a similar price range.

Booked hotel via Hotels.com and enjoyed a good rate at a decent hotel which was also in a good location. Easy to get to via subway from JFK and well served with the subway for connections to Penn Station, Times Square and all other points NSEW.We had a complimentary breakfast for the 4 of us (2 adults+2 kids) which was ideal and set us up well for the day.The three elevators were undergoing some maintenance which was a real pain (we were on the 11th floor, breakfast on the 21st) so using the stairs wasn't a viable alternative!!The room served a purpose as we didn't plan to spend too much time there but we had 1x King sized double and a sofa-bed (double) for our two boys which when set up left us with very little room. Our boys also complained that it was very uncomfortable. An excellent 3 night stay in NYC (first time for our sons) and would stay there again (perhaps next time without our boys).

The hotel looked nice online, but not so much in person. The street where it's located feels sketchy -- not a place you would choose to walk. Renovation work was occuring in the hotel when I stayed there -- I was shocked when I got off on my floor and saw bare floors and wires hanging along the walls. The room was average for a business hotel. Given the rate I was charged, I expected something much nicer. Just around the corner is Hilton Garden Inn -- that's probably a better choice if you need to stay in Tribeca.
user_name:
Debbie M
Decatur, Georgia, United States

review_body: We stayed at the is hotel based on its proximity to Tribeca. It is an excellent location for walking to great restaurants, bars and boutiques. By Sheraton standards I feel this hotel falls a bit flat. The staff treats everyone as if they are a clueless tourist. When we asked the gentleman who checked us in for some recommendations he directed us to a guidebook. We wanted his honest opinion, not a canned answer. The same goes for the staff in the bar and the cafe. They seemed as if they were there to do their job and didn't want to go above and beyond. This isn't what I expect from Sheraton hotels.

Location was ok, The subway was close and to different lines. But The area is not great! The hotel is not 5 star. Rooms are small but convenient. They have a Starbucks inside, lobby is small! You can walk to Chinatown and little Italy. Parking seems to be an issue.

We spent one night at this property since we had some Starwood points available to use. The front desk always seemed to be busy and the lobby is very tight. The room was very small and tight, even by New York standards for a hotel of this caliber. But it was clean and as comfortable as it could be. The bathroom had a shower stall which I liked. The bedding was comfortable. Wifi did not work at all in our room and it barely worked in the club lounge. The Internet worked only if you could plug into the cord. The street noise was a bit loud even by New York standards and for being so high in the building.The club lounge is nice although it was packed for breakfast. It has an amazing outside terrace that would be a great place for a rooftop bar but remains just a smoker hangout most of the time. The lobby bar area wasn't enticing to us as it was full of kids and people eating take out pizza.

My room was a good size and my bed was very comfortable as is expected with the Sheraton. When I checked in they told me they had upgraded me. My room was rather large for New York but when I open the window I was looking at a brick wall. I would rather have a smaller room and a better view than be looking at a brick wall 3 feet away. The reason I gave a three versus a four is I found it was rather warm in the room and I continued to turn the air conditioner down as low as 60 and it still never got cool. I talk to other people in my hotel and they had the same issue. I also had a hard time finding available taxis. Most people used Über.

The good - If you want a convenient location in New York close to 3 mtr stations and 5 minute walk to 3 different shopping districts this is the place to go .. Staff were friendly and helpful.. and the housekeeping was excellent.. The rooms were quite spacious for a hotel in Manhattan.. The bed was extremely comfortable. Every time I sat on it I just sunk into it and couldn't help myself from dozing off.. Apparently they have a patent on the bed.. Excellent view of the Manhattan skyline from roof terrace and club floors - specially rooms 18-20 on any of the club floorsThe bad - the club lounge is not what you call a club lounge if you're used to the spread you get at hotels in the east .. The club lounge served the exact same breakfast for our entire 2 week stay ( there were 3 chaffing dishes with scrambled eggs in one, bacon and sausage in one and hash browns in the other) I just didn't feel this was on par with other hotels of the same grade which offer so much more. In the evening they say they have cocktails during a certain time. And I heard a gentleman asking for a beer and he was charged separately for it unlike club lounges everywhere else in the world where everything is complementary. I had soft drinks though and they didn't charge for that. Important Note- ask the hotel the international call rates before taking a call from the room phone. We had to make an urgent overseas call that just lasted 57 seconds and were told the charge was $200 for that 57 seconds.. But the lady at the front desk was really sweet she gave us a 50% discount based on the fact that we were Spg loyalty members ..

Booked 3 rooms for a family celebration / vacation. What was not mentioned at booking or upon the 3 confirmation calls I made was that remodeling was being done in the halls starting at 8 am each morning. Looks great now, but wow, what a mess while we were there. The daily housekeeping was to say the least non existent. Floors were disgusting. Bed linens were dirty. One bed actually had the blanket and sheet pushed down to the foot of the bed only for the maid to pull the comforter over it and stack pillows on top. It sat there for 3 days...The desk, club and bar staff were very nice and courteous. The location is good close to Little Italy and Chinatown. Canal St can be a bit dicey at night... Club access is nice especially with the view however it was constantly over crowded for breakfast. We will probably chose a different hotel next trip.

We chose this hotel because it is coveniently located. It' s close to Little Italy and Chinatown and within walking distance to the World Trade Center and Brooklyn bridge.The subway station is less than a minute from the hotel.We arrived late in the evening and we were greeted by a nice lady. Check-in was fast and professional. Our room was on the 19th floor with view on the Empire State Building. It was smaller than the usual rooms at Sheraton but it was clean and we didn't expect more.Breakfast at 21st floor was good and we enjoyed sitting outside on the roof deck.The only negative point was that WIFI was slow.We would stay at Sheraton Teibeca again the next time.

Very clean and classy hotel, has the vibe of a boutique hotel with its small reception area and the coffee shop in the lobby. The room I stayed in on the 14th floor was next to the elevator and a bit on the smaller side, but impeccably clean and relatively quiet considering where it was located. You could still hear the NY noise in the background, but that comes with the territory. The street where the hotel is located - one of Chinatown's entry points - not up to par. The many street vendors and their bargain merchandise come with a lot of garbage.

Rooms were modern and clean, higher floors have great views. Club rates include breakfast, which is delicious (hot food, not just continental), access to the rooftop patio with a view, and free wifi. No pool or hot tub, but there is a fitness center. This hotel is in the ideal location for a trip to NYC!

I stayed at Sheraton Tribeca 3 nights for its close proximity to Soho and China town. Hotel room was good size and very quite.I had a corner room on club floor room was clean with very comfortable bed,pillows and nice linens.lots of shops restaurants and delis with in close proximity subway would only be 100metres away.The club lounge had a balcony with magnificent views across to Empire State Building.Breakfast was okay but nothing special but had great Starbucks coffee and plenty of variety.Staff were all friendly and courteous I would stay again.

The Hotel is located in Tribeca, not far away from a walking distance from everything in Manhattan. How far? Let's say that from Wall Street it might be 20 / 30 minutes (or so) walk - depending in your pace. The good thing is that if you like fashion you are really near or mayor stores and if you are a coffee lover you will be in the right place to move around and try different coffee stores / restaurants.When we did the check in (3 pax. adults) it was very fast and responsive. No wait at all and it only took a couple of minutes. Two room: 1 king size and 1 twin. Both in non smoking room and in my suprise I had a very nice view.Room: big, clean, comfortbale and cozy. It was very cold outside but indoors the temperature was just right.Bathroom: it had a very big bathtub with an excellent water preassure. So after a very long day after hours of walking it was perfect.Breakfast: not a big wo-ha at all. A big platterns of overcooked or cold scrammbled eggs (depending on the day), beacon, juices, fruits and more or less that's it. It's not a full scale intercontinental breakfast at all. Advice: go to one of those deli's out from the Hotel and you'll have a proper brekkie.

They were going through a renovation here but the staff upgraded our room to the club level. The hotel is on Canal street and flatiron, TriBeCa, soho, nyu, is all walking distance from here. I would recommend staying here if you like being in Soho.

I have stayed at Sheraton Tribeca NewYork for 15 Nights recently on a business trip.The location of the hotel is excellent. Very convenient for subway commuters as the hotel is very close to Canal Street Subway station. I have stayed at a higher floor and view was amazing. From my window I could see the Empire state building and the NY skyline. Thanks to the hotel staff (MAI) for allotting the room. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. I had some initial hick-ups during my stay, however its beautifully managed by the FOM Karim. A special mention to the general manager Mr Nick Amato. He is a real leader in every sense. He intervened in every highlighted issue and personally made efforts to resolve it for me.Thank you again for the wonderful experience.

Terrible. Three days of lines in lobby for an elevator. Ten minute waits on your floor. Guests taking the stairs. Housekeeping that required a phone call. Understaffed for breakfast. Every hotel has its problems but his hotel doesn't do credit to the Sheraton name.

I stayed here just over 2-3 weeks ago with a few of my friends and Overall it is a great hotel given its busy location and fairly small rooms which can, to some, be a plus. For families and business men or woman the canal section of the hotel may be a bit Aggravating! However, I would have to say that the staff here are super friendly and joyful which makes up for some of the eatablishments lackings ! The housekeeping staff could use some work. I did not Appreciate being gone for over 5 hours only to return to my room as I left it. Again, the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive! Jackie at the front desk was to sweet and Spoke with a soothing tone! Reception,also, was surprisngly Amazing. (Dewayne) he made our stay Feel as though we were at home and he was very attentive to our needs as well. Ive never been to hotel and received a welcome call and A follow up check call to see if we were ok from the reception ! I was surprised to find out he (Dewayne) was not at the front desk, but rather in the back office as reception! His personality is to big to be behind the scenes .. Management however was not around when requested but again the staff made up for what it may have been lacking .. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family visiting NY. I will be back again by end of summer! :)

I came to new york with a few friends and stayed at the sheraton hotel. During my stay, i enjoyed myself . perfect location downtown, being that i love fashion and to shop, soho was a walk away.what made my stay at the sheraton so amazing was the help i got from an employee. His name was Dewayne, he was so polite everytime i called down for help and even offered to help me order a edible arrangements for my friend what i wanted to surprise her with. i appreciate good customer service like that. i will be coming back to the sheraton next time i come back.

The hotel is in a great location for walking to downtown and Little Italy and some of the staff do their very best (the lady from Nottingham and her concierge colleague) but the hotel seemed tired - apparently a renovation programme including a new restaurant is due to start shortly.The breakfast was disappointing to say the least at $20+ each with tax for a basic buffet of scrambled egg, sausage, bacon and fried potato cubes which was not very hot or regularly replenished and on opting for the omelette option when the restaurant was virtually empty I was surprised to be told there was a 30 minute wait so we gave up and went out for brunch instead.

good short 2 day stay at hotel, much better than some of the negative reviews I have seen.park on street to check-in, so be ready for that. cars back up at check-in/out.you can self park or valet, and valet was easy to communicate options. you don't save much to self, but we did get damage to car during valet, but not do to parking but seems from other cars and people around it. also was overcharged for parking, so make sure you get a good understanding on the parking fees, as the garage is not associated with the hotel. so hard to fight the charges. (i.e. 55$ a day, was there 2 days and 2 hours. somehow got charge 43$ for 2 hours?) no mini frig in room, size of rooms what you expect in NYC.hotel and rooms were clean.Staff at front desk and baggage guys were all AWESOME! made our day when they help us out (besides the parking issue).The street was busy and never felt scared or anything walking around there....not compared to other areas in NYC for sure.less than mile from the parks and green on the waterways and the walk along to the Battery was great.food around us was plentiful, and there is a Whole Foods like a mile away as well. 9-11 Memorial is less than mile away as well.there was a subway right around the corner, but never used it as we stayed in the Soho area generally.Elevators are tight, and especially the hallway to them, so with a BOB stroller, it made things kinda tight for 3 elevators and 22 floors worth of people. no real issue, but just FYI

This hotel is a lot more modern style than what I prefer BUT I had the best experience here. Small but clean and nice rooms! Nice bar and bartenders, friendly front desk help! And a nice little bakery next door is an added advantage. Overall I had a great experience staying here! Will be a return guest if I am back in NYC.

why the hotel has pictures of sky bar when you have to pay extra if you want access, that is pure fraud. Disappointing, was looking forward to enjoy the wiev and a beer on the terrace. It will not happen, so I use my right as a customer and will never book tips hotell again

My stay at this hotel could have been the plot of a bad comedy film, Anything that could have gone wrong, did... To begin, the place told me check-in is 3 P.M., so when I arrived at 8 P.M. that evening I was quite surprised to hear that all three of the rooms my friends and I had booked were not yet ready. Once an hour (no more or less) I would check on the status of our rooms. The people at the front desk, as well as the manager, were unhelpful and outright rude. As the hours ticked by there was no discount or form of compensation offered to make up for this waiting period... not even a free bottle of water (which cost $8.00 a bottle). It was almost midnight when the rooms were ready... but two of the rooms were not adjoining as they were supposed to be. To the contrary, two rooms were on opposite sides of the floor, and one of them was on a different floor entirely. But I'm taking too long now. So let me give you a list of the other benefits of staying at this amazingly terrible establishment: the toilet in my room was broken, and the manager said my only option was to use the pubic restroom on the second floor. Another major dilemma for us was the fact that two of the pull-out beds in the couches did not work. Live insects feasted on dead insects underneath one of these couches in my friends room. Management didn't even offer an apology. You know what? There are at least four other things I could complain about, but I don't want to waste any more of my time dwelling on this nightmare. My message is simple: If you want a terrible New York City hotel experience: stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. If not, stay anywhere else.
user_name:
Brad L
Long Island, New York

review_body: By far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at in my entire life. We had booked this terrible hotel for a bachelorette party 3 months in advance and upon arrival at 8:30pm one of our two rooms was not ready and they could not provide us with another room. We had 12 girls crammed into one tiny room trying to get ready when we were already late because we were fighting with the front desk who couldn't accommodate a reservation which was booked 3 months earlier. When we got back to the hotel at 4am and finally got our room the pull out bed was broken so we had 6 girls sleeping on the floor and the toilet was broken so we had to go to the 2nd floor in the middle of the night to use the public bathroom. When we requested they comp our stay the next day they would do nothing for us! After over an hour of arguing with the hotel manager we were late to our brunch reservation. I'm not even making it sound as bad as it was, but book somewhere else I'm telling you do not go here. Try the Hudson Hotel or any other hotel in NYC DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

We go to NYC once a year, and this was our first stay in Tribeca, and it was not our favorite place to stay. There are not a lot of good restaurants nearby, and it did not feel safe at night - very empty. The hotel was fine. The lobby area is weird and not very inviting.

I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.The rooms were dirty and not cleaned properly. On the second night we discovered a cockroach in ONE OF THE BEDS, and got to change rooms in the middle of the night. As we had unpacked and were ready to get into bed, we discovered that someone had WET THE BED in the new hotelroom. Absolutely DISGUSTING! The bed was soaked and it STANK! The hotel and its housekeeping department obviously knew of this, since they had changed the bed into clean sheets, and put an extra blanket on the mattress, probably to 'soak it up'. Totally disgusting and so unprofessional, this from a hotel which portrays itself as on the more fancy side. So, once again, on the same night, we had to change rooms. The last room was not very clean either. In the end we didnt get to bed until 4 in the morning, so the day after was pretty much ruined for us.The staff were not very friendly or apologetical over this unbelivable incident. We were not offered any compensation or formal apology, but had to request a compensation ourselves. Below any acceptable standard for handling situations like this (and there were a number of different staff involved, both during the night and day, so it was not a one-off incident)We were absolutely shocked and appalled, I have stayed in numerous hotels in many countries but I HAVE NEVER experienced something like this!!DO NOT STAY AT SHERATON TRIBECA!!!!!There are lots of other hotels in New York in the same price range which are actually worth your money and time!

Celebrating my birthday with friends. Spent 4 nights in this hotel, the room was small but adequate the manager was excellent as was the bar man. We took advantage of the executive lounge which had a great view of Manhattan! Umbrellas were available and the great concierge offered us amazing advice on where to go (29th May)! The only problem was that my credit card was debited with my deposit which was not what I wanted. All in all a great experience if a wee bit squashed for 3 of us in a room!

My sister and I came down for a few days no reason Other than we both just love the city. The hotel was very nice! The people at the front desk were all so nice. At the time of booking we requested an upper room with an Empire State Building view and were told if there were some available they'd give us one and lucky for us there was! The beds were very comfortable and rooms were perfect size for us. We had no complaints at all! We loved this place! We booked the room through Priceline bidding service and saved A LOT of money, if you have the patience and willingness to do it I would highly recommend it.

Neat hotel within walking distance to China Town, Little Italy, Soho and Financial District. One of the few hotels these days with a decent executive lounge for SPG members. Has a small modern gym, a small coffee shop in lobby and a well stocked bar.

I really struggled over what rating to give. On the one hand, their staff did eventually fix a couple problems. But the fact that they caused the biggest of the problems AND the absurd lengths I had to go to get solutions just leaves me feeling like a 1 star is deserved.First, our travel agent definitely informed the hotel we would be arriving late on our first night. No one took note of that. In fact, the hotel gave away our room! So, after 30 hours of flying, we arrive smelly, worn out, just wanting a shower, and "Sorry sir, we have nothing for you." We waited 5 hours for a room to open up.Then (get this) a few weeks later I open our credit card statement to find the hotel had gone ahead and charged us for the first night! Full rack rate: more than $500! No one had informed us of this at the time we checked in. Eventually, our travel agent was able to show the hotel that they had made a mistake and they refunded it more than a month later.The third problem we had was our fault to begin. We left an item of clothing in the room. The staff said they could arrange to have it sent back, which eventually happened. So we're thankful for that. But we had to chase and chase and chase to get any action. Over more than a week we made 5 phone calls and sent several emails, being handed off to other people several times. In the end, the $12 shipping cost was much less of a cost than the hair pulled out of my scalp as I tried to find the right person who could help us. Basically, the stay was a major source of frustration. The staff there could have made it all work fine if they'd been slightly attentive to detail. Instead, we were put out in a big way. I won't stay at this hotel ever again, and I'll seriously think twice about staying at another Sheraton unless I have no other alternative.

We spent 5 days in NYC and are planning a return trip in the Spring of 2016 and will be staying here. Can't beat the location & service - close to lower Manhattan, subway, & easy to catch a cab or Uber. The hotel is clean and being on the upper floors we had no issues with noise as mentioned in one of the reviews. Our rooms were clean, beds super comfortable, plenty of pillows and a relaxing shower head with plenty of hot water. There were 4 people in our group (2 rooms). Some of us get up early and some of us sleep in so having access to the Club Lounge with a free breakfast (eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, Danish rolls, bagels, juice, fruit, coffee, tea) made it easy for the earlier risers. Plus the outside terrace has terrific views of the city. Then there are the appetizers and cash bar in the late afternoon. One of our group members has some knee issues and came back early to relax in the lounge area on 2 occasions. We really appreciated the umbrellas when it rained. Coming back to the Sheraton Tribeca after a day of sight seeing and being greeted with a smile was a plus. The staff are friendly and wanting to help you in any way they can to make your stay enjoyable.

Comfortable room, very clean and well maintained. Service was excellent,the Starbucks Coffee was great! The price per night was very competitiveand location is close to great SOHO ,TRIBECA and Little Italy restaurants.The breakfast area was under construction.Would recommend to friends and family!

Really had a great time staying here! the Hotel is in a great area - located in a typical New York setting. not too many tourists in the area which leaves it genuine and with vibrant culture. The Hotel is on the boarder of China town so you'll be surrounded with some cheaper shops as well.The hotel was great - clean and just what you need if you're a tourist out and about every day. Reception was friendly - but always only one person available to help check in or out. They have a mini starbucks in the lobby - with slow service but none the less, great to have (from 7am - 2pm.. would have been great if it was 24/7)no wifi in the rooms but they have a great lobby computer area and space if you'd like to sit down at the bar and catch up on emails. Close to subways, bus stops, star bucks, pharmacy. We asked the hotel to assist us in arranging a lift to JFK, unfortunately didn't arrive so we had to stop a cab outside. Would definitely want to go back! great stay!

The credit card of my boss was charges double and triple. I asked clearly for two double bed, but of course just get one. And they even did not wanted to give me the double bed at the reception. Sheraton you did it again and this was now. i`m booking more then 500 Nights every Year for my Team, but never never again at Sheraton. You just can not handle it! Poor, very poor!

The hotel is in a pretty reasonable location, super close to Chinatown and Little Italy. A short walk up to Greenwich Village through Soho or Chinatown / Little Italy to East Village area. Also very accessible to Downtown area being maybe just a 15 minute walk to the financial district and World Trade Centre / 9/11 Memorial. A subway station is literally around the corner which provides good access for the whole of Manhattan and beyond (Brooklyn / Queens etc). The staff I found to be very friendly and courteous and didn't have a problem with my stay. The rooms are smaller than some other hotels, but I guess this is New York so I was kind of expecting it anyway. Also you get a fair amount of a street noise in to the rooms but not enough to keep you up at night I wouldn't think, and again this is probably to be expected in such a large city.

The Sheraton Tribeca is an average big brand hotel. The location in Tribeca is great for soho and downtown NYC. It is located on busy Canal street and the Canal street subway is just round the corner.We had a deluxe double room on the 16th floor. It had a great view of the ESB; however, you could still hear traffic noise. The room was a decent size, complimentary water was supplied each day and a coffee machine with Starbucks coffee is available in the room.The room did look a bit dated, but it was functional and represented the rate spent for NYC. The bed was comfortable; however, the sheets and bed linen had a few holes in them and some of the bedding did not fit the bed properly. The bathroom was small, but the shower was good and looked like it had been recently updated.The staff were helpful and friendly. The lobby was always busy with people coming and going. Wifi was not originally included in our rate and was $9.95 extra per day. But if you join up to the loyalty program you receive free wifi.

My wife and I stayed in a larger king room for several days with two of our grown children. The room had one king-sized bed and a queen-sized sofa bed. It was a little snug but we were comfortable. Our room was quiet. The hotel is in an extremely convenient location: walking distance to Soho, TriBeCa, Chinatown, little Italy and not far from Greenwich Village and NYU. It's very close to two subway stations that can get you uptown or into Brooklyn in short order. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is a convenient business center in the lobby. The place is clean but it is more utilitarian than elegant, so if it's luxury you want look elsewhere. Nevertheless we found this a good value for a family of 4 and would stay again.

The hotel is well located (Canal street, between the Village / Tribecca and downtown areas and close to many subway stations); definetely worth getting the lounge access room. Not because of the food they offer (quite basic at breakfast - and the dely downstairs is very good) but the terrace is really nice with unobstructred views toward the north (so all major landmarks like Empire State Building, Chrystler building, the river, etc.). Make sure you don't get a room near the elevators (for some reason the engine is rather noisy) and not on the 20th floor (because you are right below the lounge and you hear people walking, moving chars, etc.). Overall, not the best hotel of this chain, though rather decent for NYC type of service. Other remarks to consider : strangely their keys stopped working several times (hopefully not because they assigned our room to other guests, it happened to me in other hotels!) and their common areas are super cold (so bring something heavy to survive the artic temperatures of the corridors and of the lounge - it was a continuous battle even to set our room temperature, we left it at 75 and every day housekeeping set it to 65!).

So, important to say that staying at the Sheraton means guaranteed comfortable bed and good pillows. With regard to this hotel:Saying it's Tribeca is pushing it. Hotel is just north of on Canal Street which is very much the "wanna buy a watch" area but safe and well positioned for subway stations to take you up or downtown and Tribeca is walking distance. Hotel itself is small as are the rooms but ok if you are not seeking a 'luxury' weekend away.. more practical traveller or business person.If you book the Executive Club (floors 21/22) you get access to the private club which means small lounge for breakfast and hors d'oeuvres on occasional evening. The 'club' leads out onto a private rooftop seating area, very pretty with lovely view of Empire State.Try Pepolino - Italian Restaurant just around the corner on West Broadway. Absolutely lovely.

I spent 2 nights here and was very happy with the hotel. It was close to walk to many attractions in NYC. The room was quite and clean. I used the free wifi and computers. They had a bar and restaurant but I didn't get a chance to use either. It looked like the bar had a good crowd in there both nights.

Lobby under construction without any warning during reservations...jack hammer was going on constantly. Rude front desk staff. No assistance to enter hotel. No assistance obtaining a taxi in front of hotel. Room small (which is fine...most NYC hotel rooms are small). Tired carpet, etc. Stay at another Sheraton and/or if you need to stay in that area...choose another hotel until it's updated. Also wrote manager...but never heard back.

Excellent location nearby major subway lines in Tribeca District. Hotel lobby spacious and clean. All staff very friendly. Room was nice size for NYC. On 2nd night stay, didn't receive room service for unknown reason. Otherwise, very comfortable.

the lounge idea is fantastic, great breakfast and the evening snacks are great. The best that you can order food from outside and have a party in the lounge with your guests and others can hang if they want. THe balcony is beautiful would love a fireplace but probabaly not up to code?

This is a nice spot, in a great location and has excellent service. I was on the 22nd floor with a great view. My room was clean and nice but nothing too fancy. I had access to the executive lounge which was definitely no frills. The breakfast was just average but the view from the outside terrace was fantastic.

The location of this hotel is convenient if you need to be at lower Manhattan. Soho and Chinatown. Wall Street is also within walking distance. We were upgraded to a room facing the Empire State Building , so that was a bonus. We stayed on the club floor which had complimentary meals. I love the bed the most. Very very comfortable....wished I had one exactly the same at home. The service staff from the front desk to the concierge were all excellent.

If this hotel were anywhere but Tribeca/NYC I would never come back. Rooms are TINY and the hotel itself is amazingly squeezed between 2 buildings. The service was good the building/amenities were meh. However, that being said I would come back here. The raters were reasonable for NYC especially for a last minute trip. I would point out that this hotel is right next to China town and that should be noted. To one side of the hotel is charming Tribeca, but to the other is the outskirts of China town which to say the least was not pleasant or charming.

Have stayed here twice purely because business trip. Have had club lounge access each time - enquire about this when you book. This gives you acces to club lounge on 21st floor where there are soft drinks and hit drinks available all day; breakfast in the morning and light supper served from 5:30pm onwards. There is also access to a roof terrace where you get an amazing view of the Empire State Building and there are comfy chairs and tables to sit at - amazing during the day, stunning at night. Our room was on 20th floor so had amazing views of NYC and the sun coming up. Some negatives - lifts seem to take forever at certain times of the day; key card for our room seemed to stop working every other day; although room was cleaned properly everyday they did not always replenish loo roll and tissues!! The light supper available was taken advantage of by some guests (this is out of control of hotel I guess) but most evenings I saw guests filling up their plates several times thus food running out for other guests who came up later. There is a small but adequate gym on floor 2 and wifi in the rooms. Like the lifts - at certain times of the day it was slow or almost impossible to get on to. The hotel is in a good location in TriBeCa and the staff are amazing - the staff in the club lounge really are lovely. I'd recommend this hotel and am happy to stay here again and again.

This is really between 3 and 4 stars, but trying to be generous. As I mentioned several times in my reviews, Sheraton is the most dated and least interesting of Starwood brands, IMHO. This one is not exception. Good location in Tribeca, close to Metro station. Fairly elegant lobby and common areas, not much of the room. Fairly tired dated décor, small room. Somehow my deluxe room was more of standard NYC size room, and had weird hole in the door. I am SPG Gold Member, and stayed in many properties, including NYC. My expectations are pretty low for $320 per night room, so it matched my expectations, and even exceeded some with pleasant cheerful staff, great bartender, and generally nice atmosphere. My room had good view too towards Empire State Building. Will stay again, if have business in lower Manhattan or Midtown, and if the rate is right.

Yes the location is good, unless of course your room faces Canal Street where there are honking cars 24/7 due to the entrance to the tunnel. Traffic there is a beast so if you want to catch a cab or Uber, you need to walk several blocks to get away from the madness.The rooms are meh. The housekeeping was particularly lax. For example we told them not to change our sheets every night (green option) but they chose to not even make the bed. Weird. We stayed 4 nights and every night they would forget to replace towels they took away, or supplies that needed replenishing, so we would have to ask every day.There were big bags of trash in the hallways every day/night that sometimes weren't removed until the next day. Room service trays were left outside for too long in the hallways too. The elevators are super slow. Can't tell if the walls were thin because we had so much honking it drowned out anything else. It didn't feel clean or fresh at all, but again the location is good and perhaps the price is competitive but overall it's just meh.

The bed was amazing! As comfortable as my bed at home...The hotel was clean and staff courteous. They allowed us a late check-out (1pm) without penalty. The only unfortunate thing was the view out of our window... but if you request a higher floor (we were on the 7th floor) your view will probably improve.

The hotel rooms are always small in NYC but why shouldn't they be you are going to be out playing in the city. So as far as hotels go this one is very good.Location is by financial district and shopping in Soho and East Village.The train is close to take you up and over to Brooklyn if needed.A lot of good restaurants and bars up a couple of blocks.The staff is very nice and helpful. Book it. You'll be good.

Great location, to the right you can get to China Town and Little Italy, if you go up, you have a nice zone of restaurants and stores. Metro station, is literaly around the corner. Room was clean, bed comfortable and service was good.
user_location: Province of San Jose, Costa Rica
user_name:
Luis Diego C
Province of San Jose, Costa Rica

review_body: Dirty hotel. From pictures that I had attached you can see that the sheets, which are covering the mattress are so dirty, that shades of brown and yellow are clearly seen. Once you tell them and ask to be fixed, it takes one day for housekeeping to find their way to your room, and at the end they say that the down sheets are not their responsibility but other department, and they can change the blankets only.If you ask for cleaning today, you will get it on the next day.The area is not recommended for tourists.Also if you book and pay for a club room, most probably you will get a standard room. And they will argue long enough with you, until they find their mistake. (Days!) Also if you have paid internet in your printed reservation, they will spend time arguing with you that you do not have. Again, until they found out, that they are wrong, and finally give you an access code.The more "experienced" male staff seems to lack basic courteous manners as greeting, or even nodding; they answer questions without checking in the system; poor communication between the departments;However, if you happen to be stuck there – the only people who can actually fix part of your stay, and are trustworthy - are Jacky from FO, and Carlos from Concierge;

Staff at Sheraton were very helpful and friendly. They provided us with free WiFi service throughout our 4 days stay with them because I am a Starwood member. Concierge are always helpful and would go out of their way to ensure we're comfortable. Location was great, so close to SoHo and Chinatown, we were pretty sorted with food and shopping. Only can be improved with faster and continous wifi service

This is a beautiful hotel, only the location is less than ideal, since it is on Canal Street. We stayed here to visit NYU with our daughter. It's amazing how you can walk 2-3 blocks and be in a totally different world in New York City. What a contrast between the seediness of Canal Street and the beautiful serenity of Greenwich Village! Regardless, the hotel is new-feeling, and reasonable. We had free internet, and really enjoyed the comfortable beds! Overall, great hotel in less than perfect setting...!

And that you were happy? And didn't make up excuses like "no rooms are ready" and "you can't have that because . . ."?Well, it's still like that at the Sheraton Tribeca. Great staff, goes out of their way to accommodate you. They might even overhear you referring to a birthday or anniversary and send something to your room, unbidden.Sure the rooms are small, but it's New York, darnit. And the open air roof top on a warm summer evening is a terrific place to unwind.

I stayed there for 3 nights with my mum and aunt for a long weekend in NY. The initial welcome at the desk was very good and the happy hour at the bar was good value (although I'm not sure that the 'dirty martini' was quite to my taste!!). Staff were on the whole friendly and there's free wi-fi in the whole hotel. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but instead opted to go out each morning, The location was excellent - within easy walking distance of 3 subway lines. Although Canal Street seems a bit edgy at night (I certainly wouldn't walk around after dark on my own) it was only across the road from the SoHo district, where there are excellent restaurants. I would definitely stay in this area next time I visit.

This was a great hotel if you like modern. Very modern. Nice with lots of amenities, friendly staff, nice location in TriBeCa, close to SoHo. Restaurant had good food. Nice little deli/store right next door, convenient. My room was pretty quiet.

The hotel itself was very good, the front desk was friendly and helpful.Rooms are nice and clean, although there was no minibar at the room.Nice internet center and free WiFi at the lobby, but you have to pay for internet in the room.The location of the hotel is not very good though, it is not very nice place to walk outside at nights.pretty close to the financial district and 911 memorial, pretty far from times square and the uptown.Overall experience was good, it is a good option to stay in manhattan in a reasonable price.

We stayed 2 nights and had a room on the 20th floor with a good view on the Empire State Building.The room was a good size for NY,a little bit outdated, comfortable bed, clean bathroom.The lounge had a great view , breakfast there was ok.The staff was welcoming.Canal St is not very nice but a short walk take you to great shops and restaurant in Soho.

The location is great! Walking distance to Greenwich Village /West village, also walking distance to the lower east side. Very accessible by subway. Chinatown and Little Italy are around the corner and so is shopping on SoHo. Room is about average for NYC hotels. Bathroom is very clean and rooms are clean. Great hotel and staff are friendly especially the bellman. If you are a SPG member, WiFi in the room is complimentary and they also moved us to a higher floor. Will definitely return!

This Sheraton in the heart of Tribeca district is not that big but more than perfect. The rooms have a normal NY size, a bit outdated , wonderful bed and a small but clean bathroom with shower. I had a room on the 2nd floor with a patio. There are only 4 rooms in this hotel with a patio but it’s well worth the money. Breakfast is perfect, bar is nice and staff is more than friendly. Applause for the doorman, what a great service finding me a driver with the impossible mission bringing me to JFK within the hour in rush-hour! I will definitely stay in this hotel again

My fiancé and I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a wedding in Greenwich Village and a reception in Tribeca. For getting around the City, the location is unbeatable - right near the Canal Street subway stop, so an easy ride up to the Village, Fifth Avenue, Times Square/Broadway, and Central Park. For first-time visitors to the City (which I am not), it's close enough to Times Square, etc. to be convenient, but far enough from the crazy crush of crowds. The hotel is tastefully decorated with old photos of the City, but our room was extremely small, which is to be expected in NYC. For some, the price point at over $220 per night (a wedding rate) may not justify the small room (i.e., the bathroom had narrow, french-style doors that opened inward, leaving little space between the shower, toilet, and vanity; most storage space was in the closest at the end of a small hallway opening up onto the bed and the desk area). That being said, we requested a room with a City view (and got a one!) and so the architecture of the building may have required a smaller room. The hotel staff was kind and accommodating, and the open-area business center and Starbucks in the lobby are convenient. With the great service and location, we'd definitely stay at the Sheraton Tribeca again.

Standard Sheraton fare. Pricey but I guess that's just the location.Reasonable sized rooms, plenty of storage space. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Lack of attention to detail in the room though i.e. only decaf coffee initially available (like alcohol free beer, this should be a crime).

Spent four nights here, and had a pleasant stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was on the small side but clean , and quiet between rooms, though a lot of noise came in from the corridor and outside. But it is in New York after all. Handy to Metros on Canal Street, China Town and Little Italy. Would stay here again

I brought my hubby with me on this business trip and he loved the hotel and their location was prime. The only thing that was disappointing was that there was one little girl working the front desk. There were people around who were all speaking different languages and they really needed at least 4 people working the front desk.

Stayed here two weekends ago and it was very unsatisfactory. I had pre-requested a quiet room away from elevators and vending machines and they booked me into a room that was supposed to be a king with a small couch and sitting area. HOWEVER, the desk person gave us a teeny tiny room, valued at much less than what I was charged. I requested a room change and they took me to a room that that was exactly what I had specifically asked NOT to get- a room between a vending machine and the elevators. The desk staff were pleasant and a manager said all their rooms with King and vouch we're in the same location, so I noted that they need to train their staff better so this mistake isn't made again. We were offered a third room, somewhat bigger than the first room for less money that what we had originally booked, which was better. The manager was supposed to adjust the price for the two nights, and this was not done. Don't stay here. Had a great experience at the James a few years ago, a block away, and if he I need to be in TriBeCa, I'd head there next time.
user_name:
J H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Perfect location for a pit-stop back to my second home. The hotel met all my needs and they were attentive without being overbearing. Room service was polite, efficient and hit the spot after a long flight. I'd probably use again if I need to be back in that neck of the woods.

I stayed in this hotel in November 2014 for business .. First night had problem with shower tub it was blocked and when I tried to open there was so much dirt was coming out off it, was disgusting anyhow call the maintenance and it got sorted out ..And here is the next morning got up at 6 am wanted to go up to my friends room at 11th floor .. Got onto the elevator ıt got stuck and was so scary trıed to bang the doors was so darlk ınsıde could not find the emergency button anyhow after 15 minutes off crying and screaming someone heard me .. But the funny thing is have no apologizes from the hotel staff what so ever .. It's bloody ridiculous .. I never ever go back there again .. One of the worst business hotels I have ever stayed in !!!

I usually stay here when in NYC on business. Not the nicest part of town but with a quick walk or subway ride you can get almost anywhere in Manhattan quickly. Staff is very nice and helpful. Rooms are nicely appointed and beds are comfy and clean. And that is really what matters when traveling on business.

This hotel was very convenient for me on a recent trip to NYC. I was able to walk just a few steps to catch the A/C/E subway to head uptown to visit Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, Central Park etc.. and I was able to use that same station to get further downtown to visit the 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park, Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island. It was just a quick walk up Canal Street to catch the 6 train to Grand Central. Aside from easy public transit access, the area was great- lots of shopping in Soho. The hotel was clean, and staff was friendly. I'd stay again if in the area.

Excellent service from staff and concierige with personal touch and good city knowlegde giving great advice. Many thanks to Shanekqwa who organised the fantastic seats at Broadway show and good price and the ease of being able to collect the tickets without having to go to the theatre and queue up.

Drove in from CT to spend the day and night in NYC. We got in around noon and Milly greased us at the front desk she was able to give us an early check in which made our day she Was helpful and a pure delight. This is a great location as you are close to little Italy, the village and soho, tine a and nolita. Our room was clean some reviews said the rooms were small and it wasn't a shoe box but it wasn't too small for 2 people We weren't there to stay in the room all day. So we would definitely stay here again

this hotel is an amazing find in a difficult location. The price is reasonable, it is clean, friendly and offers amenities. For a room with breakfast, the fare is eggs and bacon along with cereals and pastries. Also, free wi-fi. I have a pet peeve in that it seems to me that the most expensive hotels charge the most for wi-fi, I guess because they can. So I am delighted when I get free wi-fi.

We recently stayed here, two stays in two weeks. The location is great and the staff is incredibly helpful. I'm sure that they see hundreds of new faces weekly, but I was recognized by several staff members, which was really nice. Each room we stayed in was clean and comfortable. Walking distance to great restaurants and shops. Loved it!

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca recently and found it to be very pleasant with a hard working and friendly staff. Wonderful bar/lobby area and business center. Very clean and upgraded room, a little small , but hey, we were in New York. Bathroom could use two things: a) a shower that you can turn on without having to be IN the shower (but water heats up quickly) and of course b) the hotel bathroom fan that is not connected to the main light. Who needs the extra noise in New York? Other than that the place is great and priced well for the big apple. Staff is exceptional.

Very helpful concierge, Shaneqwa, who gave me great information and encouragement to take the subway to see Mamma Mia on Broadway. Also I was within walking distance to go to the IFC Center. Hotel was in a good part of Manhattan, room was nice and comfortable, and the rate was good, too.

Good location, just next to the Canal St. subway station, the room was clean and well sized compared to New York hotels. However, the reception was occupied only by a single person while the other employees playing with a dog those making a 10 minutes wait in one and the reception lady (Lorenna) was coding the key to the wrong room, which led me to open a room with a sleeping person... Yep, that great. Oh and she would argue with me for 5 minutes not believing the customer... ("Your key is correct sir, you have the problem...")If they change the the staff, would recommend the place, if not, be sure to double check your key ;-)

Spent two nights here and it wasn't a bad experience. The location is great. Broadway and Canal roads are round the corner. Likewise China town and Little Italy. Hop off, Hop on tour bus around New York stops on the corner of Broadway. Small hotel bar has great chicken wings.

It is a good hotel not fancy but good enough. Room is big enough and clean. Breakfast is poor but who cares. Metro station is arround The corner. You can walk to Soho. Staff is The best part of The hotel. Specially David Tom Bell/Door man. Believe me he is your man. If you have any question in your mind ask him. Even if he has not The answers he knows some one to solve the problem.

A central location for Tribeca. Staff was positive and upbeat with every greeting. Small hotel bar, yet did the trick. Lounge on 21st floor had great views uptown. Room was clean with plenty of room - couch, table and chair. Elevator was a bit painful to use.

Stayed here for 3 nights as a change from uptown. Good location within walking distance of 9/11 Memorial Museum and downtown. Next to SOHO so lots of restaurants nearby. Hotel was efficient and comfortable and reasonably priced (for NY). Asked for a higher room with a view and they moved us up on the second day which was good. Room was smallish (Kingsize double. - the 2 Queen sized one we had first was bigger) but well appointed with lots of chargers and lights. Breakfast was a little dull - no exuberance about it (like real cheese or proper rolls) but had standard scrambled egg, sausage and bacon. All in all, would recommend for a downtown base.

I stayed for a night early November for one day.The hotel is reasonably close to the subway and is couple of mins walk away from the Canal St stop.The check-in was fine and I did not have too many requests to the service staff. The room was adequate for the price. You can walk around a bit to reach surrounding village, china town etc.I came back late night at around 2 AM and took a taxi back to the hotel.For the price, the neighborhood and the rooms, this hotel is just about average.With humongous number of hotels available in Manhattan, there are lot of other options which provide more bang for the buck.

We wanted to go into NYC for the weekend (to get out of our snow covered yard!) and wanted to stay somewhere not in Times Square. A friend recommended this hotel and we just loved it. It was easy to get to and from the moment we checked in we felt welcomed and taken care of. The room was spacious, the bathroom was modern and water pressure was Great!But the best part of the stay was that we accidentally left a purchase from SoHo in the room and didn't realize it until the day after we checked out. We called the hotel and believe it or not, the housekeeper had turned the purchase into lost & found (we were shocked!) and they are sending it back to us today! I wish I could thank our housekeeper personally for this honesty. I think we'll have to go back again just so we can do that!Thank you!!

Anytime I see a hotel mattress concaving in, I get worried about its freshness, cleanliness and overall condition. This is precisely what I saw at Sheraton Tribeca. In addition to the mattress condition, the room carpet looked quite old. I would expect better standards from Sheraton. I had a a very tough time finding taxi from outside this hotel... Unlike some of the other hotels, this is not a place where you can find taxis easily.. AND if it rains or snows, good luck with your taxi hunt.

We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights while we were doing some renovations. The first night we unfortunately were in a room next to loud, drunk people and the bed was a little mushy (room 1815). The staff at the hotel was great and moved us the next night. The new room was at the end of the hall and was quiet and the bed was great. (room 920)The room was spacious enough. (NYC hotels rooms tend to be smaller)The hotel is located just on the border of tribeca and soho. It's on Canal Street which isn't the best, however a two minute walk north or south puts you in a much better area. All in all, we had a positive experience.

Just came back from NY for an annual meeting This hotel is a walking distance from our company in NYThe front desk Lewis is excellent. He listen to you and try to accommodate you when selecting your room Fery runs quickly when my colleague forgot her keys in her room and run a bit faster to unlock my safety box because I completely forgot my number When asking him for a taxi he literally stands in the street to find you a cab!! Great service Fery!!! Thank you The staff at the breakfast are very smiling and helpfulThe room is very comfortable and clean the bed is a little dream I slept like baby!!!The bathroom is a bit small but very convenient when staying alone in your room lots of towels and amenities I'm happy with this hotel and I hope to comeback next year!!!

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca November 2014 . It is a convenient location to visit Manhattan... Traffic and drop off areas are an issue but overall the location is great...Subway around the corner a few eateries worth the visit nearby.Contemporary hotel small reception and common areas due probably to the footprint.While the experience was good overall, the ground floor bar was a disappointment. Little if no service unless you sat at the bar counter.... It did not bother us there are plenty of great bars and restaurants all over NYC....

The location for this hotel is excellent - two blocks away from a subway station, near great restaurants and shops. The hotel is so-so, however the rooms are EXTREMELY small. There was no really hot water in the shower (only warm water), and at some points it was cold to the extent you could not even shower. The price paid per night was ridiculous, if you consider there was no hot water and the size of the room. Breakfast was very expensive and not good at all, you better have breakfast in the small store next to the hotel... it is cheaper and much better.

Stayed at this hotel for one night (Saturday). Check in staff extremely friendly and helpful. Room small but not tight. Clean and bed exceptionally comfortable. But... Breakfast!? Came down to restaurant Sunday morning at 9:30am. No staff in sight. No hot beverages in sight. Meager assortment of breads. My partner had a croissant which was stale. Scrambled eggs synthetic. I had to go to reception to ask where the restaurant staff was. 9:40 first sign of server. 9:45 I was at last served my hot tea, but I was not given any choice of tea! I asked if there was a any fresh bread available, 10 minutes later "fresh" bread/pastries brought out, but croissants still stale. Bottom line: good place to stay in Tribeca. Excellent value. But lousy place to start your day.

I had to come to NYC for work, and since I am a SPG guy, I chose to stay at Sheraton Tribeca because they had the most competitive rates and I have a budget I have to manage. The location is good, the staff was great but my room was less than desirable.The phones in the room didnt work, so when I needed the front desk, etc, I had to walk down stairs. The room itself was not clean. There were scrapes and scratches all over the walls.....even on the ceiling above the armoire - looked as though a previous guest had a shoe or suitcase throwing contest. I had a room with double beds and one of the beds comforters had yellow stains on it. Needless to say I slept in the other bed.All in all, this place was average at best, but I will say that David, the bell hop/taxi hailer is top notch. One of the best I have ever seen. Willing to help everyone and treated EVERYONE like they were the most important guest.I would stay here again if I had to, but the rooms (decor) are a bit long in the tooth and are due for a much needed update.

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a week in February (during freezing cold temperatures all week in New York!) and overall were really pleased with the hotel.I chose the Sheraton Tribeca predominantly for its close proximity to subway lines (there are 3 different lines within a few minutes walking distance on Canal Street) and knowing that we'd be spending time all over Manhattan, Brooklyn, and also needing to get to Long Island. For this, the location was fantastic.We stayed on the club floor, level 22, and had a large (by NYC standards) room with a big window that looked out onto East Manhattan. The room was comfortable and more than fine for a week long stay. The club floor stay also provided access to the club lounge, with complimentary breakfast and evening appetizers each day. The breakfast didn't change through the week (bacon, potatoes, scrambled eggs) and fruit options were very minimal. More variety over the days would have been good, especially as the hotel increased in busyness as the week went on but breakfast provisions didn't seem to match this increase. Tribeca Bagels right next door to the hotel is good for a quick breakfast.Staff were friendly, our heating worked, and overall we had a great stay. Highly recommend if you're looking for something not in Midtown, but still with plenty of options nearby for things to do and close by to all the subway lines you could need!

My wife and I took a last minute weekend trip to NYC and found a great package deal for flight and hotel that included the Sheraton. We stay at Sheratons a lot and really haven't found one that has disappointed us yet... The Sheraton Tribeca was no different... The staff was great and the check-in process was quick and easy... and the room was nice and clean... It is a New York hotel so the rooms aren't huge but they are set up to maximize the space. Everything was clean and well taken care of.The location was perfect... lots of cool spots close by and the hotel is right in the middle of multiple train stations that can get you anywhere pretty quick... It was cold the weekend we went so getting to the train quick was a really good thing! They have a pretty cool interactive kiosk in the lobby that can help you research and get just about anywhere... and a lot of the main NYC "must sees" are one train ride away.Catching a cab away from the hotel was the only challenge we found and we only needed to do that on the way to the airport so it wasn't a big deal.We will be back in NYC in the Spring and we'll be staying here again for sure!

I've only checked in a few hours ago. Great service on that point. Nice staff, very accommodating. Seems like a nice bar, all looks good. But then we want to order a movie in the room, and there is no on demand?? What is going on, aren't we in 2015? I'm watching cable tv, I can do that at home.. Come on Sheraton, we expect more, and pay for movies anyway, so why don't you have them?

I just stayed x5 nights at the Sheraton in Tribeca. I am a Platinum member and have been for 5 years. Clean hotel...... But don't tell me that over a weekend you were NOT prepared with your breakfast food because of the amount of guests? really??? It's NYC there are bagels every where, food,hot water for tea,coffee makers were not working, did not have any bottled water all Sunday. There were NO snacks in the the evenings ( fruit,granola bars,nuts etc) This was one of the worst Club rooms I have ever stayed at. Talked to the asst. manager and I got a sorry and 5000 point? Sorry Starwood that doesn't cut it in the frequent travelers world... I'm not a hotel Diva, but I expect what you promise. I will never stay here again and I stay at Sheratons all over the U.S. Also this area is located on Canal street... I got more than sick of the pushy street vendors in my face pushing the counterfeit purses and watches...ugh!

The neighborhood TriBeCa is super nice and close to everything. This specific hotel is located just by a not very nice street. The last 200 feet before reaching the hotel felt a bit unsafe. The overall hotel service/standard was just fine and as can be expected by Sheraton

I recently tryed to book this hotel and I called and emailed hotel to make sure all was fine and booking was confirmed ,1 month later when I got credit card statement I realised this information was incorrect I called and was told several reasons why it didn't go through When I questioned the new rates and asked if my rate could be reviewed as I am now paying a lot more the hotel cancelled the booking and didn't even offer an apology for the misinformation I was given

That's a very nice hotel. I'm so pleased to stayed there. The reception service was brilliant! The only thing I wasn't happy was the service room because took a long time to change our bed sheets ! Ones I was there for 12 days. And other thing wasn't good was the breakfast ours something was missed!

1-heating: In three day it never worked. 2 of the technical staff came to fix it without success. 2- internet Wi-Fi: very slow, sometimes never worked at all3- restaurant downstairs closed for a big part of the day.3-elevators! Always packed of people! two because the 3rd was broken. Only the sight from my room was great

First time back in NYC in 10 years.Have to say I am still shocked at how on the whole service is so crap in the US - all superficial and the Sheraton exemplified this! BUT I will say the front desk staff were pleasant enough although really did not listen to what people were saying to them!Room was not clean - a paid of socks abandoned on the floor from previous occupants.Club Lounge frankly a joke - come on guys if you are going to have a lounge staff it with people who do not talk drivel to each other constantly.The lifts (elevators) are a JOKE! Kept running into people in the lifts desperately trying to use their key card to access their floor but failing! I had a 50% failure rate!Location on Canal St was OK if you did not walk along towards the Subway Stations, frankly quite disgusting, but if you headed north into SOHO the area is better.You get what you pay for. Would I stay here again, no!I am an SPG Platinum member and spend a third of the year in hotels.

Came to NY for a business trip. Stayed at Sheraton Tribeca for a Scholastic Meeting am not from NY and the people were great help!!! Made me feel at home and hoped get cabs and helped me get around. Very friendly and helpful

This hotel was in a great location with a subway stop very close by. The hotel is close to china town and little italy. The food around here was fantastic. The hotel staff were very helpful. The bar staff were great. I would stay here again even though I wasn't wowed by the rooms. However the rooms were clean, and functional. Nice bathroom e.t.c Comfortable bed. But the location was the right location for me personally as I would not want to stay around Times square. I would definately advise going on the Mob Tour. So interesting! And if you go out the hotel, turn right, then another right there are two bars which were very much a "locals" bar. Great vibe, and fab cocktails.

Here for three nights with several colleagues on a business trip.The staff were super friendly, helpful and efficient. I really liked them, from the bell desk folk to reception and check in to room service staff. Sheraton must be getting their training spot on.However, the rooms are absolutely soul-less. Functional, old with dirty curtains . I always check curtains, they say a lot.Really, I doubt I will stay here again because of the look and feel of the rooms. Quality of room service food is also very, very mediocre with minimal decent vegetarian options.This is like an old and fading two star hotel without the charm!
user_name:
fathimad
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: While the staff were all very sweet and attentive, the hotel misses the boat when trying to meet the standards of a Sheraton. The hallway carpets were tattered and frayed, the room had paint cracking and worn carpet as well, and the food in the lounge matched that of a Hampton Inn, or something similar. The bathroom was relatively clean, although there was hair in the shower. The bed met Sheraton's standards, as did the crisp, fresh linens, so that was great. Also, there is NOTHING fun or attractive about the immediately surrounding area. You do have a short walk to China Town, about five blocks, but that's about all that appealing. To end on a strong point, the hotel is just two blocks from the subway.

What a great hotel. I have stayed at other hotels in New York before and have been disappointed, but this experience was the complete opposite. The location is perfect for exploring the city, being just 5 minutes walk (at most) to the Canal Street subway stations. One of these also links to JFK so very easy to get to and from the airport. From first check in to leaving we could not fault the hotel. Swift check in and subsequent friendly assistance (thanks Lenora) and fantastic communication with Nick Amato. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Club room on the 20th floor with amazing uptown views to the Empire State Building, breakfast included in the 21st floor club room etc. Lovely room. Nice bar and restaurant areas on the ground floor. Really good cocktail bar/restaurant just round the corner in Church Street (Macao). Just a perfect stay in a perfect hotel. Book this hotel, you won't be disappointed!

My stay was nice but they lost my bag with all kids' clothes. I am trying to get in touch with NicholasThe GM but he does not answer my requests. After 2 weeks I left the hotel I am waiting for a call!!!! They said they really lost the bag. I am waiting.

We flew into new York for the start of our adventure . Basically dumped our bags and spent most of the day exploring. We covered lots of things and came back to the hotel then went out to dinner.We had a recommendation from the concierge for dinner and ended up at a lovely Italian restaurant where we were the last to leave talking to the staff.

I could not wrap my mind around this location. It's literally on Canal right in front of the Holland Tunnel. It's almost like staying on a highway off ramp. The marquee is very subtle so many a cab almost passed it right up. Walking down Canal is a special kind of torture.
